translated: They grasp the feeling aggregate as belonging to the self, thinking that they experience the feeling that is the maturation of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

analyzed: de la bde ba myong ba ni las dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'o //

original: sdug bsngal ni las mi dge ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni las mi dge ba rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni gnyi ga'i'o //

original: 'dir ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dar mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms nyid yang dag par na las kyi rnam par smin pa ste /

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the store consciousness itself is the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ni rnam par smin pa las 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin par gdags pa'o //

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la bdag tu 'du shes pa'i sgo nas tha snyad 'dogs par byed do snyam du 'du shes kyi phung po la bdag gir 'dzin to //

translated: He thinks that the aggregate of consciousness is the self, because the self is the one who imputes names in regard to objects that are seen, heard, distinguished, and known.

original: bdag tu 'dod pa'i sems ni 'du byed rnams kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa la 'jug par byed pas 'du byed kyi phung po la bdag gir 'dzin te /

translated: He thinks that the aggregate of karmic predispositions is the self, because the mind that is the object of the notion of self is caused to engage in virtue, sin, etc., by the karmic predispositions.

original: phung po ni lnga kho na'o //
analyzed: phung po ni lnga kho na'o //

original: 'o na phung po rnams kyi go rims 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na phung po rnams kyi go rims 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: ji ltar rags pa'i rim bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rags pa'i rim bzhin te /

original: de la gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i gnas su gyur pa dang / rnam par shes pa drug gi yul yin pa'i phyir thams cad pas ches rags te /

analyzed: de bas na gzugs dang por brjod do //

analyzed: nga'i klad par tshor ro zhes rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir yul yongs su chad pas de nyid la brjod kyi /

original: 'du shes la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for perception, etc.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi 'og tu @197a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi 'og tu @197a * //
translated: Therefore, after form,

original: 'du byed ni 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas khong du chud par sla ba'i phyir /üîΩrnam par shes pa las ches rags so //
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas khong du chud par sla ba'i phyir / rnam par shes pa las ches rags so //
translated: because it is easier to understand that formations have the characteristic of formation.

original: rnam par shes pa ni thams cad pas phra ba'i phyir kun gyi tha mar brjod do //üîΩde la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni thams cad pas phra ba'i phyir kun gyi tha mar brjod do // de la gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa'am /
translated: It is said that the aggregate of consciousness is the most subtle of all because it is the most difficult to understand.üîΩThe aggregate of form is the most coarse of all because it is the easiest to understand.üîΩThe aggregate of form is the most coarse of all because it is the easiest to understand.üîΩThe aggregate of consciousness is the most subtle of all because it is the most difficult to understand.üîΩIn this context, the term ‚Äúaggregate of form‚Äù is a common locus for the aggregates of feeling, conception, formations, and consciousness.

original: de'i skyes bu'i phyir zhes bya bar 'gyur grang na /üîΩgzhi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i skyes bu'i phyir zhes bya bar 'gyur grang na / gzhi mthun pa ni ma yin te /

original: phung po rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a common locus because the aggregates do not exist as real substances.

original: gang gi phyir phung po'i sgra spungs ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i tshig yin pa de'i phyir phung po rnams ni spungs pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po'i sgra spungs ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i tshig yin pa de'i phyir phung po rnams ni spungs pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir na gzhi mthun pa nyid med do //

original: de'i skyes bu'i phyir yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i skyes bu'i phyir yang mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: lha sbyin gyi zhang po zhes bya ba lta bu yin la /
translated: For example, Devadatta‚Äôs uncle.

analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i kyi  'di ni 'brel ba'i don yang yin pas gzugs las phung po gzhan nyid du 'gyur na /

analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa la yang drug pa mthong ste /

analyzed: gzugs su byas pa ni lus las gzhan ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir de'i skyes bu'i kyi  nyid do //

analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na /

translated: It is related,

original: phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the aggregates are essenceless.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid brjod pas ni dmigs kyis dbye bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid brjod pas ni dmigs kyis dbye bar mi nus kyi /
translated: Since their essence is not expressed, they cannot be distinguished by implication.

original: 'on kyang de'i rten dmigs kyis phye bas 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rten dmigs kyis phye bas 'gyur te /
translated: However, they can be distinguished by implication through their basis.

original: de'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes 'dri'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes 'dri'i /
translated: Therefore, the question, ‚ÄúWhat is form?‚Äù is asked,

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ‚ÄúWhat is the form aggregate?‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gzugs kyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gzugs kyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the classification of form in terms of cause and effect,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe four great elements and form derived from the four great elements.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po bzhi po thams cad ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po bzhi po thams cad ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: Thus, all four great elements are the cause of all form derived from the elements.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: All derivative form is the effect of the great elements.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi chen po ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad kyi rten yin pas gtos che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi chen po ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad kyi rten yin pas gtos che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great elements are great because they are the support of all derivative form, since they are the most extensive.

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa thams cad la srab la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa thams cad la srab la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Or, they are great because all form, etc., are included in them, since they are the coarsest.

original: gnas pa tha gru che ba'i phyir chen po'o //
analyzed: gnas pa tha gru che ba'i phyir chen po'o //
translated: Or, they are great because they are the basis of the extensive, since they are the basis of the extensive, i.e., the great, four continents.

original: de dag gi 'byung ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs sna tshogs 'grub pa na de dang de dag gi rnam par 'byung bas 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi 'byung ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs sna tshogs 'grub pa na de dang de dag gi rnam par 'byung bas 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: They are elements because they are the source of various derivative form, since they are the source of this and that derivative form.

original: yang na sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas nam yang ma byung ba ma myong bas 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: yang na sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas nam yang ma byung ba ma myong bas 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: Or, they are elements because they are the source of all sentient beings, since they have never been nonexistent in beginningless samsara through the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag la yang 'byung ba nyid thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang 'byung ba nyid thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not the case that other things are also elements,

original: ming grags pa yin pas sa steng nyal la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ming grags pa yin pas sa steng nyal la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because the term element is well known to refer to earth, water, fire, and wind, just as the term bed is well known to refer to a sleeping mat, etc.

original: de dag ni bzhi kho na ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bzhi kho na ste /
translated: They are only four in number,

original: mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mang ba'am nyung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mang ba'am nyung ba ma yin no //
translated: because it would follow that there would be more or less if they were not.

original: 'byung ba'i bya ba ni brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / skyod par byed pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bya ba ni brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / skyod par byed pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The function of the primary elements is merely to support, to attract, to mature, and to expand.

original: de dag nyid kyis de'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang / bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag ni bzhi kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis de'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang / bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag ni bzhi kho na'o //
translated: The function of the primary elements is complete with just those functions, and there is no other function.

original: brten pa la sogs pa bzhin du nam mkha'i bya ba ni go 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: brten pa la sogs pa bzhin du nam mkha'i bya ba ni go 'byed pa yin te /
translated: The function of space is to provide room, like the function of a container.

original: de yang nam mkhas byed pas na sa la sogs ba bzhin du nam mkha' yang 'byung ba chen po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de yang nam mkhas byed pas na sa la sogs ba bzhin du nam mkha' yang 'byung ba chen po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ram /
translated: If space provides room, then space would be a primary element, like earth, etc.

original: de ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs med pa tsam ma gtogs par nam mkha' zhes bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs med pa tsam ma gtogs par nam mkha' zhes bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: Space is nothing but the mere absence of tangible form.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de nas song ste /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de nas song ste /
translated: It is the intrinsic reality of that which impedes, and it is that which goes there.

original: rang gi go der thogs @198a * //
analyzed: rang gi go der thogs @198a * //
translated: It is that which impedes in its own place.

original: pa dang bcas pa la go 'byed par zad kyi nam mkhas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa dang bcas pa la go 'byed par zad kyi nam mkhas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is that which makes room for that which impedes, but not space.

original: gzugs ltar nam mkha' phyogs de nas song ba med pas de go 'byed ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs ltar nam mkha' phyogs de nas song ba med pas de go 'byed ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Space is not like form, which goes from one place to another. Therefore, it is not suitable to say that space makes room.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs ni rang gi phyogs su gzugs gzhan 'byung ba'i bgegs byed kyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs ni rang gi phyogs su gzugs gzhan 'byung ba'i bgegs byed kyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no //
translated: Obstructed form impedes the arising of another form in its own place, but not space.

original: de lta bas na 'dir gang na gang yod na ni go phye ba med la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir gang na gang yod na ni go phye ba med la /
translated: Thus, in this case, where there is something, there is no making of room.

original: de na de med na ni der go phye ba yod pas de'i phyir de nyid gnas de nas song nas go phye ba yin gyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de na de med na ni der go phye ba yod pas de'i phyir de nyid gnas de nas song nas go phye ba yin gyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no //
translated: Where there is not, there is making of room. Therefore, that which impedes goes from that place and makes room, but not space.

original: de bas na nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa ltar 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa ltar 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: Thus, space is not an element like earth and so on.

original: 'byung ba bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gi gzugs dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyi gar yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gi gzugs dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyi gar yang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the four great elements as its cause‚Äù is applied to both the form that is the four great elements and the form that is derived from the four great elements.

original: skyed pa dang brten pa dang gnas pa dang ston pa dang 'phel bar byed pa rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos po rnam pa lngas 'byung ba rnams kyis 'byung ba las gyur pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: skyed pa dang brten pa dang gnas pa dang ston pa dang 'phel bar byed pa rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos po rnam pa lngas 'byung ba rnams kyis 'byung ba las gyur pa gzung ngo //
translated: The great elements are considered to be the cause of the form that is derived from the elements in five ways: as the cause of origination, as the cause of support, as the cause of subsistence, as the cause of special qualities, and as the cause of growth.

original: rgyur byas pa'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: The term ‚Äúcause‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúhaving the four great elements as its cause‚Äù means the same as the term ‚Äúsource‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúform that is derived from the four great elements.‚Äù

original: dper na shing rgyur byas nas me byung ngo zhes byas na rgyu de las byung bar shes pa lta bu'o //üîΩde la skyed pa'i rgyu ni de dag de med par de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na shing rgyur byas nas me byung ngo zhes byas na rgyu de las byung bar shes pa lta bu'o // de la skyed pa'i rgyu ni de dag de med par de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, when it is said that ‚Äúfire is produced from kindling,‚Äù it is understood that fire is produced from that cause.üîΩIn this context, the great elements are the cause of the form that is derived from the elements in the sense of being the cause of origination, because the form that is derived from the elements does not occur in the absence of the great elements.

original: rten gyi rgyu ni 'byung ba 'gyur na de la brten pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang rjes su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi rgyu ni 'byung ba 'gyur na de la brten pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang rjes su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great elements are the cause of the form that is derived from the elements in the sense of being the cause of support, because the form that is derived from the elements changes when the great elements change.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba rnams rgyun 'dra bar 'byung ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yang 'dra ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba rnams rgyun 'dra bar 'byung ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yang 'dra ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of duration is the four great elements, because the continuity of the derivative form is uninterrupted due to the continuity of the great elements.

original: rton pa'i rgyu ni de'i stobs kyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rton pa'i rgyu ni de'i stobs kyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of reliance is the four great elements, because the derivative form relies on them.

original: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba 'phel na de la rten pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba 'phel na de la rten pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of increase is the four great elements, because when the great elements increase, the derivative form that is based on them also increases.üîΩThe four great elements are called earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: sa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa la rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa nyid khams so /
analyzed: sa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa la rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa nyid khams so /
translated: The term ‚Äúearth‚Äù is used to indicate the characteristic of solidity and the derivative form that possesses that characteristic.

original: sa la sogs pa smos pa ni phan tshun dang mig gi khams la sogs pa dag las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa smos pa ni phan tshun dang mig gi khams la sogs pa dag las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúearth‚Äù is used to distinguish the great elements from each other and from the eye element, etc.

original: khams smos pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sa la sogs pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams smos pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sa la sogs pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúgreat element‚Äù is used to distinguish the great elements from the mundane earth, etc.

original: sal sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang bstan bcos las grags pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sal sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang bstan bcos las grags pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The elements are of two types, according to whether they are known in the world or in the treatises.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid du kun du tha snyad 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir khams ma @198b yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid du kun du tha snyad 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir khams ma @198b yin no //
translated: The elements known in the world are not elements, because they are only conventionally designated as color and shape.

original: bstan bcos las byung ba rnams la ni sra bal sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir yang dag par na khams yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos las byung ba rnams la ni sra bal sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir yang dag par na khams yin no //
translated: The elements known in the treatises are real elements, because they have the nature of solidity, etc.

original: 'byung ba bzhin du sa'i khams la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma bshad par mi shes pas yang sa'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //üîΩsra pa nyid do zhes bya ba la nyid ni sra ba kho na sra ba nyid de 'di la don gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhin du sa'i khams la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma bshad par mi shes pas yang sa'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so // sra pa nyid do zhes bya ba la nyid ni sra ba kho na sra ba nyid de 'di la don gzhan ni med do //
translated: The nature of the earth element, etc., is not known without explanation, as is the case with the elements. Therefore, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the earth element?‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe nature of the earth element is solidity. The nature of the water element is fluidity. The nature of the fire element is heat. The nature of the wind element is motility.

original: sra ba dang mkhrang ba dang 'thas pa ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sra ba dang mkhrang ba dang 'thas pa ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The terms ‚Äúsolidity,‚Äù ‚Äúfluidity,‚Äù ‚Äúheat,‚Äù and ‚Äúmotility‚Äù are synonyms for the earth, water, fire, and wind elements, respectively.

original: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: gsher ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'du bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang rlan par byed pas gsher ba'o //
analyzed: gsher ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'du bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang rlan par byed pas gsher ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoistness‚Äù is the essence of that which causes cohesion and that which wets.

original: me'i khams ni sreg par byed pa yin pas tsha ba'o //
analyzed: me'i khams ni sreg par byed pa yin pas tsha ba'o //
translated: The fire element is heat, that is, that which burns.

original: rlung gi khams ni yang zhing g-yo ba nyid do zhes bya ba la yang ba nyid rlung gi khams yin no zhes brjod na ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang 'byung ba nyid thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni yang zhing g-yo ba nyid do zhes bya ba la yang ba nyid rlung gi khams yin no zhes brjod na ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang 'byung ba nyid thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wind element is lightness and movement. If lightness were the wind element, then primary matter would be an element.

original: rlung gi khams g-yo ba'o zhes brjod pa ni de'i las nyid bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rlung gi khams g-yo ba'o zhes brjod pa ni de'i las nyid bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The wind element is movement. This indicates its activity,

original: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: not its intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir de yang ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang las rnam par gcod pa'i phyir rlung gi khams ni yang zhing g-yo ba'o zhes de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang las rnam par gcod pa'i phyir rlung gi khams ni yang zhing g-yo ba'o zhes de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the wind element is said to be lightness and movement in order to distinguish it from primary matter and its activity.

original: g-yo ba ni dngos po'i rgyun yul gzhan du 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni dngos po'i rgyun yul gzhan du 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Movement is the cause of the arising of a continuum of entities in another place.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams de dag dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs phan tshun tha dad du mi 'jug par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams de dag dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs phan tshun tha dad du mi 'jug par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: If the elements of earth, water, fire, and wind are not perceived separately from the form that is derived from them, how can it be known that they exist?

original: las las mngon te /
analyzed: las las mngon te /
translated: They are known through their actions.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi las ni brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / skyod par byed pa brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi las ni brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / skyod par byed pa brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the actions of the elements are described as supporting, collecting, ripening, and expanding.

original: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs kyang rdo la sogs pa la yod par las las ji ltar rjes su dpag ce na /üîΩ'di ltar rdo la sogs pa la 'dus pa dang / skam pa dang / g-yo ba rnams yod pa las chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams sa'i khams dang lhan cig 'jug par mngon no //
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo mi dmigs kyang rdo la sogs pa la yod par las las ji ltar rjes su dpag ce na / 'di ltar rdo la sogs pa la 'dus pa dang / skam pa dang / g-yo ba rnams yod pa las chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams sa'i khams dang lhan cig 'jug par mngon no //
translated: Even though their individual natures are not perceived, how can it be inferred that they exist in earth and the other elements through their actions?üîΩIn this way, the existence of water, fire, and wind in earth is inferred from the fact that earth is cohesive, moist, and hot, and from the fact that it expands.

original: tshul yang shing 'degs pa dang / padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa dang / chu g-yo ba rnams yod pa las sa dang / me dang rlung rnams chu'i khams dang lhan cig rgyu bar mngon no //
analyzed: tshul yang shing 'degs pa dang / padma'i 'dab ma rgyas pa dang / chu g-yo ba rnams yod pa las sa dang / me dang rlung rnams chu'i khams dang lhan cig rgyu bar mngon no //
translated: The existence of earth, fire, and wind in water is inferred from the fact that water supports, is hot, and expands.

original: me la yang me lces 'degs pa dang / 'dus pa dang / g-yo ba rnams yod pa las sa dang chu dang rlung rnams me dang lhan cig 'jug par mngon no //üîΩrlung la yang 'degs pa dang / mi 'gyes pa dang / gos la sogs bskam bar byed pa yod pa las /üîΩsa dang chu dang me rnams rlung gi @199a * //
analyzed: me la yang me lces 'degs pa dang / 'dus pa dang / g-yo ba rnams yod pa las sa dang chu dang rlung rnams me dang lhan cig 'jug par mngon no // rlung la yang 'degs pa dang / mi 'gyes pa dang / gos la sogs bskam bar byed pa yod pa las / sa dang chu dang me rnams rlung gi @199a * //
translated: The function of water is to moisten, since it is observed that water moistens earth, fire, and wind.üîΩThe function of fire is to mature, since it is observed that fire matures earth, water, and wind.

original: khams dang lhan cig 'jug par mngon no //
analyzed: khams dang lhan cig 'jug par mngon no //
translated: The function of wind is to increase, since it is observed that wind increases earth, water, fire, and itself.

original: las dang rang gi ngo bo gnyis bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: las dang rang gi ngo bo gnyis bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between activity and intrinsic nature?

original: bya ba la ltos nas las rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bya ba la ltos nas las rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Activity is established in dependence on function.

original: 'di ltar brten par bya ba'i rdzas brten pa la ltos nas sa'i khams kyi las ni brten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar brten par bya ba'i rdzas brten pa la ltos nas sa'i khams kyi las ni brten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the activity of the earth element is said to be supporting, since it is observed that the earth element supports the substances that are to be supported.

original: bsdu bar bya ba la ltos nas chu'i las ni sdud pa'o //üîΩsmin par bya ba la ltos nas /
analyzed: bsdu bar bya ba la ltos nas chu'i las ni sdud pa'o // smin par bya ba la ltos nas /
translated: The activity of the water element is moistening, since it is observed that the water element moistens earth, fire, wind, and itself.

original: me'i las ni smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: me'i las ni smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The activity of the fire element is maturing, since it is observed that the fire element matures earth, water, wind, and itself.üîΩThe activity of the wind element is increasing, since it is observed that the wind element increases earth, water, fire, and itself.

original: 'phel bar bya ba nur nur po dang / myu gu la sogs pa la ltos nas rlung gi las ni skyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar bya ba nur nur po dang / myu gu la sogs pa la ltos nas rlung gi las ni skyod par byed pa'o //
translated: The function of wind is to move, in dependence on the stages of the embryo such as kalala, arbuda, etc.

original: bskyod pa ni 'phel bar byed pa dang 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa ni 'phel bar byed pa dang 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: Moving is to increase and to change.

original: ngo bo nyid ni dngos po gzhan thams cad la mi ltos pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni dngos po gzhan thams cad la mi ltos pa ste /
translated: The intrinsic nature is not dependent on any other entity.

original: 'di ni las dang ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di ni las dang ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag go //

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi dang khyad par gyi ming dang / rang bzhin bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi dang khyad par gyi ming dang / rang bzhin bshad zin to //

analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi 'og tu bstan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang rang gi ngo bo mi shes te /

original: de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhe na zhes dris te /

analyzed: rnam pa ni du zhig rang gi ngo bo ni ci 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, ‚ÄúHow many types are there and what is their intrinsic nature?‚Äù

original: mig gi dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i rang gi ngo bo ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of the eye faculty?

original: yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya bas rang gi ngo bor ston te /
analyzed: yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya bas rang gi ngo bor ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object is the visible form‚Äù indicates its intrinsic nature.

original: skabs yin pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs yin pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since this is the proper context, the phrase ‚Äúoriginating from the four great elements‚Äù should be applied here.

original: kha dog ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: ‚Äú Visible form‚Äù refers to the four types of color: blue, yellow, and so on.

original: kha dog la lta ba dang kha dog tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kha dog ni de'i yul yin pas yul kha dog ces bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog la lta ba dang kha dog tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kha dog ni de'i yul yin pas yul kha dog ces bya'o //
translated: The visible form is the object of the eye consciousness because it is the unique cause of the visual consciousness that perceives visible form.

original: 'di ni 'dir dang ba'i don te /üîΩdper na gzugs la brten nas de ltar snang ba'i gzugs brnyan me long ngam /üîΩsnod kyi chu dang ba'i nang du 'byung ba de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir dang ba'i don te / dper na gzugs la brten nas de ltar snang ba'i gzugs brnyan me long ngam / snod kyi chu dang ba'i nang du 'byung ba de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la brten nas /
translated: The term ‚Äúclear‚Äù has the following meaning in this context.üîΩJust as a reflection appears in dependence on a mirror or a vessel of clear water,üîΩso too does a representation appear in dependence on a visible form, a sound, and so on.

analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i rnam par rig pa mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po dag las 'byung ngo //
translated: A representation is a consciousness that appears in the form of an object. It arises from the five sense faculties, such as the eye faculty, which are clear and form-like.

original: 'dir ni mig la sogs pa phan tshun dang / yul gzugs kyi bdag nyid dang ba dang / yid dang / dad pa las rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni mig la sogs pa phan tshun dang / yul gzugs kyi bdag nyid dang ba dang / yid dang / dad pa las rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the eye, etc. are distinguished from each other, from the clarity of the object form, from the mind, and from faith.

original: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du bye brag med pa dang / yul kha dog yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o zhes gnyis ka brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du bye brag med pa dang / yul kha dog yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o zhes gnyis ka brjod do //
translated: Both are mentioned as the object form of clarity of form, because there is no distinction in the clarity of form, and because there is no distinction in the object color.

original: de la yul kha dog ces bya bas ni rna ba la sogs pa dang / yul gyi @199b gzugs dang ba las rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: de la yul kha dog ces bya bas ni rna ba la sogs pa dang / yul gyi @199b gzugs dang ba las rnam par 'byed de /
translated: Among them, the object color distinguishes it from the ear, etc. and from the clarity of the object form.

original: rna ba la sogs pa dang yul ni dang ba yin yang kha dog yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa dang yul ni dang ba yin yang kha dog yul ma yin no //
translated: Although the ear, etc. and the object are clear, color is not the object.

original: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid kyis ni yid las rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid kyis ni yid las rnam par 'byed de /
translated: By the nature of clarity of form, it distinguishes it from the mind.

original: de'i yul kha dog yin yang gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul kha dog yin yang gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Although its object is color, it is not of the nature of clarity of form.

original: gzugs smos pas ni dad pa dang ba'i bdag nyid las rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: gzugs smos pas ni dad pa dang ba'i bdag nyid las rnam par 'byed de /
translated: By mentioning form, it distinguishes it from the nature of clarity of faith.

original: dad pa ni dang ba'i bdag nyid kyang yin la yul kha dog kyang yin te /
analyzed: dad pa ni dang ba'i bdag nyid kyang yin la yul kha dog kyang yin te /
translated: Faith is clarity and it is form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs smos so //

original: mig gi dbang po ni dang ba yul kha dog go zhes brjod na dad pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gzugs smos te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni dang ba yul kha dog go zhes brjod na dad pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gzugs smos te /
translated: If one were to say that the eye faculty is clarity and form, then faith would also be included.

original: dad pa ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dad pa ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, form is mentioned, because faith is not form by nature.

original: mig la sogs pa ni dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po rnams te /
translated: The eye faculty, etc. are faculties because they are dominant.

original: tshogs pa 'di la bdag po byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs pa 'di la bdag po byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdominant‚Äù is that they are the masters of this collection.

original: de bas na bdag po'i don ni dbang po'i don te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag po'i don ni dbang po'i don te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúdominant‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúfaculty.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa yul can rnams phan tshun yul tha dad pas tha dad par brjod de /
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa yul can rnams phan tshun yul tha dad pas tha dad par brjod de /
translated: Just as the subjective faculties of the eye, etc. are described as different because their objects are different,

original: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye faculty?

original: yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: yul kha dog gzugs dang ba'o //

original: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /

original: gzugs ni mig nyid kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni mig nyid kyi yul yin te /

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i ma yin te /

original: dgag pa yang med do //
analyzed: dgag pa yang med do //

analyzed: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad par brjod pa yin no //

original: mig gi yul ni gzugs nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi yul ni gzugs nyid yin gyi /

original: gzugs ma yin pa ni ma yin te de ltar na mig gi dbang po'i yul sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa phan tshun mi 'dra ba rnams kyang gzugs su tha dad pa med par bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: gal te gzugs mig gi yul nyid kyis bye brag tu byas pa yin na kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos she na /

original: kha dog ni rnam ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha dog ni rnam ba bzhi ste /
translated: Color is of four types:üîΩblue,üîΩyellow,

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po @200a * //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po @200a * //

analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs bzhin du gzugs kyi bye brag tu 'dir ma smos te /

analyzed: cig car du mngon sum dang / mngon sum du ma gyur pa dang / 'brel pa can tha dad pa'i phyir de dag gdon mi za bar tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are simultaneous, because they are both direct perception and not direct perception, and because they are related to different things, they must be different.

original: ci ste tha mi dad na yang de dang 'brel pa can rnams kyang phyogs tha dad pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste tha mi dad na yang de dang 'brel pa can rnams kyang phyogs tha dad pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not different, then the things related to them would not have different directions.

original: de lta bas na dbyibs ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dbyibs ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore shape does not exist as a substance.

original: 'on kyang kha dog la sogs pa de lta de ltar gnas pa rnams la ring po la sogs par 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang kha dog la sogs pa de lta de ltar gnas pa rnams la ring po la sogs par 'dogs so //
translated: But when color, etc. are arranged in a certain way, they are designated as long, etc.

original: 'o na rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'i chos 'di gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'i chos 'di gang zhig yin /
translated: What is this dharma called informative form?

original: de la dmigs pa'i sems las skye ba lus kyi 'byung ba chen po la brten nas 'byung ba lus kyi dbyibs te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sems las skye ba lus kyi 'byung ba chen po la brten nas 'byung ba lus kyi dbyibs te /
translated: It is the shape of the body that arises in dependence on the great elements of the body, which are the objects of the mind that gives rise to it.

original: rang kun nas slong ba'i sems rnam par rig par byed pas rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang kun nas slong ba'i sems rnam par rig par byed pas rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is called informative because it informs others of the mind that gives rise to it.

original: 'dir ni de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rig byed de /
analyzed: 'dir ni de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rig byed de /
translated: Here, the form that is derived from the primary elements of the mind is the informative form that is generated by the mind that is focused on that form.

original: gzhan la dmigs pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la dmigs pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not generated by the mind that is focused on something else.

original: de ltar na smra ba'i mchu la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin pa dang / smon lam las skyes pa yang bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na smra ba'i mchu la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin pa dang / smon lam las skyes pa yang bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the shape of the lips, etc., that are used in speech is not generated by the mind that is focused on that shape, nor is it generated by the mind that is focused on the sound of speech.

original: de ni smon lam gyi sems dang gzhan rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i sems las kyang skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni smon lam gyi sems dang gzhan rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i sems las kyang skyes pa yin te /
translated: It is generated by the mind that is focused on the sound of speech, and by the mind that is focused on the vow to speak.

original: @201a * // de'i phyir rnam par rig byed du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: @201a * // de'i phyir rnam par rig byed du mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not considered to be informative form.

original: de la gal te rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'i dbyibs gcig pus lus kyi spyir khyab pa yin na ni gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / khyab pa yin pa'i phyir te thams cad na yod pas yan lag so so la yang gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'i dbyibs gcig pus lus kyi spyir khyab pa yin na ni gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / khyab pa yin pa'i phyir te thams cad na yod pas yan lag so so la yang gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the shape called informative form were to pervade the entire body, it would be apprehended in each of its parts, because it would be one and it would pervade the body.

original: yang na cha shas su rnam par gnas pa'i phyir gcig tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yang na cha shas su rnam par gnas pa'i phyir gcig tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Or else, it would not be tenable that it is one, because it would be situated in parts.

original: skye mched bcu ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i grub pa'i mtha' la'ang gnod par 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta bas na dbyibs zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan du gyur pa med de /
analyzed: skye mched bcu ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i grub pa'i mtha' la'ang gnod par 'gyur ro // de lta bas na dbyibs zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan du gyur pa med de /
translated: and the theory of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas that the ten sense-spheres are agglomerations of atoms would be undermined.üîΩThus, there is no shape that is a real entity distinct from the primary elements.

original: de'i phyir dbyibs ni rnam par rig byed ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs ni rnam par rig byed ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, shape is not a real entity.

original: gal te lus las don gzhan du gyur pa'i dbyibs rnam par rig byed ma yin na'o na de gang yin /üîΩde la dmigs pa'i sems pa'i rgyu mtshan can lus kyi rgyud rgyun ma chad par yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gal te lus las don gzhan du gyur pa'i dbyibs rnam par rig byed ma yin na'o na de gang yin / de la dmigs pa'i sems pa'i rgyu mtshan can lus kyi rgyud rgyun ma chad par yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If shape is not a real entity distinct from the body, what is it?üîΩIt is the cause of the continuity of the body, which is the causal condition of the volition that has shape as its object.

original: sems pa rgyur gyur pa ni lus kyi rgyud yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu rlung gi khams bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa rgyur gyur pa ni lus kyi rgyud yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu rlung gi khams bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The volition that is the cause of the continuity of the body is the cause of the wind element that produces the continuity of the body in another place.

original: lus yul gzhan du 'byung ba de ni rang gi rgyu sems pa rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: lus yul gzhan du 'byung ba de ni rang gi rgyu sems pa rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed do //
translated: The body in another place is called informative because it is the cause of the volition that is known.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not of the nature of either virtue or nonvirtue.

original: 'on kyang de dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems pas skyed pa'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu btags te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems pas skyed pa'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu btags te /
translated: But because it is generated by virtuous or nonvirtuous intention, the result is designated by the cause.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du 'dogs so ;
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du 'dogs so ;
translated: Therefore, it is designated as virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: /'dir gzugs rnam par gzhag pa ni ngo bo nyid dang gnas pa dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: /'dir gzugs rnam par gzhag pa ni ngo bo nyid dang gnas pa dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Here form is established by its intrinsic reality, by its duration, and by its function.

original: ngo bo nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa kha dog bzhi po rnams te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa kha dog bzhi po rnams te /

original: de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the intrinsic reality of form.

original: gnas pa ni ring po la sogs pa dbyibs rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: gnas pa ni ring po la sogs pa dbyibs rnam pa brgyad de /

original: kha dog de lta de ltar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog de lta de ltar gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rig byed de /
analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rig byed de /

analyzed: lus g-yo ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Form that exists as substance is the object of the eye, etc.

original: dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed ni /
analyzed: dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed ni /

analyzed: btags pa yod pa'i phyir mig gi yul ma yin pa snyam na ji ltar gzugs mig gi yul zhes brjod /

original: 'dir 'jig rten dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir dbyibs kyi khyad par dang bcas pa'i kha dog mig gi yul du 'dod de /

analyzed: 'di ltar dbyibs kyi khyad par can du gyur pa'i kha dog la mig gis 'dzin gyi /

original: dbyibs sa ma kha dog gcig pu la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs sa ma kha dog gcig pu la ni ma yin te /

analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i @201b dbyibs kyi khyad par du gyur pa'i kha dog tu snang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs ni mig gi yul lo zhes 'jig rten na grags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs ni mig gi yul lo zhes 'jig rten na grags so //

original: don dam par ni dbyibs bzhin du kha dog kyang mig gi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni dbyibs bzhin du kha dog kyang mig gi yul ma yin te /

analyzed: de lta bas na slob dpon gyis 'dir 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las grags pa dang / mthun par mdzad par shes so //

analyzed: gzugs kyi 'og tu sgra bstan pa'i phyir de bshad ma thag tu sgra bshad par rigs pas na /

analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig gang zhe na zhes dris so //

original: reg bya ni rnam pa gnyis te /

translated: The primary elements have already been explained and will be explained further.

original: 'dir ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs  kyi skabs yin pas de'i phyir reg bya'i phyogs gcig gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs  kyi skabs yin pas de'i phyir reg bya'i phyogs gcig gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: But since this is a discussion of derivative form, therefore the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the one type of tangible object?‚Äù

original: lus kyi yul te zhes bya ba ni lus nyid kyi yul yin gyi /
analyzed: lus kyi yul te zhes bya ba ni lus nyid kyi yul yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is the object of the body‚Äù means that tangible objects are the object of the body sense faculty.

original: mig la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the object of the eye or any of the other sense faculties.

original: de ltar na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa las de tha dad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa las de tha dad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, tangible objects are presented as being distinct from form, sound, etc.

original: lus nyid kyi yul reg bya nyid ces bya bas ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis phan tshun mi 'dra yang reg bya nyid du bye brag med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus nyid kyi yul reg bya nyid ces bya bas ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis phan tshun mi 'dra yang reg bya nyid du bye brag med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object of the body, which is tangible objects‚Äù indicates that, although the primary elements and the form derived from them are not similar to each other, they are not distinguished from each other in terms of being tangible objects.

original: lus kyi yul te zhes bya ba 'byung ba rnams kyang lus kyi yul yin pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi yul te zhes bya ba 'byung ba rnams kyang lus kyi yul yin pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the primary elements are also the object of the body, it would follow erroneously that they are derivative form.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams gzhag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams gzhag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe primary elements are not derivative form.‚Äù

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate one part of the tangible,

original: 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says smoothness, roughness, etc.

original: lus kyi dbang por reg par bya bas na 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa reg bya zhes brjod na ni /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang por reg par bya bas na 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa reg bya zhes brjod na ni /
translated: If smoothness, etc. are called tangible because they are contacted by the body faculty,

original: gang gis gang la reg pa des kyang de la reg par gdon mi za bar 'gyur bas lus kyi dbang po yang reg khyar thal bar mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gang gis gang la reg pa des kyang de la reg par gdon mi za bar 'gyur bas lus kyi dbang po yang reg khyar thal bar mi 'gyur ram /
translated: then since it is certain that whatever contacts something is itself contacted, wouldn‚Äôt it follow that the body faculty itself is tangible?

original: gang gis kyang ci la yang reg pa @202b med de /
analyzed: gang gis kyang ci la yang reg pa @202b med de /
translated: Nothing contacts anything,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg na ni gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab kyi tshad tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg na ni gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab kyi tshad tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it contacts by its whole self, then all masses would be the size of a single atom.

original: phyogs kyis reg na ni rdul phra rab rnams cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur bas rdul phra rab nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyis reg na ni rdul phra rab rnams cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur bas rdul phra rab nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it contacts by a part, then it follows that atoms have parts, and that contradicts their being atoms.

original: de bas na yul dang dbang po gnyis bar ma chad par skye ba na gang la brten nas rnam par shes pas yul dmigs pa des yul la reg ces bya bar gdags kyi yul gyis rnam par shes pa'i gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yul dang dbang po gnyis bar ma chad par skye ba na gang la brten nas rnam par shes pas yul dmigs pa des yul la reg ces bya bar gdags kyi yul gyis rnam par shes pa'i gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the object and the sense faculty arise without an interval, it is designated that the object is contacted by the sense faculty on the basis of which the consciousness perceives the object.

original: de'i phyir lus kyi dbang pos 'byung ba rnams nyid la reg go zhes gdags kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi dbang pos 'byung ba rnams nyid la reg go zhes gdags kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is designated that the body sense faculty contacts the primary elements themselves.

original: de dag la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the form, etc., that exist in those primary elements,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body consciousness does not apprehend them.

original: me tog la sogs pa'i kha dog la sogs pa la gnod pa ni de'i gnas la gnod pa'i phyir gyi lus kyis reg pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa'i kha dog la sogs pa la gnod pa ni de'i gnas la gnod pa'i phyir gyi lus kyis reg pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: The harm to the color, etc., of flowers, etc., is due to the harm to their location, not due to the contact of the body.

original: kha dog la sogs pa'i gnas la yang lus kyis reg pa ma yin na ji ltar gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa'i gnas la yang lus kyis reg pa ma yin na ji ltar gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the body does not contact the location of the color, etc., how can it be harmed?

original: 'di ni bsam par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam par bya ba ste /
translated: This should be considered.

original: de lta bas na 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'brang bar bya'i don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'brang bar bya'i don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here we follow worldly convention, not ultimate meaning.

original: 'jam pa nyid ni ma nyen pa dang / mi rtsub dang / spyad du bzod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'jam pa kho na 'jam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid ni ma nyen pa dang / mi rtsub dang / spyad du bzod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'jam pa kho na 'jam pa nyid do //
translated: Smoothness is the opposite of roughness, not harshness, and is what is meant by ‚Äúagreeable to the touch.üîΩ‚Äù Smoothness is just that which is smooth.

original: rtsub pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la rtsub pa yod pas rtsub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtsub pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la rtsub pa yod pas rtsub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Roughness is that which is rough,

original: spu can bzhin no //
analyzed: spu can bzhin no //
translated: like a porcupine.

original: rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni stobs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni stobs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Roughness is what is meant by ‚Äústrength.

original: rtsub pa kho na rtsub pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtsub pa kho na rtsub pa nyid de /
translated: ‚Äù Roughness is just that which is rough.

original: rud rud po dang / hrud hrud po dang / shin tu 'jam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rud rud po dang / hrud hrud po dang / shin tu 'jam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is what is meant by ‚Äúrough, ‚Äù ‚Äúcoarse, ‚Äù and ‚Äúnot soft.

original: lci ba ni lcid gnon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lci ba ni lcid gnon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äù Heavy is what is weighty.

original: lci ba kho na lci ba nyid de /
analyzed: lci ba kho na lci ba nyid de /
translated: Heavy is just that which is heavy.

original: dngos po rnam pa 'jam pa na gang gis dma' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa 'jam pa na gang gis dma' bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is what causes things to bend downward when they are bent.

original: yang ba nyid ni gang gis dngos po rnams 'jam pa na dma' bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang ba nyid ni gang gis dngos po rnams 'jam pa na dma' bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Lightness is what causes things not to bend downward when they are bent.

original: dbyibs cher zin kyang gang yod na gdeg bla ba ste /
analyzed: dbyibs cher zin kyang gang yod na gdeg bla ba ste /
translated: Even though the shape is similar, it is the cause of the raising of the lower end of the scale.

original: srang mda'i rtse mo dma' bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srang mda'i rtse mo dma' bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is the cause of the lowering of the upper end of the scale.‚Äù

original: gang gis nyen na dro ba 'dod pa de ni grang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis nyen na dro ba 'dod pa de ni grang ba nyid do //
translated: Cold is the discomfort that causes one who desires warmth to seek warmth.

original: dpyid dang ston grang ba yod kyang dro ba mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dpyid dang ston grang ba yod kyang dro ba mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that cold exists in spring and autumn, but that one does not desire warmth?

original: dro ba 'dod pa ni gzhan du mi 'byung bas grang ba nyid dro ba 'dod par byed pa zhes nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: dro ba 'dod pa ni gzhan du mi 'byung bas grang ba nyid dro ba 'dod par byed pa zhes nges par gzung ngo //
translated: Since the desire for warmth does not occur elsewhere, cold is ascertained to be that which causes the desire for warmth.

original: de ltar na de'i 'bras bu yang de dang rigs gcig pa'i phyir mtshan nyid pa rnams kyis @203a * //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i 'bras bu yang de dang rigs gcig pa'i phyir mtshan nyid pa rnams kyis @203a * //
translated: Thus, its result is also understood by the logicians to be of the same type as it.

original: rtogs so // bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs so // bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Hunger is the discomfort that causes one who desires food to seek food.

original: skom pa ni skom 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa ni skom 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Thirst is the discomfort that causes one who desires drink to seek drink.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos ni lus kyi dbang po'i yul ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos ni lus kyi dbang po'i yul ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Mental factors are not objects of the body faculty.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa byas nas 'dir bkres pa dang skom pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa byas nas 'dir bkres pa dang skom pa bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the result is figuratively designated as the cause, and here hunger and thirst are taught.

original: rlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni bkres pa'i rgyu reg bya'i bye brag 'ga' zhig 'byung ba de ni bkres pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni bkres pa'i rgyu reg bya'i bye brag 'ga' zhig 'byung ba de ni bkres pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause of hunger is a certain type of tangible object, which is a predominance of the wind element.

original: bkres pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bkres pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Hunger is so called because it is the cause of hunger.

original: de bzhin du me'i khams kyi shas che na skom pa'i rgyu yin ba'i phyir skom pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i khams kyi shas che na skom pa'i rgyu yin ba'i phyir skom pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Similarly, thirst is so called because it is the cause of thirst, which is a predominance of the fire element.

original: gzhan nas brgyal ba dang / nyams yod pa dang nyam chung ba la sogs pa reg bya'i bye brag smos pa rnams kyang 'di dag gi nang du 'dus pas logs shig tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan nas brgyal ba dang / nyams yod pa dang nyam chung ba la sogs pa reg bya'i bye brag smos pa rnams kyang 'di dag gi nang du 'dus pas logs shig tu ma brjod do //
translated: Other types of tangible objects mentioned elsewhere, such as fainting, weakness, and feebleness, are included in these, so they are not mentioned separately.

original: brgyal ba ni 'jam pa nyid las gud na med do //
analyzed: brgyal ba ni 'jam pa nyid las gud na med do //
translated: Fainting is not separate from smoothness.

original: nyams yod pa ni rtsub pa dang lci ba nyid las logs shig na med de /
analyzed: nyams yod pa ni rtsub pa dang lci ba nyid las logs shig na med de /
translated: Weakness is not separate from roughness and heaviness.

original: de ltar gzhan nas reg bya'i bye brag 'byung ba rnams kyang 'di dag gi nang du mthun mthun du bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan nas reg bya'i bye brag 'byung ba rnams kyang 'di dag gi nang du mthun mthun du bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, other types of tangible objects mentioned elsewhere should be included in these, as appropriate.

original: 'jam pa la sogs pa yang gnas kyi bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad de /
analyzed: 'jam pa la sogs pa yang gnas kyi bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad de /
translated: Smoothness, etc. are also mutually distinct due to the distinction of location.

original: chu nyid las gud na med do //üîΩnyams yod pa ni rtsub pa dang lci ba rlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni rtsub pa nyid do //
analyzed: chu nyid las gud na med do // nyams yod pa ni rtsub pa dang lci ba rlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni rtsub pa nyid do //
translated: They do not exist apart from water itself.

original: sa dang chu'i khams kyi shas che ba ni lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: sa dang chu'i khams kyi shas che ba ni lci ba nyid do //
translated: Weight is the predominance of the earth and water elements.

original: me dang rlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: me dang rlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni yang ba nyid do //
translated: Lightness is the predominance of the fire and wind elements.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shi ba'i lus la lci ba nyid kyi shas che ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shi ba'i lus la lci ba nyid kyi shas che ba'o //
translated: Therefore, in a dead body, the predominance of weight is due to the predominance of the earth and water elements.

original: chu'i khams kyi shas che ba ni grang ba'o //üîΩrlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni bkres pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi shas che ba ni grang ba'o // rlung gi khams kyi shas che ba ni bkres pa'o //
translated: Cold is the predominance of the water element.üîΩHunger is the predominance of the wind element.

original: me'i khams kyi shas che ba ni skom pa'o //
analyzed: me'i khams kyi shas che ba ni skom pa'o //
translated: Thirst is the predominance of the fire element.

original: de bzhin du gnas kyi bye brag gis phan tshun bye brag tu gyur par rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas kyi bye brag gis phan tshun bye brag tu gyur par rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: In this way, other derived forms should be understood as mutually distinct due to the distinction of location, as appropriate.

original: 'dir ni tshig mang du 'gyur ba spangs pa'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni tshig mang du 'gyur ba spangs pa'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bstan to //
translated: Here, a mere part is taught in order to avoid an excessive number of words.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'am rgyur byes pa'i gzugs las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'ba' zhig lus pas /üîΩrnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / rnam par rig byed dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'am rgyur byes pa'i gzugs las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'ba' zhig lus pas / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / rnam par rig byed dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs te /
translated: Only non-informative form remains from the form aggregate or form as basic matter.

original: bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya bas de bstan to //
analyzed: bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya bas de bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is non-informative form?‚Äù and it is taught by the statement, ‚ÄúIt is form that is derived from the primary elements that are not derived from a cause, that is invisible and non-resistant.‚Äù

original: de la rnam par rig byed ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Non-informative form is twofold:

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag @203b gi rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag @203b gi rnam par rig byed do //
translated: informative of the body and informative of speech.

original: de re re la yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de re re la yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Each of these is threefold, according to its division into virtuous, non-virtuous and indeterminate.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang rnam pa gsum nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang rnam pa gsum nyid do //
translated: Non-informative form is also threefold.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is related to the realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed las byung ba ste /
translated: Non-informative action related to the realm of desire arises from wholesome and unwholesome informative action.

original: de yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang / de dag ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang / de dag ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the restraint of the code of discipline, the restraint of the bodhisattva, non-restraint, and that which is neither.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni dge slong dang / dge tshul dang / dge bsnyen dang / bsnyen gnas la gnas pa'i bye brag gis rdzas su rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni dge slong dang / dge tshul dang / dge bsnyen dang / bsnyen gnas la gnas pa'i bye brag gis rdzas su rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The restraint of the code of discipline is fourfold in substance, according to the distinctions of the monk, the novice, the lay practitioner, and the one-day fasting vow.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ming du ni rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ming du ni rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: It is eightfold in name according to the distinctions of the monk, nun, etc.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa las gzhi dang bcas par rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa las gzhi dang bcas par rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa'o //
translated: The restraint of the code of discipline is the complete avoidance of harming others, together with the basis of such harm.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni lus dang srog gis bsdus pa'i dngos po la mi lta bar /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni lus dang srog gis bsdus pa'i dngos po la mi lta bar /
translated: The bodhisattva vow is to not look at things that are included in one's body and life.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyis rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyis rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva vow is to engage in benefiting others in every way with body, speech, and mind, without regard for one's body and life.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Non-vow is to engage in harming others in every way.

original: phyogs gcig gis phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par zhugs pa ni sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par zhugs pa ni sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Engaging in benefiting or harming others in part is neither vow nor non-vow.

original: de la gzugs su gtogs pa dang / zag pa med pa ni ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs su gtogs pa dang / zag pa med pa ni ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ste /
translated: Among those, that included in form and the uncontaminated arise from concentration.

original: de yang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are the meditative discipline and the uncontaminated discipline, respectively.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi po dag dang / mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na zag pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi po dag dang / mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na zag pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'o //
translated: The absorption of the summit of cyclic existence is the restraint of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig byung ba ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig byung ba ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: The absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited consciousness is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited consciousness.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited space is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited space.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of nothingness is the restraint of the perception-sphere of nothingness.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited ideation is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited ideation.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited beauty is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited beauty.

original: de yang 'byung ba rnams la brten nas 'byung ba dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid do //üîΩ'di ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba rnams la brten nas 'byung ba dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid do // 'di ni 'di na'o //
translated: The absorption of the perception-sphere of infinite beauty is the restraint of the perception-sphere of infinite beauty.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of infinite consciousness is the restraint of the perception-sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: pha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes brjod pa 'di ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes brjod pa 'di ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The absorption of the perception-sphere of infinite space is the restraint of the perception-sphere of infinite space.

original: de 'di la med pas bstan du med pa'o //üîΩrang gi phyogs su gzhan 'byung @204a * //
analyzed: de 'di la med pas bstan du med pa'o // rang gi phyogs su gzhan 'byung @204a * //
translated: The absorption of the perception-sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation is the restraint of the perception-sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation.

original: ba'i gegs byed pa ni thogs pa'o //üîΩrnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir de mi srid pas thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i gegs byed pa ni thogs pa'o // rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir de mi srid pas thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The absorption of the summit of cyclic existence is the restraint of the summit of cyclic existence.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited consciousness is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited consciousness.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited space is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited space.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of nothingness is the restraint of the perception-sphere of nothingness.üîΩThe absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited ideation is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited ideation.

original: gzugs thams cad ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The absorption of the perception-sphere of unlimited beauty is the restraint of the perception-sphere of unlimited beauty.üîΩThe absorption of

original: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa'o //
translated: 1. having form and resistance; 2. not having form but having resistance; 3. not having form and not having resistance.

original: de la bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig gi dbang po'i yul lo //
analyzed: de la bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig gi dbang po'i yul lo //
translated: Among these, that which has form and resistance is the object of the eye sense-faculty.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig la sogs pa lnga dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya bzhi'o //
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig la sogs pa lnga dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya bzhi'o //
translated: That which does not have form but has resistance is the five sense-faculties of eye, etc., and the four sense-objects of sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ni chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ni chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs so //
translated: That which does not have form and does not have resistance is the form of the sense-field of mental objects.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of five kinds:

original: bsdus pa las gyur pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa dang / yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba dang / kun brtags pa dang / dbang 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa las gyur pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa dang / yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba dang / kun brtags pa dang / dbang 'byor pa'o //
translated: that which is derived from the elements; that which is derived from the elements and is resistant; that which is derived from the elements and is non-resistant; that which is derived from the elements and is derived from vows; that which is derived from the elements and is imaginary; and that which is derived from the elements and is mastery.

original: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po ni /
translated: Here, the aggregate of form is:

original: rdzas bcu gcig kho nar 'dod pas yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba'i gzugs nyid du bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med par bshad de /
analyzed: rdzas bcu gcig kho nar 'dod pas yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba'i gzugs nyid du bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med par bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the form that arises from the proper undertaking of vows is both imperceptible and nonresistant.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: ci'i phyir de dag mi bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag mi bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are these not taught?

original: bsdus pa las gyur pa ni rdul phra rab rnams nyid de /
analyzed: bsdus pa las gyur pa ni rdul phra rab rnams nyid de /
translated: The form that is derived from the elements is the atoms themselves.

original: de dag ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog las gud na med de /
analyzed: de dag ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog las gud na med de /
translated: It is not separate from the color blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog las kha dog tu snang ba gzhan rnams ni med do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog las kha dog tu snang ba gzhan rnams ni med do //
translated: There is no other form that appears as the color blue, etc.

original: mngon par skabs yod pa yang rdul phra rab rnams nyid de /
analyzed: mngon par skabs yod pa yang rdul phra rab rnams nyid de /
translated: The form that is the space element is the atoms themselves.

original: de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: It is the absence of any other resistant tangible object.

original: de dag kyang kha dog gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'dus pa nyid pas yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: de dag kyang kha dog gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'dus pa nyid pas yang ma bshad do //
translated: Since it is the nature of color, it is included in the form that is derived from the elements.

original: kun brtags pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs keng rus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs keng rus la sogs pa'o //
translated: The form that is imagined is the form of a reflection, a skeleton, etc.

original: dbang 'byor pa ni rnam par thar pa la bsam gtan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa ni rnam par thar pa la bsam gtan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa ste /
translated: Mastery is the form that is the domain of the meditative development of the liberations.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'dir ma 'dus te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'dir ma 'dus te /
translated: That is not included here because it is of the nature of conceptual thought.

original: de ni de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba las phyi rol na med do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba las phyi rol na med do //
translated: It does not exist externally, apart from the appearance in the consciousness that has its aspect.

original: gzugs brnyan yang yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yang yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid do //
translated: The reflection is the consciousness itself that appears as the object.

original: rnam par shes pa las gzugs brnyan nam gzugs brnyan las rnam par shes pa gud na med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzugs brnyan nam gzugs brnyan las rnam par shes pa gud na med do //
translated: The reflection is not apart from the consciousness, nor is the consciousness apart from the reflection.

original: de lta bas na yang dag par blangs la las byung ba nyid 'dir @204b bshad kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na yang dag par blangs la las byung ba nyid 'dir @204b bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, only that which arises from the correct assumption is explained here,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: and not the other.

original: mthu stobs kyis che ba'i blos bskyod pa ni bdag lta bu gang gis kyang rtogs par ga la nus te /
analyzed: mthu stobs kyis che ba'i blos bskyod pa ni bdag lta bu gang gis kyang rtogs par ga la nus te /
translated: How can anyone like me understand the movement of the mind of one who is great by virtue of his power?
