original: de lta bas na de dag ma bshad pa ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ma bshad pa ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the omission of those should be sought in the intention of the Master.

original: de ni 'di skad du rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba las byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni sems g-yeng ba dang / ma g-yeng ba dang / sems med pa na yang rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba las byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni sems g-yeng ba dang / ma g-yeng ba dang / sems med pa na yang rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: That is to say, nonindicative form that arises from virtue or nonvirtue, such as indicative form and that derived from concentration, is concomitant with the mind that is either distracted or not distracted and it is also concomitant with the mindless state.

original: de stong pa'i rgyu med na yod pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de stong pa'i rgyu med na yod pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nonindicative form that exists without a cause for its cessation is taught to be nonindicative form.

original: gzugs dang byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang rang kun nas slong ba'i sems rnam par rig par byed pa bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang rang kun nas slong ba'i sems rnam par rig par byed pa bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: Even though it is the intrinsic state of form and action, it is nonindicative form because, unlike the mind that motivates it, it does not indicate to others.

original: 'dir ni bye brag tu smra bas kun brtags pa'i rnam par rig byed bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'dir ni bye brag tu smra bas kun brtags pa'i rnam par rig byed bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang med de /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Nonindicative form does not exist like the imputed indicative form.

original: tshad ma'i yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an object of valid cognition.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: The vows of individual liberation and so on are not nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar sems pas bya bar khas blangs nas bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems pas bya bar khas blangs nas bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga sngon du btang ste /
translated: Thus, having promised to act with the thought to fully awaken to buddhahood, one first performs the rite of full ordination and so on.

original: sems pa gang gis lus dang ngag gi las bkag pa las sdom pa'i sems pa des ma 'ongs pa na de dang rigs gcig pa bskyed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sa bon btab nas /
analyzed: sems pa gang gis lus dang ngag gi las bkag pa las sdom pa'i sems pa des ma 'ongs pa na de dang rigs gcig pa bskyed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sa bon btab nas /
translated: The thought that restrains one from physical and verbal actions plants the seed of that thought in the foundation consciousness and in the future it generates that same type of thought.

original: de'i 'og tu bdag ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o zhes yang dag par blangs pa dran pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdag ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o zhes yang dag par blangs pa dran pa 'byung ste /
translated: Subsequently, the recollection of the vow arises, thinking, ‚ÄúI have abandoned taking life and so on.‚Äù

original: de byung nas gang 'dzem pa de bslab pa mi 'dral lo //
analyzed: de byung nas gang 'dzem pa de bslab pa mi 'dral lo //
translated: If that recollection arises, one will not violate the training.

original: de ltar na yang dag par blang ba'i sems pa rgyun chags pa dang bcas pa ni sngom pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag par blang ba'i sems pa rgyun chags pa dang bcas pa ni sngom pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus the thought to take the vow and its continuum are taught to be a vow.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan nam lam la snyoms par zhugs na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med par yang gang thob na langs nas log pa'i ngag la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa la 'jug pa de lta bu'i bsam pa dang gnas thob ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan nam lam la snyoms par zhugs na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med par yang gang thob na langs nas log pa'i ngag la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa la 'jug pa de lta bu'i bsam pa dang gnas thob ste /
translated: So too, when one enters meditative attainment on the absorptions or the path, one obtains a state and a basis that, even without nonindicative form, one will not engage in wrong speech and so on when one rises from meditative attainment and one will engage in right speech and so on.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la rgyu can gdags par byas nas lam gyi yan lag brgyad rnams dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yang rnam par gzhag go //üîΩsdom pa ma yin pa yang de'i rigs su skyes pa rnams kyi gsad par sbyor bar bya ba'i sems pa dang / gzhan gyi rigs su skyes pa rnams @205a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la rgyu can gdags par byas nas lam gyi yan lag brgyad rnams dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yang rnam par gzhag go // sdom pa ma yin pa yang de'i rigs su skyes pa rnams kyi gsad par sbyor bar bya ba'i sems pa dang / gzhan gyi rigs su skyes pa rnams @205a * //
translated: Therefore, having imputed the result to the cause, the eight branches of the ƒÅrya path and the vows of the absorptions are posited.

original: kyi las de bya bar khas len pa'i sems pa ste /
analyzed: kyi las de bya bar khas len pa'i sems pa ste /
translated: Nonvows are the intention to engage in killing and so on of those born in a class of beings that is an object of killing and the intention to accept the performance of that action of those born in another class of beings.

original: sems pa de med kyang sdom pa ma yin pa btang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa de med kyang sdom pa ma yin pa btang ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though that intention does not exist, nonvows are not relinquished.

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa bya bar bsam pa las ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa bya bar bsam pa las ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not turn away from the thought to harm sentient beings.

original: de ltar bya ba'i sems pa dang / khas len pa'i sems pa sems can rnams la gnod pa bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni sdom pa ma yin pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba'i sems pa dang / khas len pa'i sems pa sems can rnams la gnod pa bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni sdom pa ma yin pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The thought of action and the thought of promise that are associated with the thought of harming sentient beings are non-vows.

original: 'dir rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba nyid ni brda phrad par sla bas yang ma spros so //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba nyid ni brda phrad par sla bas yang ma spros so //
translated: Here, since indicative form and that arisen from concentration are easy to understand, they are not elaborated.

original: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i sems pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba ni bdag nyid kho nas so ;
analyzed: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i sems pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba ni bdag nyid kho nas so ;
translated: The virtuous and nonvirtuous natures of the thoughts of vows and nonvows are virtuous and nonvirtuous by their very nature.

original: / de'i rgyun chags pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems pas 'phangs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i rgyun chags pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems pas 'phangs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their continuity is virtuous and nonvirtuous because it is projected by virtuous and nonvirtuous thoughts and it is the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous thoughts.

original: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i lam rgyu yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i dag la sogs pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i lam rgyu yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i dag la sogs pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
translated: Also, the absorptions and uncontaminated vows are virtuous because the absorptions and uncontaminated paths are their cause and right view and so on are their result.

original: gzugs ni lus dang ngag yul yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs ni lus dang ngag yul yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Form is the object of body and speech.

original: yul can la yul btags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: yul can la yul btags pa'i phyir ro // bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ni /
translated: The object is figuratively designated as the subject.

original: brda phrad par sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The form that is not visible and not capable of being indicated is easily understood, so it is not explained.

original: de'i ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la thug pa'i gzugs kyi phung po 'di gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ci'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la thug pa'i gzugs kyi phung po 'di gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the form aggregate called form, up to and including non-revealing form?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gzugs su rung bas de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gzugs su rung bas de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMonks, it is form because it is suitable as form. Therefore, it is called the form aggregate.‚Äù

original: ci gzugs she na /
analyzed: ci gzugs she na /
translated: What is form?

original: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pas reg na gzugs su rung ba'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pas reg na gzugs su rung ba'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: It is that which is suitable as form when touched by the contact of the hand, etc.

original: mdo las kyang lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pas gzugs yod pa'i phyir gzugs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las kyang lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pas gzugs yod pa'i phyir gzugs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The s≈´tra also says, ‚ÄúIt is form because it exists as form through the contact of the hand, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi gzugs su yod pa 'di gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi gzugs su yod pa 'di gang zhe na /
translated: What is this existence of form as form?

original: lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa snga ma'i gnas las gzhan du skyed pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa snga ma'i gnas las gzhan du skyed pa ste /
translated: It is the generation of a different state from the previous state through the contact of the hand, etc.

original: 'di yang rgyun gyi dbang du byas te brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang rgyun gyi dbang du byas te brjod kyi /
translated: This is said from the perspective of a continuum,

original: skad cig la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig la ni ma yin te /
translated: not from the perspective of a moment.

original: skad cig ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dus kyi dbang du byas pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dus kyi dbang du byas pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A moment is from the perspective of the time of arising and cessation, because it does not endure.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i 'og tu tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: The section on the aggregate of form is followed by the section on the aggregate of feeling.

original: de'i 'og tu bstan pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bstan pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is taught immediately after the aggregate of form, therefore

original: tshor ba gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / myong ba rnam pa @205b gsum ste zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / myong ba rnam pa @205b gsum ste zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhat is feeling?‚Äù and then teaches, ‚ÄúThe three types of experience.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba ni myong ba ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni myong ba ste /
translated: Experience is feeling.

original: dngos po'i sim pa dang gdung ba dang gnyi ga'i rnam par ma gtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i sim pa dang gdung ba dang gnyi ga'i rnam par ma gtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the direct experience of the nature of an entity that is not included in the categories of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: yang na sim pa dang / gdung ba dang gnyi ga'i rnam par ma gtogs pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo myong bar byed pas myong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sim pa dang / gdung ba dang gnyi ga'i rnam par ma gtogs pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo myong bar byed pas myong ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is feeling because it experiences the nature of an entity that is not included in the categories of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of three types, according to its specific nature.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ma gtogs par myong ba gsum pa yod pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ma gtogs par myong ba gsum pa yod pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How can there be a third kind of feeling, apart from pleasant and unpleasant?

original: lung dang rigs pas mngon te /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas mngon te /
translated: It is evident from the scriptures and from reasoning.

original: mdo las tshor ba rnam pa gsum zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las tshor ba rnam pa gsum zhes gsungs so //
translated: The scriptures teach three kinds of feeling.üîΩThe scriptures also teach:

original: yang bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs te /üîΩbde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs te / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAbandoning both pleasure and pain,üîΩabandoning all that is, one enters the fourth meditation.‚ÄùüîΩReasoning also proves that there is a third kind of feeling.

original: rigs pa ni tshor ba dang bral ba'i sems skye ba med pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sems kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rigs pa ni tshor ba dang bral ba'i sems skye ba med pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sems kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: The mind that is free from feeling does not arise, and a mind that is free from pleasure and pain is not perceived.

original: reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang gsungs te /
analyzed: reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang gsungs te /
translated: The master Sa·πÖghabhadra says that feeling is the experience of contact.

original: 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang / gnyi ga las ldog pa'i reg pa rnams myong ba gang yin pa de tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang / gnyi ga las ldog pa'i reg pa rnams myong ba gang yin pa de tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is the experience of contact that is desirable, undesirable, or neither of the two.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what he says.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: and the feeling of pleasure arises in dependence on the contact that is conducive to pleasure.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bskyed pa yin pas de rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bskyed pa yin pas de rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The feeling of pleasure, etc. are distinguished from contact because they are the generation of pleasure, etc.

original: gal te yul myong ba tshor ba yin du zin na dmigs pa gcig pa rnams las 'di khyad par ci yod de /
analyzed: gal te yul myong ba tshor ba yin du zin na dmigs pa gcig pa rnams las 'di khyad par ci yod de /
translated: If the experience of an object is feeling, then what is the difference between the experience of an object and the perception of an object?

original: de'i phyir reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa myong ba ni tshor ba'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the experience of contact is feeling.

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'du shes dang mos pa dang / dran pa dang ; shes rab la sogs pa yang tshor ba bzhin du dmigs pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'du shes dang mos pa dang / dran pa dang ; shes rab la sogs pa yang tshor ba bzhin du dmigs pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: If that is so, then like feeling, perception, intention, memory, understanding, etc. cannot be described as having their own unique objects.

original: ji ste 'du shes la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pas dmigs pa gcig pa rnams las khyad par du 'dod na ni tshor ba yang yul myong bar ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: ji ste 'du shes la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pas dmigs pa gcig pa rnams las khyad par du 'dod na ni tshor ba yang yul myong bar ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: If you maintain that perception, etc. are distinguished from the experience of an object because they grasp an object‚Äôs sign, etc., then why not maintain that feeling is distinguished from the experience of an object because it experiences an object?

original: de la dmigs par mi srid pa'i phyir reg pa myong ba yang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de la dmigs par mi srid pa'i phyir reg pa myong ba yang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
translated: because it is impossible to focus on that.

original: rgyu'i dngos por yongs su brtag grang na /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos por yongs su brtag grang na /
translated: If you imagine that feeling is concomitant with or the cause of contact,

original: de la mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not concomitant with contact,

original: sems las byung ba thams cad reg pa dang mtshungs par ldan par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad reg pa dang mtshungs par ldan par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all mental factors are not distinguished as being concomitant with contact.

original: rgyu'i dngos por yang mi rung ste /üîΩsems las @206a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos por yang mi rung ste / sems las @206a * //
translated: Nor is it suitable as the cause of contact,

original: byung ba thams cad kyi rgyu reg pa yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba thams cad kyi rgyu reg pa yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all mental factors are not distinguished as being the cause of contact.

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las kyang myong ba'i sgra ni 'bras bu'am rgyur grags pa med kyi mngon sum du byed par grags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las kyang myong ba'i sgra ni 'bras bu'am rgyur grags pa med kyi mngon sum du byed par grags so //
translated: In the world and in treatises, the term ‚Äúexperience‚Äù is not known to mean either effect or cause, but rather that which is directly perceived.

original: 'di snyam du sems te las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'dis myong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'dis myong ba ste /
translated: The following is thought: ‚ÄúThis experiences the effect that is the maturation of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de la bde ba myong ba ni las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba myong ba ni las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The experience of pleasure is the effect that is the maturation of virtuous karma.

original: sdug bsngal ni mi dge ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mi dge ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Suffering is the result of nonvirtue.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni gnyi ga'i'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni gnyi ga'i'o snyam mo //
translated: Neither-pleasure-nor-suffering is the result of both.

original: 'dir ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: Here, the result of virtue and nonvirtue is the store consciousness itself.

original: don dam par na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i btang snyoms nyid las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i btang snyoms nyid las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the result of virtue and nonvirtue is the equanimity associated with that store consciousness.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes btags pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes btags pa'o //
translated: Pleasure and suffering are designated as results because they arise from results.

original: de la bde ba myong ba ni gang 'gags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin na /
analyzed: de la bde ba myong ba ni gang 'gags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin na /
translated: Here, the experience of pleasure is that which arises when something ceases.

original: 'o na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gang 'byung na bral bar mi 'dod pa skye ba de bde ba'i tshor ba'o zhes 'byung ba de ji lta bu /
analyzed: 'o na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gang 'byung na bral bar mi 'dod pa skye ba de bde ba'i tshor ba'o zhes 'byung ba de ji lta bu /
translated: But how can that be, since the dependent origination teaches: ‚ÄúWhen this arises, that which does not wish to be separated from it arises‚Äù?

original: 'di la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction here,

original: don du na cig shos kyang zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du na cig shos kyang zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in reality the other is also grasped.

original: gang byung na 'bral bar mi 'dod ba skye ba zhes bya ba ni don du na de 'gags na phrad par 'dod par yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang byung na 'bral bar mi 'dod ba skye ba zhes bya ba ni don du na de 'gags na phrad par 'dod par yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwhen it arises, one does not wish to be separated from it‚Äù is that when it ceases, one wishes to meet with it.

original: gang 'gags na phrad par 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang 'dir don du na de byung na 'bral bar mi 'dod pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'gags na phrad par 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang 'dir don du na de byung na 'bral bar mi 'dod pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwhen it ceases, one wishes to meet with it‚Äù is that when it arises, one does not wish to be separated from it.

original: 'o na dka' thub can rnams mi 'dod bzhin du 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang phrad pa rnams 'dod chags las byung ba'i bde ba skyes pa'i tshe 'bral bar 'dod pa skye zhing /
analyzed: 'o na dka' thub can rnams mi 'dod bzhin du 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang phrad pa rnams 'dod chags las byung ba'i bde ba skyes pa'i tshe 'bral bar 'dod pa skye zhing /
translated: Now, ascetics, unwillingly, meet with the entanglement of passion. When the pleasure born of passion arises, they wish to be separated from it.

original: 'gags pa na phrad par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'gags pa na phrad par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: When it ceases, they do not wish to meet with it. How is this?

original: de ni sun 'byin pa'i phyir de nyid las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sun 'byin pa'i phyir de nyid las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not born from that, because it is a revulsion.

original: bde ba de tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod par mthong ba rnams la gnyi ga mi 'byung bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bde ba de tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod par mthong ba rnams la gnyi ga mi 'byung bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: When they see that pleasure is an obstacle to morality and concentration, both do not occur. There is no contradiction.

original: sdug bsngal ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'gags na yang phrad par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'gags na yang phrad par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: When it ceases, one does not wish to be united with it.

original: bral na ni de'i rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: bral na ni de'i rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: Separation is the termination of its continuity.

original: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa dang smon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa dang smon pa'o //
translated: Desire is the wish and longing for something.

original: sdug bsngal yang @206b ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni gang byung na gnyi gar 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde la lus dang sems rgyas par byed pa dang / yid du 'ong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang @206b ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni gang byung na gnyi gar 'dod par mi 'gyur ro // de la lus dang sems rgyas par byed pa dang / yid du 'ong ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is that from which one wishes for neither when it has arisen.

original: bde ba myong ba ni gang 'gags na de dang phrad par 'dod pa'o //üîΩlus dang sems nyams dams  par byed pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba myong ba ni gang 'gags na de dang phrad par 'dod pa'o // lus dang sems nyams dams  par byed pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Therein, pleasant experience is that from which one wishes to be united when it ceases, because it expands the body and mind and has a pleasant nature.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ni de byung na de dang bral bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ni de byung na de dang bral bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Unpleasant experience is that from which one wishes to be separated when it arises, because it contracts the body and mind and has a nature that is not agreeable.

original: gnyi ga ni mi 'byung ba la yang myong ba gang yin pa de yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga ni mi 'byung ba la yang myong ba gang yin pa de yod de /
translated: That which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is that from which one wishes for neither when it arises.üîΩTherein, the experience of neither pleasant nor unpleasant is that which exists in regard to the non-arising of both.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: nag po yang ma yin dkar po yang ma yin pa'i las dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nag po yang ma yin dkar po yang ma yin pa'i las dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like an action that is neither black nor white.

original: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa yang med la gnod pa byed pa yang med par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa yang med la gnod pa byed pa yang med par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is because one enters into the absence of benefit and the absence of harm.

original: de byung na gnyi gar 'dod pa med do //
analyzed: de byung na gnyi gar 'dod pa med do //
translated: When it arises, there is no desire for either.

original: myong ba rnam pa gsum po 'di ni re re la yang gnas kyi bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu gyur te /
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gsum po 'di ni re re la yang gnas kyi bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu gyur te /
translated: This threefold experience becomes sixfold due to the distinctions of the six abodes.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it arises from the contact of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: yang brten par bsdu na ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang brten par bsdu na ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, when it is summarized in terms of its basis, it becomes twofold:

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
translated: that of the body and that of the mind.

original: de la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po rnams ni lus la tha dad du mi 'jug pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang bsags pa bzhin pa'i phyir lus kyi nang du bsdus te lus kyi sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: de la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po rnams ni lus la tha dad du mi 'jug pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang bsags pa bzhin pa'i phyir lus kyi nang du bsdus te lus kyi sgrar brjod do //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, and tongue faculties are included in the body because they do not function separately from the body, because they are obstructed, and because they are aggregated.

original: de'i phyir mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i myong ba ni lus kyi zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i myong ba ni lus kyi zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the experience arising from the contact of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body is called bodily.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni yid tsam la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni yid tsam la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: The experience arising from the contact of the mental faculty is called mental, because it is based on the mind alone.

original: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i bye brag gis myong ba re re la yang rnam pa gnyis gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i bye brag gis myong ba re re la yang rnam pa gnyis gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, each experience is twofold, according to the distinction of counteragent and counteracted.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa dang zang zing med pa dang zhen pa brten pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba brten pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa dang zang zing med pa dang zhen pa brten pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba brten pa'o //
translated: The experience is either with or without materiality, and it is either based on attachment to home life or on renunciation.

original: zang zing ni lus la sred pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing ni lus la sred pa'o //
translated: Materiality is craving for the body.

original: lus ni nang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: lus ni nang gi nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The body is the internal appropriated aggregates.

original: de la sred pa bu gcig pa phongs pa la 'khyud pa'i tshul gyis mi 'brel bar 'dod pa lta bur 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing ste /
analyzed: de la sred pa bu gcig pa phongs pa la 'khyud pa'i tshul gyis mi 'brel bar 'dod pa lta bur 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing ste /
translated: The craving that engages them in the manner of a mother who embraces her son, not wanting to be separated, is called ‚Äúwith sensuality.‚Äù

original: de dang ldan pas zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One who possesses that craving is said to be ‚Äúwith sensuality.‚Äù

original: sred pa de dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rjes su mthun pa ni zang zing med pa'o //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan sdug @207a * //
analyzed: sred pa de dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rjes su mthun pa ni zang zing med pa'o // gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan sdug @207a * //
translated: The absence of that craving, which is compatible with freedom from attachment, is called ‚Äúwithout sensuality.‚ÄùüîΩThe five sense objects such as form are called ‚Äúsensual things‚Äù because they are desired by the craving that is characterized by viewing, attachment, and aspiration.

original: pa lnga la lta ba dang / mngon par chags pa dang smon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod pas zlos shing yang dang yang goms par byed pas 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams te de dag la mngon par chags pa dang smon pa ni zhen pa'o //
analyzed: pa lnga la lta ba dang / mngon par chags pa dang smon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod pas zlos shing yang dang yang goms par byed pas 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams te de dag la mngon par chags pa dang smon pa ni zhen pa'o //
translated: One who is attached to and aspires for those is called ‚Äúone who is attached.‚Äù

original: de la brten pa'am zhen pa de brten pas na zhen pa brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'am zhen pa de brten pas na zhen pa brten pa'o //
translated: One who is attached to them is called ‚Äúone who is attached to attachment.‚Äù

original: mngon par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan las 'dod chags dang bral ba'am de'i lam ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan las 'dod chags dang bral ba'am de'i lam ste /
translated: Renunciation is the path to freedom from attachment to the pleasures of sense desire.

original: de la brten pa'am de brten pas mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'am de brten pas mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa'o //
translated: It is based on that, or it is based on that, thus it is based on renunciation.

original: de la 'jig tshogs dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i dngos por zang zing dang bcas pa dang zang zing med pa gnyis rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i dngos por zang zing dang bcas pa dang zang zing med pa gnyis rnam par gnas so //
translated: In this regard, the two, with and without material possessions, are established as the adverse and the counteragent, from the point of view of the world and freedom from attachment to the perishing aggregates.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te zhen pa brten pa dang mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te zhen pa brten pa dang mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: From the point of view of the world and freedom from attachment, the two, the support of attachment and the support of renunciation, are established.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag bstan gyi ji ltar gzhan nas 'byung ba bzhin du gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag bstan gyi ji ltar gzhan nas 'byung ba bzhin du gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the difference in their intrinsic natures taught here, and not the difference in their bases, etc., as it is in other texts?

original: 'dir ni mdor bsdu bar bzhed pa dang / tha dad pa thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni mdor bsdu bar bzhed pa dang / tha dad pa thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bo las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, however, it is intended to be brief, and because all differences are not apart from their own nature.

original: 'dir gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag ma bshad do //
translated: Here, the distinctions of location, etc., are not explained.

original: tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung bo bshad pa'i skabs su bab ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bshad pa'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung bo bshad pa'i skabs su bab ste /
translated: After the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception is mentioned.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de bstan to //
translated: Therefore, when it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is perception?‚Äù it is taught that it is the apprehension of the sign of the object.

original: yul ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object is the objective support.

original: mtshan ma ni yul gyi bye brag sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu'o //üîΩde la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'di ni sngon po'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni yul gyi bye brag sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu'o // de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'di ni sngon po'o //
translated: The sign is the cause for the establishment of the objective support as a particular object, such as blue or yellow.

original: 'di ni ser po'o zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ser po'o zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of the sign is the conception that this is blue, that is yellow.

original: de lta na 'o na ni /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni /
translated: In that case, then,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes bye brag rtog pa med pa'i phyir yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes bye brag rtog pa med pa'i phyir yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The feeling of the eye consciousness and so on is not the nature of grasping an object‚Äôs sign, because the discernment associated with the eye consciousness and so on does not conceive a specific object.

original: de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: It is known to be the nature of grasping a sign,

original: zhan pa'i phyir yongs su gcod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan du na sngar ma zin pa'i bye brag las phyis kyang 'di ni sngon po'o //
analyzed: zhan pa'i phyir yongs su gcod pa ni ma yin no // gzhan du na sngar ma zin pa'i bye brag las phyis kyang 'di ni sngon po'o //
translated: but it is not a determiner because it is weak.

original: 'di ni ser po'o zhes rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni ser po'o zhes rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not later conceive this is blue or that is yellow, based on a specific object not previously apprehended.

original: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med kyang gnas dang dmigs pas 'du @207b shes tha dad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med kyang gnas dang dmigs pas 'du @207b shes tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Even though there is no difference in their own nature, the groups of discernment should be understood as different because of their basis and object.

original: gnas las 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: gnas las 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
translated: The six groups of discernment are from the basis.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'du shes dang / de bzhin du yid kyi bar du 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'du shes dang / de bzhin du yid kyi bar du 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: Discernment arising from the contact of the eye is discernment arising from the contact of the eye, and so on up to discernment arising from the contact of the mind.

original: dmigs pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / chung du dang / rgya chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / chung du dang / rgya chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched do //
translated: The object is with a sign, without a sign, small, vast, immeasurable, and the sphere of nothingness.

original: de la sgra'i sgo nas gang don gyi ngo bor sgro btags pa de ni mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: de la sgra'i sgo nas gang don gyi ngo bor sgro btags pa de ni mtshan ma ste /
translated: Among them, a sign is that which is superimposed on the nature of an object through the door of sound.

original: mtshan ma de dang lhan cig pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma de dang lhan cig pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The nature of a thing that is together with that sign is with a sign.

original: dngos po de la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo de dang / de ni sgra'o snyam pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po de la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo de dang / de ni sgra'o snyam pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The perception that the nature superimposed on that thing is just that sound is the observation of that with a sign.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni sgro btags pa'i mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni sgro btags pa'i mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Without a sign is without the sign of superimposition.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The nature of a thing, nirvana, and the peak of existence.

original: de la sgro btags pa'i mtshan ma med pa dang / gzugs dang tshor ba'i mtshan ma med pa dang / gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sgro btags pa'i mtshan ma med pa dang / gzugs dang tshor ba'i mtshan ma med pa dang / gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The absence of the sign of superimposition, the absence of the sign of form and feeling, and the absence of clarity.

original: 'di gsum ni mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These three are called signlessness.

original: sgra dang don du 'brel ba mi shes pa ni ngo bo la rang gi ngo bo kho na'i 'du shes 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: sgra dang don du 'brel ba mi shes pa ni ngo bo la rang gi ngo bo kho na'i 'du shes 'byung mod kyi /
translated: One who does not know the relation between words and their meanings has only the notion of the intrinsic nature with regard to the intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that he has the notion of form.

original: de'i phyir yul de la 'du shes pa ni mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul de la 'du shes pa ni mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the notion of that object is the objective support of signlessness.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyang 'dus byas thams cad kyi mtshan mar rab tu nub pa'i ngo bo yin pas de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes ni mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyang 'dus byas thams cad kyi mtshan mar rab tu nub pa'i ngo bo yin pas de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes ni mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The realm of nirvana is the nature of the complete disappearance of the sign of all conditioned things. Therefore, the notion associated with the concentration that has that as its object is the objective support of signlessness.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ni gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ni gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: The summit of existence is signless because it is not clear.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: The notion that enters into meditative concentration on that is the objective support of the signless.

original: dmigs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pas mtshan ma la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pas mtshan ma la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the object of a sign because it does not make a sign of the object.

original: 'dir ni mtshan ma gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni mtshan ma gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, it is not a clear sign.

original: de la dmigs pa yang bu mo lto med ces bya ba'i tshul du mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'i de ni mtshan ma med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yang bu mo lto med ces bya ba'i tshul du mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'i de ni mtshan ma med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: The object of that is called signless, in the same way that a girl without breasts is called breastless. But it is not called signless because it is signless by nature.

original: gzhan du na ni 'du shes par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni 'du shes par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it is conceptual.

original: mtshan ma med pas mtshan mar 'dzin pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas mtshan mar 'dzin pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is signless, it would not grasp signs.

original: chung ngu ni 'dod pa'i khams te ngan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung ngu ni 'dod pa'i khams te ngan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The small realm is the desire realm, because it is inferior.

original: rgya chen por gyur pa ni gzugs kyi khams te /
analyzed: rgya chen por gyur pa ni gzugs kyi khams te /
translated: The vast realm is the form realm,

original: @208a * // mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @208a * // mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior.

original: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag ste /
translated: The immeasurable realms are the bases of infinite space and infinite consciousness,

original: mu thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are limitless.

original: yongs su gzung ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ci yang med pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ci yang med pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched do //
translated: The sphere of nothingness is called nothingness because there is nothing whatsoever that is grasped.

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perceptions of limitedness, etc., are called the perceptions of limitedness, etc., because they have the desire realm, etc., as their objects.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad pa'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bshad par rigs te /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po bshad pa'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung po bshad par rigs te /
translated: The aggregate of volitional factors should be explained immediately after the aggregate of perceptions,

original: de'i 'og tu bstan pas na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bstan pas na de'i phyir /
translated: because it is taught immediately after that.

original: 'du byed rnams gang zhen zhes dris pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so zhes bya bas de bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gang zhen zhes dris pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so zhes bya bas de bstan to //
translated: Therefore, when asked, ‚ÄúWhat are the volitional factors? ‚Äù it is taught by the statement, ‚ÄúThey are the mental factors that are different from feeling and perception, and the factors that are not associated with the mind. ‚Äù

original: rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs nas byas pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs nas byas pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: All phenomena that are included in the aggregates of form, etc., are called volitional factors because they are produced by the assembly and convergence of conditions.

original: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa nyid 'du byed rnams su 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa nyid 'du byed rnams su 'dod de /
translated: Here, those included in the aggregate of formation are asserted to be formations.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes kyi phung por bsdus pa rnams ni bshad zin la /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes kyi phung por bsdus pa rnams ni bshad zin la /
translated: Those included in the aggregates of form, feeling, and discrimination have already been explained.üîΩThose included in the aggregate of consciousness will be explained later.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung por bsdus pa rnams ni 'og nas 'byung ba de'i tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis reg pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams dang sems las byung ba nyid du bye brag med kyang /üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes pa las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung por bsdus pa rnams ni 'og nas 'byung ba de'i tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis reg pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams dang sems las byung ba nyid du bye brag med kyang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes pa las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Although feeling and discernment are not differentiated from contact, attention, and so on, they are included in the aggregate of formation.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes gnyis sems las byung ba nyid yin du zin kyang tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis phung por bsdus pas 'du byed kyi phung por ma bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes gnyis sems las byung ba nyid yin du zin kyang tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis phung por bsdus pas 'du byed kyi phung por ma bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although feeling and discernment are definitely mental factors, they are not included in the aggregate of formation because they are included in the aggregates of feeling and discrimination.

original: tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: Feeling is the entity of experience.

original: 'di ltar tshor bas ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor bas ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar byed /
translated: Thus, feeling experiences the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: 'du shes ni tha snyad 'dogs pa'i gzhi ste /üîΩ'du shes kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la mtshan mar bzung nas mthong ba la sogs pa la mthong ngo //üîΩthos so // bye brag phyed do //
analyzed: 'du shes ni tha snyad 'dogs pa'i gzhi ste / 'du shes kyis mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la mtshan mar bzung nas mthong ba la sogs pa la mthong ngo // thos so // bye brag phyed do //
translated: Ideation is the basis for the designation of conventions.

original: rnam par shes so zhes 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes so zhes 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad pa 'jug ste /
translated: When ideation apprehends the signs of objects that are seen, heard, distinguished, or known, it engages in the conventions of the world, such as ‚ÄúI see,‚Äù ‚ÄúI hear,‚Äù ‚ÄúI distinguish,‚Äù and ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes nyid so sor phung por byas kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes nyid so sor phung por byas kyi /
translated: Therefore, feeling and ideation are separately designated as aggregates,

original: sems las byung ba gzhan rnams ni ma yin @208b no ;
analyzed: sems las byung ba gzhan rnams ni ma yin @208b no ;
translated: but the other mental factors are not.

original: / gal te tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa reg pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos spyod pa la thug pa rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa thob pa la sogs pa 'du byed kyi phung por bsdu na /
analyzed: / gal te tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa reg pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos spyod pa la thug pa rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa thob pa la sogs pa 'du byed kyi phung por bsdu na /
translated: If contact and so on, which are mental factors other than feeling and discernment, up to and including the mental factors of the process of actualization, and the aggregates of nonassociated compositional factors such as acquisition, are subsumed within the aggregate of compositional factors,üîΩthen it contradicts the s≈´tras,

original: de lta na 'o na ni mdo dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni mdo dang 'gal te /
translated: for the s≈´tras state:

original: mdo las ni 'du byed kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ni 'du byed kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of compositional factors?

original: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: It is the group of six intentions.

original: de ni gtso bo bstan pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de ni gtso bo bstan pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction because that is taught as the primary factor.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: Intention is the primary factor that conditions the mind.

original: yid la byed pa la sogs pa ni de'i rjes su 'brang ba yin pas sems pa nyid 'du byed kyi phung por gsungs te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la sogs pa ni de'i rjes su 'brang ba yin pas sems pa nyid 'du byed kyi phung por gsungs te /
translated: Mental activity and so on are secondary to that. Therefore intention alone is taught to be the aggregate of compositional factors.

original: 'di ltar gang dge ba la yang sems 'jug par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dge ba la yang sems 'jug par byed /
translated: In this way, it causes the mind to engage in virtue.

original: mi dge ba dang / lung ma bstan pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas rnams la yang sems 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / lung ma bstan pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas rnams la yang sems 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cause the mind to engage in virtue, nonvirtue, the indeterminate, pleasure, and pain.

original: 'du byed bzhin du sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang mi shes pa'i phyir dris pa dang / chos gang dag sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed bzhin du sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang mi shes pa'i phyir dris pa dang / chos gang dag sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Since they do not know mental factors as they are taught in the Abhidharma, they ask, ‚ÄúWhat are mental factors?‚Äù and it is taught, ‚ÄúThose phenomena that are concomitant with the mind.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang mi shes pas de'i phyir dris pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi shes pas de'i phyir dris pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: Since they do not know those, they ask, ‚ÄúWhat are they?‚Äù and it is taught, ‚ÄúThey are contact, mental volition, and so on.‚Äù

original: reg pa la sogs pa dpyod pa la thug pa de dag kyang gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa nyid rnam pa lngas sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pas mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa dpyod pa la thug pa de dag kyang gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa nyid rnam pa lngas sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pas mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: Those mental factors from contact to investigation are concomitant with the mind because they are concomitant through concomitance in five ways: they are concomitant through being the same basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad kyang sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad kyang sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not differentiated as being concomitant with mind, it follows that they are concomitant with all minds.

original: de rnams las lnga ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams las lnga ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: To eliminate that fault, the root text states, ‚ÄúFive are omnipresent.‚Äù

original: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o //
translated: Five are determined in relation to specific objects.

original: bcu gcig ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig ni dge ba'o //
translated: Eleven are virtuous.

original: drug ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: drug ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Six are root afflictions.

original: lhag ma rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The remaining ones are branch afflictions.

original: 'gyod pa la sogs pa bzhi ni gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'gyod pa la sogs pa bzhi ni gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The four beginning with regret are also other.

original: 'di dag gi nang nas dang po'i reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa gang yin pa de dag ni kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang nas dang po'i reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa gang yin pa de dag ni kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Among these, the first five‚Äîcontact, attention, feeling, conception, and volition‚Äîare omnipresent.

original: chos lnga po 'di dag ni sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag ni sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Because these five phenomena accompany all minds, they are omnipresent.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni khams gsum pa'i dge ba dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dang yang mtshungs par ldan la /üîΩ'dod par @209a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni khams gsum pa'i dge ba dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dang yang mtshungs par ldan la / 'dod par @209a * //
translated: Thus, these mental factors are associated with the wholesome minds of the three realms and with the uncontaminated minds.

original: gtogs pa'i mi dge ba dang / khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du mi ston pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gtogs pa'i mi dge ba dang / khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du mi ston pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: They are also associated with the unwholesome minds of the desire realm and with the afflicted and indeterminate minds of the three realms.

original: sems kyi 'jug pa thams cad la gdon mi za bar gsum 'dus pa 'byung ste /üîΩgsum 'dus pa yang reg pa las 'khrul pa med pas /
analyzed: sems kyi 'jug pa thams cad la gdon mi za bar gsum 'dus pa 'byung ste / gsum 'dus pa yang reg pa las 'khrul pa med pas /
translated: In all mental processes, the three universal mental factors definitely occur.

original: de'i phyir reg pa ni kun du 'gro ba nyid do //üîΩsems kyi 'jug pa med par dmigs pa la 'jug pa mi srid pas yid la byed pa yang kun du 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa ni kun du 'gro ba nyid do // sems kyi 'jug pa med par dmigs pa la 'jug pa mi srid pas yid la byed pa yang kun du 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: Since the three universal mental factors occur, contact is also universal, because there is no mental process without contact.üîΩSince there is no mental process without contact, attention is also universal.

original: myong ba med pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa'i sems med pas na tshor ba dang / 'du shes kyang kun du 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: myong ba med pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa'i sems med pas na tshor ba dang / 'du shes kyang kun du 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: Since there is no mind without feeling and discrimination, feeling and discrimination are also universal.

original: sems pa ni yid kyi las nyid yin pas de yang gdon mi za bar sems thams cad la 'byung bas de'i phyir chos lnga po 'di dag ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni yid kyi las nyid yin pas de yang gdon mi za bar sems thams cad la 'byung bas de'i phyir chos lnga po 'di dag ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Mental activity is mental karma itself, and it occurs in all minds without exception. Therefore, these five are omnipresent.

original: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag yul so sor nges pa yin gyi thams cad la ma yin pas yul so sor nges pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lnga ni yul so sor nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag yul so sor nges pa yin gyi thams cad la ma yin pas yul so sor nges pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Five are object-determining, because they determine their objects, but not all of them.

original: de dag kyang 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
translated: They are aspiration, faith, memory, samƒÅdhi, and discernment.

original: bcu gcig ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: bcu gcig ni dge ba ste /
translated: Eleven are virtuous.

original: de dag kyang dad pa la sogs pa nas rnam par mi 'tshe ba la thug pa yan chad do //
analyzed: de dag kyang dad pa la sogs pa nas rnam par mi 'tshe ba la thug pa yan chad do //
translated: They are faith, conscience, shame, absence of greed, absence of hatred, absence of ignorance, effort, pliancy, conscientiousness, equanimity, and absence of harm.

original: de dag ni ma dad pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba rnams te /
analyzed: de dag ni ma dad pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba rnams te /
translated: They are virtuous because they are the antidotes of nonfaith and so on, and because they are concomitant with the roots of virtue.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang dge ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang dge ba'o //
translated: The mind that is concomitant with them is also virtuous.

original: nyon mongs pa drug ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste /
translated: The six afflictions are desire, anger, pride, ignorance, views, and doubt.

original: de dag ni sems nyon mongs par byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni sems nyon mongs par byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: They are called afflictions because they afflict the mind.

original: lhag ma rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang khro ba nas shes bzhin ma yin pa la thug pa yan chad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang khro ba nas shes bzhin ma yin pa la thug pa yan chad do //
translated: The rest are secondary afflictions. The rest are the secondary afflictions, from anger to lack of conscience and shame.

original: 'gyod pa la sogs bzhi ni gzhan du yang ngo zhes 'byung ba de'i phyir lhag ma rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes khyad med par brjod kyang shes bzhin ma yin pa'i mthar thug pa kho na yin par mngon no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa la sogs bzhi ni gzhan du yang ngo zhes 'byung ba de'i phyir lhag ma rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o zhes khyad med par brjod kyang shes bzhin ma yin pa'i mthar thug pa kho na yin par mngon no //
translated: Since it is said that the four beginning with regret are also elsewhere, it is clear that although it is said without distinction that the rest are secondary afflictions, they are only up to lack of conscience and shame.

original: nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa dang / sems nyon mongs par byed pa dang / nyon mongs dang nye ba'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa dang / sems nyon mongs par byed pa dang / nyon mongs dang nye ba'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: They are called secondary afflictions because they are related to the afflictions, they afflict the mind, and they are close to the afflictions.

original: 'gyod pa la sogs pa bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa la sogs pa bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa'o //
translated: Like regret, etc. means like regret, sleep, initial inquiry, and investigation.

original: gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di dag nye ba'i nyon @209b mongs pa 'ba' zhig yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di dag nye ba'i nyon @209b mongs pa 'ba' zhig yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Also in other ways means that these mental factors are not only secondary afflictions.

original: dge ba yin pa dang / lung du mi ston pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba yin pa dang / lung du mi ston pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also virtuous and indeterminate.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyi sdom 'di ni bsdu na lnga bcu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyi sdom 'di ni bsdu na lnga bcu rtsa gcig go //
translated: This summary of the mental factors is, in total, fifty-one.

original: 'di dag gi so so'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas /
analyzed: 'di dag gi so so'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas /
translated: Since their individual natures are not known,

original: reg pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: yid la byed pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
translated: What is attention? and so on.

original: 'dir ni mtshan nyid kho na bstan gyi mdor bsdu bar 'dod pas gzhan nas 'byung ba bzhin du las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mtshan nyid kho na bstan gyi mdor bsdu bar 'dod pas gzhan nas 'byung ba bzhin du las ni ma yin no //
translated: Here only their characteristics are taught, not their actions, because it is intended to be concise, like the Abhidharma.

original: bdag gis ni bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis ni bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But I will explain them for easy understanding.

original: las kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: And their actions will be explained.

original: de la rang gi ngo bo ni sngar bstan pa'i phyir sngar bshad de /
analyzed: de la rang gi ngo bo ni sngar bstan pa'i phyir sngar bshad de /
translated: Since its nature has already been explained, it is not explained here.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other terms should be explained in the same way, as appropriate.üîΩThe three coming together is the determination of the object.

original: gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba ni skabs yin pas dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba ni skabs yin pas dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum nyid gsum mo //
translated: The three are the sense faculty, the object, and the consciousness.

original: de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos gnas pa ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos gnas pa ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The coming together is their presence in the state of cause and effect.

original: de yod na de'i dus nyid na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba 'di gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa
analyzed: de yod na de'i dus nyid na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor pa 'byung ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba 'di gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur pa'i yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa
translated: When that exists, at that very time, the determination of the aspect of the object that is conducive to the arising of the feeling of pleasure, etc., is the transformation of the sense faculty that is similar to the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: de reg pa'o //
analyzed: de reg pa'o //
translated: That is contact.

original: dbang po yang bye brag gang gis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa de ni de'i 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po yang bye brag gang gis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa de ni de'i 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The sense faculty is transformed by a particular state that becomes the cause of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: dbang po 'gyur ba dang 'dra bas dbang po la reg pa'am dbang pos reg pas reg pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'gyur ba dang 'dra bas dbang po la reg pa'am dbang pos reg pas reg pa'o //
translated: It is contact because it contacts the sense faculty, or because it is contacted by the sense faculty, like the change of a sense faculty.

original: 'di'i las ni tshor ba'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i las ni tshor ba'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: Its action is to support feeling.

original: de skad du mdo las kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du mdo las kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, a scripture declares: ‚ÄúPleasant feeling arises in dependence on the contact that is the condition for pleasant feeling. ‚Äù

original: yid la byed pa gang zhe na /üîΩsems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang zhe na / sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: What is attention?üîΩIt is the directing of consciousness.üîΩIt is the directing of consciousness because it directs consciousness.

original: dmigs pa la gang gis sems mngon du phyogs par byed pa de sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la gang gis sems mngon du phyogs par byed pa de sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the directing of consciousness because it causes consciousness to engage in an object.

original: de ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can te /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can te /
translated: Its action is to hold the mind to an object.

original: sems 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa de nyid la yang dang yang gtod pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa de nyid la yang dang yang gtod pa'o //
translated: It holds the mind to an object by repeatedly fixing the mind on that object.

original: las de yang sems kyi rgyun gyi dmigs pa nges pas yid la byed pa bye brag can gyi dbang du byas te bshad kyi /
analyzed: las de yang sems kyi rgyun gyi dmigs pa nges pas yid la byed pa bye brag can gyi dbang du byas te bshad kyi /
translated: This action is explained from the perspective of a specific attention that fixes the mind on an object by determining the object of the continuum of the mind.

original: de sems kyi skad cig re re la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de sems kyi skad cig re re la ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not occur in each moment of the mind.

original: yid la byed pa thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o zhes gang smos pa ni 'dir dper brjod pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa'o zhes gang smos pa ni 'dir dper brjod pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone who has attained attention‚Äù refers to one who has attained concentration.

original: der yang yid la byed pa khyad par can thob pas yid la byed pa thob pa'o zhes brjod @210a * //
analyzed: der yang yid la byed pa khyad par can thob pas yid la byed pa thob pa'o zhes brjod @210a * //
translated: This is an example.

original: do ; / gzhan du na ni thams cad kyi sems kyi skad cig re re la yid la byed pa thob pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyis yid la byed pa thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: do ; / gzhan du na ni thams cad kyi sems kyi skad cig re re la yid la byed pa thob pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyis yid la byed pa thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since everyone would attain attention in every moment of thought, all sentient beings would attain attention.

original: sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is volition?

original: yon tan dang nyes pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan dang nyes pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is mental karma, the formation of the mind with regard to virtue, nonvirtue, or the two.

original: yon tan ni dge ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan ni dge ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Virtue is the wholesome dharmas.

original: nyes pa ni mi dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyes pa ni mi dge ba rnams so //
translated: Nonvirtue is the unwholesome dharmas.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The two are the indeterminate dharmas.

original: yang na yon tan ni phan 'dogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na yon tan ni phan 'dogs pa rnams so //
translated: Alternatively, virtue is that which is beneficial.

original: nyes pa ni gnod par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gnod par byed pa rnams so //
translated: Nonvirtue is that which is harmful.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni bar ma do rnams so //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni bar ma do rnams so //
translated: The third alternative is the intermediate state.

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni yid g-yo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni yid g-yo bar byed pa ste /
translated: The mental factor called volition is the movement of the mind.

original: gang yod na khab len gyi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin du dmigs pa la sems g-yo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod na khab len gyi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin du dmigs pa la sems g-yo bar byed pa'o //
translated: When it exists, the mind moves toward its object, as iron moves under the influence of a magnet.

original: skad cig gzhan du mi gnas shing //
analyzed: skad cig gzhan du mi gnas shing //
translated: It does not remain for a second instant.

original: byed med yid kyang gang gis ni //
analyzed: byed med yid kyang gang gis ni //
translated: It is the movement of the mind, which is without action,

original: byed dang bcas ltar snang byed pa //
analyzed: byed dang bcas ltar snang byed pa //
translated: as if it had action,

original: sems pa de ni yid kyi las //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems pa de ni yid kyi las // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and is called mental action.

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes de skad ces bstan na /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes de skad ces bstan na /
translated: If volition is taught in this way,

original: yid kyi las zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi las zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na /
translated: why is it called mental action?

original: sems las byung ba thams cad kyis kyang sems mngon par 'du byed pas de'i phyir gzhan dag las rnam par dbye ba'i don du yid kyi las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad kyis kyang sems mngon par 'du byed pas de'i phyir gzhan dag las rnam par dbye ba'i don du yid kyi las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since all mental factors form the mind, in order to distinguish it from the others, volition is called mental action.

original: rnam par shes pa kun du g-yo ba ltar byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni sems pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kun du g-yo ba ltar byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni sems pa yin gyi /
translated: It is volition that causes the mind to move, as if it had action, although consciousness is without action.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to understand that it is not something else.

original: yon tan dang nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni las bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni las bstan pa'o //
translated: The mental activity of virtue, nonvirtue, and neither is the teaching of action.

original: yid kyi las so zhes bya ba ni sems pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: yid kyi las so zhes bya ba ni sems pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: The mental action is the teaching of the nature of intention.

original: 'dun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is will?

original: bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the desire for an object of thought.

original: bsams pa smos pa ni ma bsams pa la 'dun pa med do zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsams pa smos pa ni ma bsams pa la 'dun pa med do zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word thought is used in order to understand that there is no will where there is no thought.

original: de ltar na 'dun pa yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //üîΩlta ba dang / mnyan pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i yul du gyur pa la bsam pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dun pa yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no // lta ba dang / mnyan pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i yul du gyur pa la bsam pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bsam pa'o //
translated: Thus will is taught to be a particular object.üîΩThe object of thought is that which is the object of the activities of seeing, hearing, etc.

original: de la lta ba dang mnyan par 'dod pa ni don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba dang mnyan par 'dod pa ni don du gnyer ba'o //
