translated: The desire for seeing and hearing is the aspiration.

original: gal te 'dun pa 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yin na de'i tshe sred pa dang 'dun pa gnyis bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'dun pa 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yin na de'i tshe sred pa dang 'dun pa gnyis bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: If aspiration has the nature of desire, then what is the difference between craving and aspiration?

original: sred pa ni mngon par chags pa'i @210b mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: sred pa ni mngon par chags pa'i @210b mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Craving has the nature of attachment.

original: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas bye brag yod de /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas bye brag yod de /
translated: Aspiration has the nature of desire.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support the undertaking of effort.

original: mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conviction?üîΩIt is the firm apprehension of a thing that is ascertained as it truly is.

original: nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la nges pa smos pa ni mos pa'i yul yang thams cad ma yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la nges pa smos pa ni mos pa'i yul yang thams cad ma yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúascertained‚Äù is used because the object of conviction is not just anything.

original: nges pa med pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du nges par 'dzin mi srid do //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du nges par 'dzin mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to apprehend as ascertained a thing that is not ascertained.

original: rigs pa'am yid ches pa'i lung gi dngos po de la the tshom med pa gang yin pa de nges pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa'am yid ches pa'i lung gi dngos po de la the tshom med pa gang yin pa de nges pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of doubt with regard to a thing that is ascertained by reasoning or by a trustworthy scripture.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis de rnam par nges pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis dngos po de la sems 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis de rnam par nges pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis dngos po de la sems 'jog pa ste /
translated: The mind is fixed on the thing in the same mode in which it is ascertained, i.e., in the mode of impermanence, suffering, etc.

original: 'di ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin te /
translated: This is the way it is,

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
translated: and not otherwise.

original: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi las can te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi las can te /
translated: This is the function of resolve, i.e., it is the cause of non-defeat.

original: mos pa gces su byed pa ni phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las 'phrog par mi nus so //
analyzed: mos pa gces su byed pa ni phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las 'phrog par mi nus so //
translated: One who values resolve cannot be defeated by adversaries in regard to his own doctrine.

original: dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mindfulness?

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
translated: It is non-loss of attentiveness with regard to a familiar object.

original: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the mind‚Äôs expression.

original: 'dris pa ni ma 'dris pa la dran pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dris pa ni ma 'dris pa la dran pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression of the mind is mindfulness, because it is taught that there is no mindfulness where there is no expression.

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon myong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon myong ba'o //
translated: A familiar object is one that has been experienced before.

original: ma brjed pa ni dmigs pa la 'dzin pa chud mi za bar byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: ma brjed pa ni dmigs pa la 'dzin pa chud mi za bar byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Non-loss is the cause of non-forgetting of the object.

original: de ni sngon bzung ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang dang yang dran pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sngon bzung ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang dang yang dran pa'o //
translated: It is the repeated recollection of the aspect of the object that was previously grasped.

original: mngon par brjod pa nyid ni mngon par brjod pa dang 'dra bas mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa nyid ni mngon par brjod pa dang 'dra bas mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: Verbal expression is the verbal expression that is similar to the verbal expression.

original: mngon par brjod pa kho na mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa kho na mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: It is the verbal expression itself.

original: de ni dmigs pa mngon par brjod pa yod na dmigs pa gzhan nam rnam pa gzhan la sems g-yeng ba med pas de'i phyir mi g-yeng ba'i las can no //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa mngon par brjod pa yod na dmigs pa gzhan nam rnam pa gzhan la sems g-yeng ba med pas de'i phyir mi g-yeng ba'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of non-distraction, because when there is verbal expression of the object, the mind is not distracted to another object or another aspect.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration?

original: brtag pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtag pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind on a conceptually elaborated object.

original: brtag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: brtag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: A conceptually elaborated object is not something else.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin kyang yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin kyang yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, concentration is also shown to have a specific object.

original: brtag pa'i dngos po ni yon tan dang nyes pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa'i dngos po ni yon tan dang nyes pa'o //
translated: The conceptually elaborated object is either a virtue or a fault.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the state of having a single object.

original: 'dir rtse gcig ni dmigs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rtse gcig ni dmigs pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, one-pointedness is with respect to the object.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: When the mind is in equipoise, it is the basis of knowledge, because it is the thorough knowledge of reality just as it is.

original: yongs su shes pa'i phyir shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i phyir shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to serve as the basis of knowledge.

original: de la rtag pa'i dngos po ni @211a * //
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i dngos po ni @211a * //
translated: The thing that is constant is

original: bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: the four noble truths.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par brtags pas 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa ni yon tan no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par brtags pas 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa ni yon tan no //
translated: The truth of cessation and the truth of the path are virtues, because they are investigated in terms of the aspects of peacefulness, etc., and the aspects of definite release, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam par brtags pas sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni nyes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam par brtags pas sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni nyes pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering and the truth of the origin of suffering are faults, because they are investigated in terms of the aspects of impermanence, etc., and the aspects of cause, etc.

original: de bzhin dus dgu la 'og ma la ni nyes par lta gong ma la ni yon tan du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dus dgu la 'og ma la ni nyes par lta gong ma la ni yon tan du'o //
translated: In the same way, the lower truths are seen as faults and the higher truths as virtues.

original: de bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other objects of concentration, such as the general and particular characteristics, in accordance with the case.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is the discernment of those same objects.

original: rigs pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is produced by right means, by wrong means, and by other means.

original: de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni brtag pa'i dngos po nyid la ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni brtag pa'i dngos po nyid la ste /
translated: Those same objects refers to the very things that are investigated.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin bzhin du shes rab kyang yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin bzhin du shes rab kyang yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, like concentration, wisdom is also shown to have a specific object.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pas kyang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /üîΩrang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dres pa lta bu'i chos rnams la yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pas kyang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dres pa lta bu'i chos rnams la yang dag pa'am /
translated: Discernment is also discernment.

original: log par so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: log par so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the correct or incorrect discernment of mixed phenomena, that is, of general and particular characteristics.

original: rigs pa ni bshad ba ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni bshad ba ste /
translated: Right means is explanation.

original: yid ches pa'i lung dang ; rjes su dpag pa dang / mngon sum mo //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung dang ; rjes su dpag pa dang / mngon sum mo //
translated: It is the trustworthy scripture, inference, and direct perception.

original: rnam pa de gsum gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de gsum gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: That which is generated by the three modes is generated by reason.

original: de yang thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yang thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is derived from hearing, reflection, and meditative development.

original: de la yid ches pa'i gsung rab las skyes pa'i rtog pa ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la yid ches pa'i gsung rab las skyes pa'i rtog pa ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Among them, that derived from hearing is the conception that arises from a scripture that is authoritative.

original: rigs pa nges par bsam pa las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa nges par bsam pa las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That derived from reflection is that which arises from correct reasoning.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That derived from meditative development is that which arises from meditative concentration.

original: rigs ba ma yin pa ni yid ches pa ma yin pa'i lung dang / rjes su dpag ba ltar snang ba dang / log par bsam pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: rigs ba ma yin pa ni yid ches pa ma yin pa'i lung dang / rjes su dpag ba ltar snang ba dang / log par bsam pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: That which is not derived from reason is that which arises from an unauthoritative scripture, from a fallacious inference, and from a perverted meditative concentration.

original: rigs pa ma yin pa des bskyed pa ni rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa des bskyed pa ni rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: That which is generated by that which is not reason is generated by that which is not reason.

original: de la grangs can dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'i thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba ni yid ches pa ma yin pa'i lung gis bskyed pa dang / rtog gi ngan pas bskyed pa'i phyir rigs pa @211b ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la grangs can dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'i thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba ni yid ches pa ma yin pa'i lung gis bskyed pa dang / rtog gi ngan pas bskyed pa'i phyir rigs pa @211b ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from hearing and reflection of the Samkhyas, Vaisesikas, etc. is not generated by reasoning, because it is generated by scripture that is not authoritative and by bad reasoning.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi rtag pa dang chad par smra ba rnams kyi dang / kha cig rtag pa rnams kyi yang log bar bsam pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //üîΩskye bas thob pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad shes pa ni rigs pas bskyed ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi rtag pa dang chad par smra ba rnams kyi dang / kha cig rtag pa rnams kyi yang log bar bsam pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'o // skye bas thob pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad shes pa ni rigs pas bskyed ba yang ma yin /
translated: The wisdom that arises from the concentration of wrong reflection of those who are not free from desire, of those who advocate eternalism and nihilism, and of some eternalists is not generated by reasoning.

original: mi rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from birth and the mundane conventional wisdom are not generated by reasoning nor are they generated by non-reasoning.

original: 'di ni som nyi bzlog pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di ni som nyi bzlog pa'i las can te /
translated: This has the function of countering doubt,

original: som nyi bzlog pa ni shes rab kyis chos rab tu rnam par phye nas nges par thob pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: som nyi bzlog pa ni shes rab kyis chos rab tu rnam par phye nas nges par thob pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the countering of doubt is the attainment of certainty through the discrimination of phenomena by wisdom.

original: // / phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa'i bye brag tu bshad pa /
analyzed: // / phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa'i bye brag tu bshad pa /
translated: Commentary on the Compendium of AbhidharmaüîΩ

original: ba ma po gnyis pa /
analyzed: ba ma po gnyis pa /
translated: The second part of the commentary on the analysis of the five aggregates.

original: dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is faith?üîΩIt is conviction, longing, and clarity of mind with regard to actions, their results, the Truths, and the Jewels.

original: las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa dang / 'dod pa dang / sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba la las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa dang / 'dod pa dang / sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba la las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Actions are of three kinds:

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unmoving.

original: de la bsod nams ma yin pa ni mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la bsod nams ma yin pa ni mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Nonmeritorious action is only in the realm of desire, because it is associated with the unwholesome.

original: bsod nams ni rnam par smin pa nges ba med pa'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams ni rnam par smin pa nges ba med pa'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Meritorious action is only in the realm of desire, because its results are not fixed.

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba la g-yo ba med pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba la g-yo ba med pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Unmoving action is in the realm of form and the formless realm, because it is unshakable.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i rnam par smin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i rnam par smin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The result of nonmeritorious action is not desired in the realm of desire.

original: bsod nams kyi ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The result of meritorious action is desired.

original: mi g-yo ba'i rnam par smin pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i rnam par smin pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: The invariable result is the desire realm itself in the form and formless realms.üîΩFaith in the existence of karma and its result is the faith that has the aspect of conviction that karma and its result exist.

original: de la las dang 'bras bu gnyis yod par mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba yod pa dang / de yang 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la las dang 'bras bu gnyis yod par mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba yod pa dang / de yang 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Karma is virtuous or nonvirtuous, and its result is desirable or undesirable, respectively.

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba ste /üîΩdbang phyug la sogs pas sbrul pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log pa las dang 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel bar mngon par yid ches ba gang yin pa de
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba ste / dbang phyug la sogs pas sbrul pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log pa las dang 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel bar mngon par yid ches ba gang yin pa de
translated: Moreover, karma arises from the cause of virtue or nonvirtue.üîΩIt is not created by ƒ™≈õvara and so on.

original: ni las dang 'bras bu gnyis yod pa nyid du yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa'o //
analyzed: ni las dang 'bras bu gnyis yod pa nyid du yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa'o //
translated: Thus, faith in the existence of karma and its result is the faith that has the aspect of conviction that the nature of karma and its result is unmistaken and that karma and its result are related as cause and effect.

original: bden pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams te /
analyzed: bden pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams te /
translated: The truths are the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun @212a * //üîΩpa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du ma nor ba'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun @212a * // pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du ma nor ba'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: They are not mistaken with regard to the impermanence, etc. of the five appropriative aggregates, which are the effect, because they are not in accord with the noble ones.üîΩThe five appropriative aggregates, which are the effect, are the truth of suffering because they are not mistaken with regard to the impermanence, etc. of the five appropriative aggregates, which are the effect, because they are not in accord with the noble ones.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa dang / rkyen la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir rgyur gyur pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa dang / rkyen la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir rgyur gyur pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: Those very five appropriative aggregates, which are the cause, are the truth of origin because they are not mistaken with regard to the cause, condition, etc. of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa nye bar zhi ba'i bdag dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa nye bar zhi ba'i bdag dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering and its cause is the truth of cessation because it is not mistaken with regard to the self, peace, etc. of the cessation of suffering.üîΩThe path is the truth of the path because it is not mistaken with regard to the path, suitability, etc.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa thob par byed pa dang / nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa thob par byed pa dang / nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are unmistaken with regard to the aspects of the truths, such as the aspect of cessation that is the attainment of the cessation of suffering and the aspect of the truth of the path that is definite release.üîΩ

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //üîΩde la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gnyis la sdug bsngal yod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o // de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gnyis la sdug bsngal yod do //
translated: The eightfold noble path is the noble truth of the path, because it is the means to attain the cessation of suffering, because it is the means to definitely emerge from suffering, and so on, since it is unmistaken in its aspects.

original: kun 'byung ba yod do zhes yod par mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa nyid dang ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba yod do zhes yod par mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa nyid dang ba'o //
translated: Faith in the two truths of suffering and origination is the aspect of conviction that suffering exists and origination exists.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis la bdag gis 'gog pa thob par bya ba dang / lam bskyed par nus so snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis la bdag gis 'gog pa thob par bya ba dang / lam bskyed par nus so snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in the two truths of cessation and path is the aspect of desire that thinks, ‚ÄúI can attain cessation‚Äù and ‚ÄúI can generate the path.‚Äù

original: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
translated: The jewels are three:

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun rnams so //
translated: the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha.

original: dkon pa nyid dang / rin che ba nyid dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir rin po che dang 'dra bas na dkon mchog go //
analyzed: dkon pa nyid dang / rin che ba nyid dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir rin po che dang 'dra bas na dkon mchog go //
translated: They are jewels because they are rare, valuable, delightful, beneficial, and because they are the antidote to non-human beings and so on that cause harm.

original: de la dkon pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' srid pa dang longs spyod la ma chags pas lus dang srog la mi lta ba rgyun mi chad par byang chub kyi tshogs la zhugs pa rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas nyid bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thobüîΩpar bya ba yin pas na dkon pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dkon pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' srid pa dang longs spyod la ma chags pas lus dang srog la mi lta ba rgyun mi chad par byang chub kyi tshogs la zhugs pa rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas nyid bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thob par bya ba yin pas na dkon pa nyid do //
translated: They are rare because buddhahood is attained by those who are not attached to existence and enjoyments, who do not care for their bodies and lives, who continuously engage in the accumulations for enlightenment, and even by them, it is attained only after three incalculable aeons.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas 'byung ba nyid ni au dum b'a ra'i me tog 'byung ba dang 'dra bar dkon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas 'byung ba nyid ni au dum b'a ra'i me tog 'byung ba dang 'dra bar dkon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the arising of a buddha is said to be as rare as the arising of an udumbara flower.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la rag las pa'i phyir chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang dkon pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la rag las pa'i phyir chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang dkon pa nyid do //
translated: The jewels of Dharma and Sa·πÖgha are also rare because they depend on the arising of a buddha.

original: rin che ba nyid ni 'dod dgu mthar phyin pa'i gnas thob pa rnams kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis kas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin che ba nyid ni 'dod dgu mthar phyin pa'i gnas thob pa rnams kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis kas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is valuable because it is to be attained by the two stores of merit and knowledge of those who have attained the state of fulfilling all wishes.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa dang / tshul @212b khrims dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa dang / tshul @212b khrims dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang gsum mo //
translated: The store of merit consists of the perfections of generosity, morality, and patience.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The store of knowledge consists of the perfections of wisdom and meditation.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi yan lag gi dngos por gyur pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshogs gnyi gar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi yan lag gi dngos por gyur pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshogs gnyi gar gtogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is included in both stores because it is the entity that is the limb of the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: chos dkon mchog ni 'dus byas thams cad yongs su btang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rin che ba'o //
analyzed: chos dkon mchog ni 'dus byas thams cad yongs su btang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rin che ba'o //
translated: The jewel of Dharma is valuable because it is to be attained by the complete relinquishment of all conditioned things.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu 'grub pa las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu 'grub pa las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The jewel of Sangha is valuable because it is superior to the accomplishment of the fruit of cyclic existence.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis kyis thob par bya ba yin pas rin che ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis kyis thob par bya ba yin pas rin che ba'o //
translated: It is precious because it is attained through the two collections of merit and wisdom.

original: dkon mchog gsum ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rjes su dran na dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dga' ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas dga' bar byed pa'o //

translated: The Three Jewels are the cause of joy because they bring joy when seen, heard, or remembered.

original: 'di ltar bsu ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / brtsal ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba rnams kyis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa yin pas phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsu ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / brtsal ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba rnams kyis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa yin pas phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: They are helpful because they benefit sentient beings through welcoming, honoring, seeking, and understanding.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: khyod la bsu bas dpal du byed //
analyzed: khyod la bsu bas dpal du byed //

original: bsnyen bkur byas na bde bar byed //üîΩkun du tshol bas blo gros byed //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byas na bde bar byed // kun du tshol bas blo gros byed //
translated: Honoring brings you happiness.üîΩSeeking brings you intelligence.

original: yongs su shes byed rnam par sbyong //üîΩzhes bya ba brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes byed rnam par sbyong // zhes bya ba brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Understanding brings you purification.

original: mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa zhi bar byed pa ni mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa zhi bar byed pa ni mdo las ji skad du /

original: dge slong dag gal te khyod dgon pa na gnas kyang rung zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te khyod dgon pa na gnas kyang rung zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Monks, if you dwell in the wilderness,

original: 'jigs sam bag tsha ba'am sbu zing zhes byed pa'i bar du 'gyur ba de zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jigs sam bag tsha ba'am sbu zing zhes byed pa'i bar du 'gyur ba de zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: then whatever fear, terror, or trembling might arise will be pacified.

original: de bzhin du chos dkon mchog rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog rjes su dran pa la yang brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos dkon mchog rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog rjes su dran pa la yang brjod bar bya'o //
translated: The recollection of the Dharma Jewel and the Sa·πÖgha Jewel should be expressed in the same way.

original: de la shes bya thams cad la chags pa med cing thogs pa med par mkhyen pa'i mthu brnyes pas gnas gyur pa ni sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la shes bya thams cad la chags pa med cing thogs pa med par mkhyen pa'i mthu brnyes pas gnas gyur pa ni sangs rgyas te /
translated: The Buddha is the transformation of the basis, which is the attainment of the power of knowledge that is unobstructed and unattached to all objects of knowledge.

original: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon dang / bral ba zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon rgyas pa /
analyzed: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon dang / bral ba zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon rgyas pa /
translated: He is free from the seeds of all contaminated phenomena and has expanded the seeds of all uncontaminated phenomena.

original: mthu stobs mtha' yas pas yongs su bzung ba'i phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar lhun gyis grub par sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mthu stobs mtha' yas pas yongs su bzung ba'i phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar lhun gyis grub par sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par spyod pa'o //
translated: And like a wish-fulfilling gem, he spontaneously accomplishes the aims of all beings without exception, because he is endowed with infinite power and strength.

original: chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The Dharma is threefold:

original: bstan pa'i chos mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la @213a * //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la @213a * //
translated: the Dharma as teaching, which includes the class of sutras, the class of melodious narrations, and so on;

original: sogs pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'khor dang bcas pa dang / don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'khor dang bcas pa dang / don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: the Dharma as practice, which includes the noble path with its eight branches and its retinue; and the Dharma as ultimate truth, which is nirvana.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold:

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: with a remainder of the aggregates and without a remainder of the aggregates.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Among these, freedom from afflictions refers to the state with a remainder of the aggregates.

original: da ltar gyi skye ba 'gags nas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mi 'byung ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi skye ba 'gags nas ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba mi 'byung ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: When the present birth ceases, the future birth does not occur, which is the state without a remainder of the aggregates.

original: dge 'dun ni skyes bu gang zag brgyad de /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni skyes bu gang zag brgyad de /
translated: The Sangha is the eight types of noble beings:

original: 'jug pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
translated: the four who enter and the four who abide in the result.

original: phan tshun mi phyed pa dang ston pa mi phyed pa'i phyir dge 'dun no //
analyzed: phan tshun mi phyed pa dang ston pa mi phyed pa'i phyir dge 'dun no //
translated: They are called the Sangha because they are not divided from each other and because they are not divided from the Teacher.

original: yon tan dang nyes pa thams cad mchog tu phyin pa dang / bsal ba'i mthar phyin pa'i gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan dang nyes pa thams cad mchog tu phyin pa dang / bsal ba'i mthar phyin pa'i gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are the Sangha because they are the supreme field of merit for the world with its gods, humans, and demigods, because they are the supreme field for offerings, and because they are the supreme field for purification.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de la spu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma 'byung ba la sogs pas mtshon pa'i dang ba'i mtshan nyid ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de la spu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma 'byung ba la sogs pas mtshon pa'i dang ba'i mtshan nyid ni dad pa'o //

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba'i bdag nyid dang / thob par byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang ba'i mtshan nyid ni chos la dad pa'o //

analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam rdzab las rgal ba dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam rdzab las rgal ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir /

original: dge 'dun la dang ba'i bdag nyid ni dad pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir sred pa'am /
translated: and faith as desire, with regard to obtaining or producing what exists and is endowed with good qualities.

analyzed: 'dun pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Since faith is desire, wouldn‚Äôt it be either craving or aspiration?

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /

analyzed: dge ba yul yin pa'i phyir sred pa ma yin no //
translated: because faith is not craving, since the object of faith is good.

original: 'dun pa ni dad pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pas 'dun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni dad pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pas 'dun pa ma yin no //
translated: Faith is not aspiration, since aspiration is preceded by faith.

analyzed: sems dang ba zhes bya ba la dad pa ni sems kyi rnyog pa dang mi mthun pa ste /

translated: Aversion and confusion should be understood in the same way.

original: yid 'byung zhing mi len pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo la rtog pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung zhing mi len pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo la rtog pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind turns away from and does not grasp‚Äù indicates that nonattachment is a mental factor.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang / longs spyod rnams la kun du chags pa dang smon pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang / longs spyod rnams la kun du chags pa dang smon pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the desire and longing for existence and the objects of enjoyment.

original: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa ste /
translated: Its antidote is nonattachment.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la chags pa dang mi phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la chags pa dang mi phyogs pa'o //
translated: It is the non-inclination toward existence and the necessities of existence.

original: yid byung ba ni sred pa dang longs spyod kyi nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'i phyir srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la mi phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid byung ba ni sred pa dang longs spyod kyi nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'i phyir srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la mi phyogs pa'o //
translated: Disgust is the non-inclination toward existence and the necessities of existence, because of the thorough knowledge of the faults of craving and enjoyment.

original: mi len pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod gnyi ga la ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: mi len pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod gnyi ga la ma chags pa'o //
translated: Non-appropriation is non-attachment to both existence and enjoyment.

original: yang na mi len pa'i bye brag gi phyir yid byung ba smos te /
analyzed: yang na mi len pa'i bye brag gi phyir yid byung ba smos te /
translated: Or else, disgust is mentioned as a particular kind of non-appropriation.

original: srid pa dang / srid pa'i yo byad rnams la mi phyogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'i mi len pa de ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang / srid pa'i yo byad rnams la mi phyogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'i mi len pa de ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-appropriation is called non-attachment, which is the aspect of non-inclination toward existence and the necessities of existence.

original: 'di ni nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to provide a basis for not engaging in misdeeds.

original: zhe sdang med ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang med ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is absence of hatred?

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to hatred.

original: byams pa'o zhes bya ba la zhe sdang ni sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa'o zhes bya ba la zhe sdang ni sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
translated: Hatred is the malevolence toward sentient beings, suffering, and the things that cause suffering.

original: de'i gnyen po ni kun nas mnar sems pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni kun nas mnar sems pa med pa'o //
translated: Its antidote is the absence of malevolence.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni gzhan dag kyang yod pas de'i phyir byams pa smos te /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni gzhan dag kyang yod pas de'i phyir byams pa smos te /
translated: Since there are other antidotes to hatred, the root text specifies lovingkindness.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang med pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni zhe sdang med pa ste /
translated: Lovingkindness is the antidote to hatred, and it is the absence of hatred.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to provide a basis for not engaging in misdeeds.

original: gti mug med pa gang zhe na gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gti mug med pa gang zhe na gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
translated: What is nondelusion? It is the antidote to delusion.

original: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the correct understanding of what is correct.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa yin pas gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa yin pas gnyen po yin te /
translated: All virtuous entities are antidotes to the afflicted entities because they are incompatible with their occurrence.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa la yang dag par rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúwho have correctly realized the real nature of things.‚Äù

original: yang dag par phyin ci ma logs par rtogs @214b pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par phyin ci ma logs par rtogs @214b pa'o //
translated: They have correctly and unmistakenly realized the real nature of things.

original: de yang bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, that realization is twofold, according to its specific forms:

original: shes pa dang so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: knowledge and discernment.

original: shes pa yang rnam par smin pa dang / lung dang bsam pa dang / rtogs pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: shes pa yang rnam par smin pa dang / lung dang bsam pa dang / rtogs pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Knowledge is of four types, according to its specific causes: the cause of karmic maturation, the cause of verbal expression, the cause of reflection, and the cause of realization.

original: so sor rtog pa ni shes rab bstan pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni shes rab bstan pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: Discernment is wisdom accompanied by teaching.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang ting nge 'dzin rnams la bya'o //üîΩde la shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis 'grogs mi srid pas brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang ting nge 'dzin rnams la bya'o // de la shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis 'grogs mi srid pas brtson 'grus sam /
translated: Teaching refers to wisdom, effort, and concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is impossible for two substances of wisdom to accompany each other, discernment is the wisdom that is concomitant with either effort or concentration.

original: gang gi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma bton ma bcom yang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skabs mi 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma bton ma bcom yang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skabs mi 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is that by whose power the seeds of the defilements are not uprooted and destroyed, but the defilements do not get an opportunity to operate.

original: 'dir tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words here is as follows:

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i bdag nyid dang / so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa khyad par can ni gti mug med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i bdag nyid dang / so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa khyad par can ni gti mug med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The special knowledge which has the nature of knowing things as they really are and the nature of discernment is called non-delusion.

original: de'i phyir gti mug med pa ni nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gti mug med pa ni nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Therefore, non-delusion has the function of providing a basis for not engaging in misdeeds.

original: brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is VIGOR?

original: le lo'i gnyen po ste /üîΩdge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba la sbyor ba dman pa ni le lo ste /
analyzed: le lo'i gnyen po ste / dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba la sbyor ba dman pa ni le lo ste /
translated: It is the antidote to laziness.üîΩIt is the mental factor that is the delight in virtue.üîΩLaziness is the inferior application; it is the inactivity of the mind.

original: snyom las byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sems mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: snyom las byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sems mi spro ba'o //
translated: It is the non-delight in virtue and non-virtue.

original: de'i gnyen po ni brtson 'grus yin pas /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni brtson 'grus yin pas /
translated: Since vigor is the antidote to that,

original: de'i phyir le lo bzhin du gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba rnam par gcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir le lo bzhin du gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba rnam par gcad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to exclude the consequence that it is like laziness,

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äústriving is the mental factor that is the delight in virtue.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa can la spro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la spro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not delight in the afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can la spro ba ni smad pa yin pa'i phyir le lo nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la spro ba ni smad pa yin pa'i phyir le lo nyid do //
translated: Delight in the afflicted is laziness because it is reprehensible.üîΩIt is not striving because it is not delight in virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa can la shin tu goms pa'i phyir //üîΩrang gi ngang gis 'jug bzhin du de la spro bar bya ci dgos she na phal cher ni de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la shin tu goms pa'i phyir // rang gi ngang gis 'jug bzhin du de la spro bar bya ci dgos she na phal cher ni de lta mod kyi /
translated: Since one engages in the afflicted through habituation,üîΩwhat need is there to delight in it?

original: gang du spro ba la ltos pa yang cung zad yod do //
analyzed: gang du spro ba la ltos pa yang cung zad yod do //
translated: For the most part, this is so, but there are some who delight in it.üîΩMoreover, when it is associated with that, it is striving.

original: de yang gang dang mtshungs par ldan na go cha dang / sbyor ba dang ; mi 'god pa dang / mi ldog pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i chos gzhan rnams la yang sems mngon par spro ba de ni brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: de yang gang dang mtshungs par ldan na go cha dang / sbyor ba dang ; mi 'god pa dang / mi ldog pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i chos gzhan rnams la yang sems mngon par spro ba de ni brtson 'grus te /
translated: What is striving? It is the delight in virtue, which is the armoring process, the application, the nonabandonment, the nonretrogression, the non-satisfaction, and the delight in other virtues.

original: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su sgrub pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function consists of perfecting and accomplishing the wholesome.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni @215a * //üîΩji ltar dngos gzhi la 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni @215a * // ji ltar dngos gzhi la 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: It perfects the wholesome by means of the path of application and the path of vision.

original: yongs su sgrub pa ni de nyid legs par yongs su sbyang bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sgrub pa ni de nyid legs par yongs su sbyang bar byas pa'o //
translated: It accomplishes the wholesome by means of the path of cultivation.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is serenity?

original: gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to the bad factors.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the serviceability of body and mind.

original: lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len ni las su mi rung ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon rnams ti go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len ni las su mi rung ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon rnams ti go rims bzhin no //
translated: The bad factors of body and mind are unserviceability and the seeds of defiled dharmas, respectively.

original: de med na ni shin tu sbyangs pa yod pa'i phyir gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de med na ni shin tu sbyangs pa yod pa'i phyir gnyen po'o //
translated: Serenity is the antidote to these because it is the absence of these.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of serenity is the serviceability of body and mind.

original: de la lus las su rung ba ni lus kyi rang gi bya ba rnams la ldang ba yang ba gang las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus las su rung ba ni lus kyi rang gi bya ba rnams la ldang ba yang ba gang las byung ba'o //
translated: Physical pliancy is the lightness that comes from the body's ability to perform its own functions.

original: sems las su rung ba ni yang dag pa'i yid la byed pa la zhugs pa'i sems kyi sim pa dang yang bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba ni yang dag pa'i yid la byed pa la zhugs pa'i sems kyi sim pa dang yang bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Mental pliancy is a factor that is different from the mind and is the cause of the mind's suppleness and buoyancy when it is engaged in proper attention.

original: de dang ldan na dmigs pa la sems thogs pa med par 'jug pas de'i phyir sems las su rung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan na dmigs pa la sems thogs pa med par 'jug pas de'i phyir sems las su rung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When one possesses it, the mind engages its object without obstruction. Therefore it is called mental pliancy.

original: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par dga' bas zin pa la lus shin tu sbyang bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par dga' bas zin pa la lus shin tu sbyang bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Physical pliancy should be understood as a special physical sensation that is conjoined with pleasure.

original: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a sutra states, ‚ÄúWhen the mind is pleased, the body becomes pliant.‚Äù

original: 'dir lus shin tu sbyangs pa sems las byung ba ma yin du zin kyang sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pas shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir lus shin tu sbyangs pa sems las byung ba ma yin du zin kyang sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pas shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu bshad do //
translated: Although physical pliancy is not a mental factor, it is explained as the limb of enlightenment called ‚Äúpliancy‚Äù because this is the chapter on mental factors.

original: yang na lus las su rung ban yid ni sems las su rung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na lus las su rung ban yid ni sems las su rung ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, physical pliancy is said to be pliancy because it is the cause of mental pliancy.

original: de'i phyir sems las byung ba ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems las byung ba ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, although it is not a mental factor,

original: 'dir lus las su rung ba nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir lus las su rung ba nyid du brjod do //
translated: it is called physical pliancy here.

original: 'di ni de'i dbang gis gnas 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib ba ma lus pa sel ba'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i dbang gis gnas 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib ba ma lus pa sel ba'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of removing all obscurations such as affliction and so on because it is the basis for that.

original: bag yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bag yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is heedfulness?

original: bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to heedlessness.

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la bag med pa ni /
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la bag med pa ni /
translated: It is the cultivation of virtuous dharmas and the abandonment of nonvirtuous dharmas by abiding in nonattachment, up to effort.

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams las sems mi srung zhing dge ba rnams 'bri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams las sems mi srung zhing dge ba rnams 'bri bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is that by which one does not protect the mind from the defilements and diminishes the wholesome.

original: bag yod pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams spong zhing @215b de'i gnyen po'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams spong zhing @215b de'i gnyen po'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa ste /
translated: Carefulness is the abandonment of the defilements and the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment which are their counteragents.

original: de'i phyir bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen por bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen por bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that carefulness is the counteragent to carelessness.

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bcas par gzung /
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bcas par gzung /
translated: Non-greed, up to vigor should be understood as non-greed, non-hatred, non-delusion, and vigor.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa nas brtson 'grus la thug pa'i bar de dag la gnas pa ni brten pa dang / gnas bcas nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa nas brtson 'grus la thug pa'i bar de dag la gnas pa ni brten pa dang / gnas bcas nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba ste /
translated: One who is established in those, beginning with non-greed and ending with vigor, having taken up and maintained them, abandons the unwholesome dharmas.

original: 'dis ni ma chags pa la sogs pa thams cad bag yod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma chags pa la sogs pa thams cad bag yod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that all of non-greed, etc. are carefulness.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni zag pa dang / zag pa'i gnas yul rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni zag pa dang / zag pa'i gnas yul rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The unwholesome dharmas should be understood as the contaminants and the objects of the contaminants.

original: de la zag pa rnams sel ba dang / rnam par gnon pa dang / sa bon yang dag pa 'don pa'i bdag nyid ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa rnams sel ba dang / rnam par gnon pa dang / sa bon yang dag pa 'don pa'i bdag nyid ni spong ba'o //
translated: Abandonment is the nature of the removal of the contaminants, the suppression of the contaminants, and the complete removal of the seeds.

original: yul rnams ni yongs su spangs pas spong ngo //
analyzed: yul rnams ni yongs su spangs pas spong ngo //
translated: The objects are abandoned by means of the complete abandonment of the contaminants.

original: de'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnyen po rnams te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnyen po rnams te /
translated: The counteragents are the counteragents to unwholesome natures.

original: de dag kyang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: They are the wholesome natures with and without outflows.

original: sgom pa ni de dag goms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgom pa ni de dag goms par byed pa ste /
translated: Cultivation is the repeated practice of those.

original: yang dang yang mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the repeated manifestation of those.

original: 'di ltar brtson 'grus dang bcas pa'i ma chags pa la sogs pa la brten nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos kyang sgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtson 'grus dang bcas pa'i ma chags pa la sogs pa la brten nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos kyang sgom pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in dependence upon nonattachment, etc., which are accompanied by effort, one abandons the unwholesome natures and cultivates the wholesome natures which are their counteragents.

original: brtson 'grus yan chad dang bcas pa'i ma chags pa la bag yod pa gdags te /üîΩ'dis ni gnas dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus yan chad dang bcas pa'i ma chags pa la bag yod pa gdags te / 'dis ni gnas dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Hence, nonattachment, etc., which are accompanied by effort are designated as heedfulness.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa la bag yod pa gdags par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa la bag yod pa gdags par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that heedfulness is designated in regard to that which is accompanied by a basis or accompanied by a cause.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa dang ; 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa dang ; 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to perfect all mundane and supramundane excellences.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni srid pa dang / longs spyod kyi khyad par rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni srid pa dang / longs spyod kyi khyad par rnyed pa'o //
translated: Among them, mundane excellence is the attainment of the excellence of existence and the excellence of resources.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'o //
translated: Supramundane excellence is the attainment of the enlightenment of the sravakas and so on.

original: btang snyoms gang zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms gang zhe na /
translated: What is equanimity?

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag nyid la gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa bag yod pa bzhin du 'dir yang bshad par bya'o //üîΩsems mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis ni @216a * //
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag nyid la gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa bag yod pa bzhin du 'dir yang bshad par bya'o // sems mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis ni @216a * //
translated: As in the case of heedfulness, here too it should be explained as follows: ‚ÄúIt is the stability of the mind in nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion, and in the vigor that is their accompaniment.

original: btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang bar dang tha ma'i dus bstan to //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang bar dang tha ma'i dus bstan to //
translated: The three phrases beginning with ‚Äúthe equality of mind‚Äù indicate the initial, intermediate, and final stages of equanimity.

original: de la bying ba dang rgod pa ni sems mi mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de la bying ba dang rgod pa ni sems mi mnyam pa ste /
translated: Among them, depression and excitement are the inequality of mind.

original: de med pas thog mar sems mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pas thog mar sems mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Since that is absent, there is the sameness of mind at the outset.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'du byed pa med cing bsgrim mi dgos par mnyam par gzhog pa'i sems kyis ci rigs par mnyam par 'jug pa ni rnal du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'du byed pa med cing bsgrim mi dgos par mnyam par gzhog pa'i sems kyis ci rigs par mnyam par 'jug pa ni rnal du 'dug pa'o //
translated: After that, the mind that enters meditative equipoise effortlessly and spontaneously, as is appropriate, is the mind that is settled.

original: de'i dus na ni bsgoms nas ring po ma lon pa'i phyir bying ba dang rgod pa 'byung bar dogs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: de'i dus na ni bsgoms nas ring po ma lon pa'i phyir bying ba dang rgod pa 'byung bar dogs pa dang ldan no //
translated: At that time, one is apprehensive about the occurrence of laxity and excitement because one has not been practicing for a long time.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa khyad zhugs par gyur pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thag ring du gyur pa'i phyir gnyis 'byung du dogs pa med de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom pa khyad zhugs par gyur pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thag ring du gyur pa'i phyir gnyis 'byung du dogs pa med de /
translated: After that, because the cultivation becomes distinctive and its resistance is removed, one is not apprehensive about the occurrence of the two.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen po'i rgyu rnams la rtsol ba mi byed pas /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen po'i rgyu rnams la rtsol ba mi byed pas /
translated: Since one does not strive for the causes of the antidotes to laxity and excitement,

original: sems lhun gyis grub par gnas so //
analyzed: sems lhun gyis grub par gnas so //
translated: the mind rests spontaneously.

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal nas zhes bya ba la gang gis zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms nyid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal nas zhes bya ba la gang gis zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms nyid dang sbyar ro //
translated: Having cleared away the defiled dharmas, etc. ‚ÄúHaving cleared away‚Äù is connected with equanimity.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúafflicted phenomena‚Äù refers to those that are associated with attachment and so on.

original: de dag bsal na yang mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag bsal na yang mi skye ba'o //
translated: They are removed and do not arise again.

original: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang mi mthun pas gdon mi za bar des 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang mi mthun pas gdon mi za bar des 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas med do //
translated: Since equanimity is incompatible with remaining in an afflicted state, there is no doubt that it removes attachment and so on.

original: de'i phyir des bsal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir des bsal zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it removes them.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa ni btang snyoms dang mi mthun pas de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnas ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa ni btang snyoms dang mi mthun pas de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnas ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, since remaining in an afflicted state is incompatible with equanimity, therefore, one who remains in equanimity remains in a non-afflicted state.

original: de nyid kyi phyir btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i skabs mi 'byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i skabs mi 'byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: For this very reason, equanimity has the function of providing a basis for not creating the opportunity for affliction.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-violence?

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste /
translated: It is the antidote to violence.

original: snying rje ba'o zhes bya ba la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pas tho mi 'tshams shing sems can rnams la gnod pa mi byed pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje ba'o zhes bya ba la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pas tho mi 'tshams shing sems can rnams la gnod pa mi byed pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Non-violence is the absence of the intention to harm sentient beings by killing, binding, beating, threatening, etc.

original: rnam bar 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ni snying rje ba ste /üîΩbsod nyams bsrel ba'o //üîΩbsod nyams zhes bya ba ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: rnam bar 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ni snying rje ba ste / bsod nyams bsrel ba'o // bsod nyams zhes bya ba ni bde ba ste /
translated: Compassion is the antidote to violence.üîΩSympathy is the desire to unite others with happiness.

original: bde ba bsrel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba bsrel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Sympathy is the desire to unite others with happiness.üîΩIt is the antidote to cruelty.

original: snying rje can gyi pha rol sdug bsngal na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje can gyi pha rol sdug bsngal na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The compassionate person suffers when others suffer.

original: 'di yang bag yod pa bzhin du btags pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di yang bag yod pa bzhin du btags pa nyid do //
translated: Like heedfulness, it is a designation and not a substance.

original: zhe sdang med pa'i cha la btags ba'i phyir rdzas @216b su yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa'i cha la btags ba'i phyir rdzas @216b su yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a substance, for it is designated in the portion of the absence of hatred.

original: tho mi 'tshams pa'i las can no //
analyzed: tho mi 'tshams pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is that of counteracting cruelty.

original: dge ba bcu gcig bshad zin to //
analyzed: dge ba bcu gcig bshad zin to //
translated: The eleven virtuous factors have been explained.

original: nyon mongs pa drug brjod par bya ba de dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug brjod par bya ba de dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: The six secondary defilements should be mentioned after the defilements, so they will be mentioned now.

original: 'dod chags gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags gang zhe na /
translated: What is desire?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la zhen pa dang lhag par chags pa'o zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la zhen pa dang lhag par chags pa'o zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang /
translated: The five aggregates of form, feeling, conception, formations, and consciousness that are associated with the outflows are the appropriated aggregates of form, feeling,

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: conception, formations, and consciousness.

original: de la gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po ni khams gnyis kyi gzugs tshor ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni khams gsum pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po ni khams gnyis kyi gzugs tshor ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni khams gsum pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The appropriated aggregate of form is the form of the two realms. The four appropriated aggregates of feeling, etc., are the feelings, etc., of the three realms.

original: 'dis srid pa gsum du srid pa skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'dis srid pa gsum du srid pa skye ba'am /
translated: Since it is the cause of the arising of existence in the three realms,

original: yang srid pa'i las len pas na /
analyzed: yang srid pa'i las len pas na /
translated: or since it is the cause of appropriating the karma of renewed existence,

original: sred pa la nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa la nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: craving is called appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa las byung ba dang / nye bar len pa la rag lus pa dang / de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa las byung ba dang / nye bar len pa la rag lus pa dang / de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: The aggregates are called appropriating aggregates because they arise from the appropriating aggregates, they depend on the appropriating aggregates, and the appropriating aggregates arise from them.

original: 'jen pa dang 'dra bas zhen pa ste /
analyzed: 'jen pa dang 'dra bas zhen pa ste /
translated: They are called clinging aggregates because they are like a clinging.

original: ji ltar 'bru mar la sogs pa'i snum ras la sogs pa'i gnas la zhugs te mched pa shin tu bsgrims kyang rang gi gnas nas dbyung bar dka' ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bru mar la sogs pa'i snum ras la sogs pa'i gnas la zhugs te mched pa shin tu bsgrims kyang rang gi gnas nas dbyung bar dka' ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as oil that has soaked into a cloth is difficult to remove even with great effort,

original: 'dod chags kyang rang gi dmigs pa la zhugs nas mched pa ni 'bad pa chen pos kyang dmigs pa de dang dbral bar dka' bas zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang rang gi dmigs pa la zhugs nas mched pa ni 'bad pa chen pos kyang dmigs pa de dang dbral bar dka' bas zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: so too attachment, having entered and spread over its object, is difficult to remove from that object even with great effort.

original: lhag par chags ba ni de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: lhag par chags ba ni de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Excessive attachment is its nature.

original: yang na reg bya'i khyad par la yang snum pa zhes bya ba yod pa de dang rnam par dbye ba'i phyir lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang na reg bya'i khyad par la yang snum pa zhes bya ba yod pa de dang rnam par dbye ba'i phyir lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Or, excessive attachment is mentioned in order to distinguish it from oiliness, which is a particular type of tangible object.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun bskyed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun bskyed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to generate all suffering.

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ji ltar mthun mthun du khams gsum pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal du brjod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ji ltar mthun mthun du khams gsum pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal du brjod de /
translated: The five aggregates of the three realms are described as suffering, in accordance with the three kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de yang 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa'i dbang gis mngon par 'grub pa de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi las ni sdug bsngal kun bskyed par bshad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa'i dbang gis mngon par 'grub pa de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi las ni sdug bsngal kun bskyed par bshad do //
translated: Suffering is produced by the power of craving for the realms of desire, form, and formlessness. Therefore, attachment is said to generate all suffering.

original: khong khro ba gang zhe na /üîΩsems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba la kun nas mnar sems @217a * //
analyzed: khong khro ba gang zhe na / sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba la kun nas mnar sems @217a * //
translated: What is repugnance?üîΩIt is a malevolence toward sentient beings.

original: pa ni sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa ste /
translated: Malevolence is a harshness of mind toward sentient beings.

original: des non na sems can rnams la gsod pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa bya bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: des non na sems can rnams la gsod pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa bya bar sems pa'o //
translated: When one is seized by it, one thinks of injuring sentient beings by killing, binding, and so on.

original: 'di ni reg par mi gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni reg par mi gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to obstruct contact and to support bad conduct.

original: reg pa ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni bde ba ste /
translated: Contact is pleasure.

original: de dang lhan cig gnas pa ni reg par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig gnas pa ni reg par gnas pa'o //
translated: To dwell with that is to dwell with contact.

original: reg par gnas pa ma yin ba ni reg par mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: reg par gnas pa ma yin ba ni reg par mi gnas pa ste /
translated: To not dwell with that is to not dwell with contact.

original: sdug bsngal dang lhan cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang lhan cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: to dwell with suffering.

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems yod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir sems la gdung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems yod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir sems la gdung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is a hostile mind, there is certainly mental distress, and so the mind is tormented.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'gyur ba'i phyir lus la yang gdung bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'gyur ba'i phyir lus la yang gdung bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: And because the body is affected by the mind, the body is also tormented.

original: de ltar de spyod lam thams cad du sdug bsngal dang bcas shing phongs pa dang bcas par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de spyod lam thams cad du sdug bsngal dang bcas shing phongs pa dang bcas par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one dwells in all activities with suffering and with distress.

original: zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One has a hostile mind.

original: nyes par spyod pa gang dang yang ring ba ma yin pas khong khro ba ni reg par mi gnas ba dang nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can du bshad do //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa gang dang yang ring ba ma yin pas khong khro ba ni reg par mi gnas ba dang nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can du bshad do //
translated: Since one is not far from any misdeed, hostility is explained as having the function of being the basis for not dwelling with contact and for misdeeds.

original: nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is pride?

original: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are seven types of pride.

original: nga rgyal ni thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'byung ba'i sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: nga rgyal ni thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'byung ba'i sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Pride is the characteristic of the mind's haughtiness that arises in dependence on the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag la bdag dang bdag gir dngos por sgro btags nas 'di ni bdag go 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes de dang de'i khyad par gyis bdag khengs shing gzhan dag las lhag par rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag la bdag dang bdag gir dngos por sgro btags nas 'di ni bdag go 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes de dang de'i khyad par gyis bdag khengs shing gzhan dag las lhag par rlom sems pa'o //
translated: Thus, having exaggerated the five aggregates to be a self and what belongs to a self, one is conceited about that self and thinks oneself superior to others because of one's particular qualities.

original: 'di ni mi gus pa dang / sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi gus pa dang / sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to serve as the basis for disrespect and the arising of suffering.

original: mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang / gang zag yon tan can rnams la 'gying zhing lus dang ngag gi sri zhu med pa'o //
