original: gang gi tshe bdag gi rgyun du gyur pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig la bdag tu lta ba'i tshe gzhan la ni bdag gir lta'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gi rgyun du gyur pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig la bdag tu lta ba'i tshe gzhan la ni bdag gir lta'o //
translated: The phrase that which is not a self refers to the five grasping heaps.üîΩThe phrase

original: 'di ni lta ba thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support all views.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
translated: With regard to that very self, one views it as permanent or annihilated.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i stobs kyis de'i 'byung ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni de la dbang byed do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i stobs kyis de'i 'byung ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni de la dbang byed do //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the dominant condition for the view of the self, because it arises by the power of the view of the transitory collection.

original: rtag pa'am chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas dngos po gang la bdag tu dmigs pa de nyid la ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'am chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas dngos po gang la bdag tu dmigs pa de nyid la ste /
translated: With regard to that very entity that is observed as a self by the view of the transitory collection, one views it as permanent or annihilated.

original: rtag pa ni ther zug go //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ther zug go //
translated: Permanent means eternal.

original: chad pa zhes bya ba la chad pa ni 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba med par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa zhes bya ba la chad pa ni 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba med par 'jig pa'o //
translated: Annihilated means destroyed without rebirth.

original: yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i shes rab nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is afflicted wisdom that views things in a distorted manner.

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to obstruct the path of the middle way that leads to liberation.

original: dbu ma'i lam ni rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pa spangs nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam ni rtag pa dang chad par 'dzin pa spangs nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: The middle way is the knowledge of dependent origination, having abandoned the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: rgyu'am 'bras bu'am byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yang khyad par can la bya'i /
analyzed: rgyu'am 'bras bu'am byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yang khyad par can la bya'i /
translated: The expression ‚Äúdenial of cause, effect, or action, or the destruction of an existent thing‚Äù and so on refers to a specific case,

original: thams cad la ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i las can dang / mi dge /
analyzed: thams cad la ni ma yin no // 'di ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i las can dang / mi dge /
translated: not to all cases.üîΩThis is the action of severing the roots of virtue and the action of firmly grasping the roots of nonvirtue.

original: ba'i rtsa ba dam du 'dzin pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba dam du 'dzin pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: The view that holds as paramountüîΩWhat is the view that holds as paramount?

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa la dam par 'dzin pas lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa la dam par 'dzin pas lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view that holds as paramount is the grasping of views and so on as being paramount.üîΩThe three types of views are the view of the transitory collection, the extreme view, and the false view.üîΩThe view that holds as paramount is the grasping of views and so on as being paramount.

original: lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba @221b dang ; log par lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba po'i lus zhes bya ba gang yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba @221b dang ; log par lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba po'i lus zhes bya ba gang yin pa dag ste /
translated: The three types of views are the view of the transitory collection, the extreme view, and the false view.

original: gang dag la brten nas lta ba rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag la brten nas lta ba rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is that on the basis of which views arise.

original: de'i gnas la mchog dang gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog la sogs pa'i sgra de dag don mtshungs mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i gnas la mchog dang gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang dam pa zhes bya ba ni mchog la sogs pa'i sgra de dag don mtshungs mod kyi /
translated: The terms ‚Äúsupreme,‚Äù ‚Äúchief,‚Äù ‚Äúdistinguished,‚Äù and ‚Äúexcellent‚Äù are synonymous.

original: gcig gis gcig bshad pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bshad pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: They are mentioned in order to explain each other.

original: 'di ni lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its function is to serve as the basis for attachment to bad views.

original: lta ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa yon tan gyi ngo bor 'dzin pas de yongs su mi gtong ba'i sgro nas 'di ni lta ba thams cad kyi rten byed par bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: lta ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa yon tan gyi ngo bor 'dzin pas de yongs su mi gtong ba'i sgro nas 'di ni lta ba thams cad kyi rten byed par bshad pa yin no ;
translated: Since it is the apprehension of the characteristics of views as having the nature of good qualities, it is explained that it serves as the basis for all views because it does not abandon them.

original: / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas phung po rnams la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / de'i gnas phung po rnams la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Morality and spiritual disciplines and the aggregates that are their bases.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims spong ba ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims spong ba ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the avoidance of immorality.

original: cha byad dang / tshul dang / lus dang / ngag gi 'jug pa nges par byed pa ni brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: cha byad dang / tshul dang / lus dang / ngag gi 'jug pa nges par byed pa ni brtul zhugs so //
translated: Spiritual disciplines are the determination of the forms, manners, bodily and verbal conduct.

original: phung po gang dag la brten nas tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs 'byung ba'i phung po de dag tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi gnas so //
analyzed: phung po gang dag la brten nas tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs 'byung ba'i phung po de dag tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi gnas so //
translated: The aggregates in dependence upon which morality and asceticism arise are the basis of morality and asceticism.

original: lta ba ngan pa la yon tan du bzung nas de mngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs la dam par 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa la yon tan du bzung nas de mngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs la dam par 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Morality and asceticism are held to be supreme when one holds bad views to be good and holds the morality and asceticism which manifest them to be supreme.

original: de'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas mchog tu 'dzin pa sngar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas mchog tu 'dzin pa sngar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the holding of morality and asceticism to be supreme is explained first.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs 'dis sdig pa'i dri ma sel zhing dag par byed pas dag pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs 'dis sdig pa'i dri ma sel zhing dag par byed pas dag pa'o //
translated: This morality and asceticism is pure because it removes and purifies the stains of immorality.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol bar byed pas grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol bar byed pas grol ba'o //
translated: It is liberation because it liberates from the bondage of the defilements.

original: 'dis 'khor ba las nges par 'byin par byed pas nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'khor ba las nges par 'byin par byed pas nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is definite release because it causes definite release from cyclic existence.

original: nges par 'byin pa ni thar pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa ni thar pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Definite release is a synonym for the path of liberation.

original: yang dag par rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase he views correctly means that he has understanding.

original: tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs bdag po la sogs pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs bdag po la sogs pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase he has understanding that is dominated by the view that morality and ascetic practices are supreme means that he has understanding that is dominated by the view that morality and ascetic practices are the cause of purity.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is defiled because it is based on a mistaken view.

original: 'di ni ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support the useless pursuit of austerities.

original: the tshom gang zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gang zhe na /
translated: What is doubt?

original: bden pa la sogs pa la gang yin gnyis @222a * //
analyzed: bden pa la sogs pa la gang yin gnyis @222a * //
translated: It is indecision about the truths, etc.

original: za ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: za ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase about the truths, etc. includes action, results of action, and the Three Jewels.

original: yin nam ma yin zhes som nyi yod pa ni yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: yin nam ma yin zhes som nyi yod pa ni yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: Indecision means not knowing whether something is or is not.

original: 'di shes rab las rang bzhin tha dad par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di shes rab las rang bzhin tha dad par blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that doubt is a separate mental factor from discernment.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support the non-cultivation of virtue.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams la du zhig ni kun du brtags pa kho na yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams la du zhig ni kun du brtags pa kho na yin /
translated: How many of the afflictions such as attachment are only imaginary?

original: du zhig lhan cig skyes pa dang / kun du brtags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig lhan cig skyes pa dang / kun du brtags pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are innate and imaginary?

original: lta ba gsum po de dag ni gong ma la yang 'gol bas de'i phyir 'og ma zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lta ba gsum po de dag ni gong ma la yang 'gol bas de'i phyir 'og ma zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The three views are also present in the higher realms, therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúthe lower realms.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang log par lta ba dang / lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang log par lta ba dang / lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They are the view of annihilation, the view that holds extremes, and the view that holds moral discipline and ascetic practice to be paramount.

original: 'di dag nyi tshe kun du brtags pa yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag nyi tshe kun du brtags pa yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only these three views are imaginary,

original: the tshom yang kun du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom yang kun du brtags pa'o //
translated: but doubt is also imaginary.

original: lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / kun du brtags pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / kun du brtags pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: The remaining afflictions are both innate and imaginary.

original: lhag ma rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the remaining afflictions?

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal rnams dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal rnams dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
translated: They are attachment, anger, ignorance, pride, the view of the transitory collection, and the view that grasps an extreme.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The afflictions have been explained.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod dgos pas de dag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod dgos pas de dag bshad par bya'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions should be mentioned, so they will be explained.

original: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúImmediately‚Äù means in the present,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: not in the future or the past.

original: gnod par byed pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa gzung ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa gzung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúResiding in the object of anger‚Äù means grasping the object of anger.

original: 'dis ni khro bo'i yul bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni khro bo'i yul bstan to //
translated: This shows the object of anger.

original: khro bo ni de ltar nyid gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la 'jug gi //
analyzed: khro bo ni de ltar nyid gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la 'jug gi //
translated: Anger engages in the object of anger in this way,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: not otherwise.

original: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par shes pa dang 'brel ba can dang rang gi ngo bo yang bstan to //
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par shes pa dang 'brel ba can dang rang gi ngo bo yang bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúMental belligerence‚Äù shows that it is associated with consciousness and indicates its intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ni kun nas mnar sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas khong khro ba dang tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas mnar sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas khong khro ba dang tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Since it is by nature belligerence, it is not different from anger.

original: 'di ni khong khro ba'i cha'i khyad par la btags pa'i phyir khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni khong khro ba'i cha'i khyad par la btags pa'i phyir khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid de /
translated: It is called a part of anger because it is a special part of anger.

original: 'phral du gnod par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral du gnod par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: It is a mental factor that torments the mind with regard to sentient beings and non-sentient entities that are objects of harm, on the basis of the aspect of harm.

original: dbyug pa len pa @222b la sogs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can gang yin pa de khro ba zhes gdags so //
analyzed: dbyug pa len pa @222b la sogs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can gang yin pa de khro ba zhes gdags so //
translated: It has the function of supporting the taking up of a stick, etc.

original: khros pa'i 'og tu 'dis bdag la gnod pa 'di byas so zhes shar gnyer ba'i bdag nyid de'i mdud par 'dzin pa mi gtong bar rgyun du 'byung pa ni kho na du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: khros pa'i 'og tu 'dis bdag la gnod pa 'di byas so zhes shar gnyer ba'i bdag nyid de'i mdud par 'dzin pa mi gtong bar rgyun du 'byung pa ni kho na du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: After anger, this is the state of mind that does not let go of the knot of holding a grudge, thinking, ‚ÄúThis person did this harm to me,‚Äù and it continues to arise. It is holding a grudge.

original: mi bzod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of supporting intolerance.

original: mi bzod pa ni gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: mi bzod pa ni gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam par mi byed kyi /
translated: Intolerance is not the state of mind that ignores harm.

original: phyir gnod pa byed 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir gnod pa byed 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the state of mind that wishes to harm in return.

original: 'di yang khro ba bzhin du zhe sdang gi gnas kyi khyad par la btags pa yin pas btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang khro ba bzhin du zhe sdang gi gnas kyi khyad par la btags pa yin pas btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is also a designation for a special object of anger, like anger itself. Therefore, it should be understood as existing as a designation.

original: 'chags pa ni 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'jigs ba la sog pa bsal te /
analyzed: 'chags pa ni 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'jigs ba la sog pa bsal te /
translated: Concealment is the desire to hide one's faults when one has committed an offense.

original: de la phan par 'dod pa'i gleng bar byed pas dus su khyod 'di lta bu byed pa'o zhes bsnyad pa la gti mug gi char gtogs pas kha na ma thob ma khyud pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan par 'dod pa'i gleng bar byed pas dus su khyod 'di lta bu byed pa'o zhes bsnyad pa la gti mug gi char gtogs pas kha na ma thob ma khyud pa'o //
translated: When one who is concerned about one's welfare points out to one at the proper time, You have done such and such, one conceals one's offense out of delusion.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'i rnam pa yin pas gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'i rnam pa yin pas gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Concealment is a form of concealing an offense, and therefore it is a part of delusion.

original: 'di ni 'gyod pa dang reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyod pa dang reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support regret and lack of serenity.

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: 'di ltar kha na ma tho ba mkhyud na 'gyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kha na ma tho ba mkhyud na 'gyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one conceals an offense, one will have regret.

original: 'gyod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur bas reg par mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'gyod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur bas reg par mi gnas so //
translated: If one has regret, one will certainly be accompanied by mental distress, and so one will lack serenity.

original: tshig brlang po zhes bya ba ni mtshang 'bru ba'i tshul gyis zhe gcod pa dang / tshig rtsub po zher 'debs par byed pa'i ngang tshul ni zher 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: tshig brlang po zhes bya ba ni mtshang 'bru ba'i tshul gyis zhe gcod pa dang / tshig rtsub po zher 'debs par byed pa'i ngang tshul ni zher 'debs pa ste /
translated: Scorn is the nature of a contemptuous attitude.

original: de'i dngos po ni zher 'debs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni zher 'debs pa nyid do //
translated: Scornfulness is the nature of scorn.

original: tshig brlang pos za ba dang 'dra bar tshig brlang por zher 'debs pa nyid ni 'tshig pa'o //
analyzed: tshig brlang pos za ba dang 'dra bar tshig brlang por zher 'debs pa nyid ni 'tshig pa'o //
translated: Scornfulness is like a harsh word that hurts.

original: 'di yang khro ba dang / kho na du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di yang khro ba dang / kho na du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Since this is preceded by anger and resentment, it is a form of mental cruelty. Therefore, it is included in anger.

original: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist as a separate substance.

original: 'di ni ngag gi nyes par sbyong ba skyed pa'i las can dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i las can te de dang ldan pa'i gang zag dang 'grogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gi nyes par sbyong ba skyed pa'i las can dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i las can te de dang ldan pa'i gang zag dang 'grogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its function is to generate verbal misconduct and to make it impossible to enjoy contact with others, because a person who has it is difficult to be with.

original: phrag dog ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mthong nas zhe sdang gi char mngon par gtogs pa'i sems khong nas 'khrugs pa ste /
analyzed: phrag dog ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mthong nas zhe sdang gi char mngon par gtogs pa'i sems khong nas 'khrugs pa ste /
translated: Jealousy is an inner disturbance of mind that is a part of hatred, which occurs when one sees the good qualities of another, such as gain, honor, fame, family, morality, or learning.

original: rang gi bsam pa la khyab par 'khrugs pas khong nas @223a * //
analyzed: rang gi bsam pa la khyab par 'khrugs pas khong nas @223a * //
translated: It is an inner disturbance because it disturbs the mind by pervading it with a sense of dissatisfaction.

original: 'khrugs pa'o // 'di ni yid mi bde ba dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i las can no //üîΩzin pa'i dngos po chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa'i bdag nyid rnams gang gi phyir mchod pa dang / phan 'dogs par 'dod pas 'dod pa'am /üîΩmi 'dod pa la yang rung ste sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa'o // 'di ni yid mi bde ba dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i las can no // zin pa'i dngos po chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa'i bdag nyid rnams gang gi phyir mchod pa dang / phan 'dogs par 'dod pas 'dod pa'am / mi 'dod pa la yang rung ste sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: Its function is to support unhappiness and lack of satisfaction.üîΩGenerosity is the giving of possessed things to others out of a desire to benefit or please them, whether they want it or not.

original: de yod na sbyin pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yod na sbyin pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called generosity because it is the opposite of stinginess, which is the desire to keep things to oneself.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen nas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams la 'dod chags kyi shas kyis sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa dang / yongs su mi gtong bar 'dod pa ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen nas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams la 'dod chags kyi shas kyis sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa dang / yongs su mi gtong bar 'dod pa ni ser sna'o //
translated: It is the mental factor that, due to the power of attachment to gain and honor, holds on to and does not give up the necessities of life.

original: 'di ni yo byad ma bsnyungs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni yo byad ma bsnyungs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support not being satisfied with few necessities.

original: yo byad ma bsnyungs pa ni ser snas yo byad mi mkho ba rnams kyang sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yo byad ma bsnyungs pa ni ser snas yo byad mi mkho ba rnams kyang sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not being satisfied with few necessities means not being satisfied with few necessities due to stinginess.

original: rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is its cause?üîΩIt is the teaching of false objects in order to deceive others.

original: gzhan la slu ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan la slu ba'i bsam pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i don gzhan du gnas la gnas gzhan du ston pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la slu ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan la slu ba'i bsam pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i don gzhan du gnas la gnas gzhan du ston pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching of objects that are not real, such as morality and so on, in order to deceive others with the intention of gaining and honor.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags dang gti mug gnyis kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan ston pas na de gnyis 'dus pa la gdags te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags dang gti mug gnyis kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan ston pas na de gnyis 'dus pa la gdags te /
translated: It is imputed in the combination of both attachment and delusion, because it teaches false qualities.

original: khro bo la sogs pa bzhin du btags pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: khro bo la sogs pa bzhin du btags pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is a designation, like anger, etc.

original: rdzas su ni med do //
analyzed: rdzas su ni med do //
translated: It does not exist as a substance.

original: log pas 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can te /üîΩlus dang ngag gi tshul 'chos pas zin pa'i mal cha la sogs pa nye bar 'tsho'i /
analyzed: log pas 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can te / lus dang ngag gi tshul 'chos pas zin pa'i mal cha la sogs pa nye bar 'tsho'i /
translated: Its action is to support a false livelihood.üîΩOne lives by means of a bed, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas rnyed pas ni ma yin pa ni log pas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas rnyed pas ni ma yin pa ni log pas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that is taken up by the hypocrisy of body and speech, and not by means of that which is obtained by right effort.

original: g-yo gang zhe na /üîΩbdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ba ste /
analyzed: g-yo gang zhe na / bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ba ste /
translated: What is DECEIT?üîΩIt is a crookedness of mind that conceals one's faults.

original: sems gya gyu ba'o zhes bya ba la bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs ni gzhan mgo rmongs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems gya gyu ba'o zhes bya ba la bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs ni gzhan mgo rmongs par byed pa ste /
translated: Concealing one's faults means confusing others,

original: de yang gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur zhing gtam rlung skur ba dang / bsal bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur zhing gtam rlung skur ba dang / bsal bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: changing the subject, and not clarifying the truth.

original: de'i phyir g-yo dang 'chab pa gnyis tha dad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yo dang 'chab pa gnyis tha dad de /
translated: Therefore, deceit and hypocrisy are different.

original: de ni dngos su mkhyud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos su mkhyud par byed pa'o //
translated: The former directly conceals,

original: 'di ni bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ba ste /
translated: while the latter is a crookedness of mind that conceals one's faults.

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of that.

original: sems gya gyu ba ni mi drang ba ste /
analyzed: sems gya gyu ba ni mi drang ba ste /
translated: Crookedness of mind is dishonesty.

original: de dang ldan na sems lam drang por mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de dang ldan na sems lam drang por mi 'jug go //
translated: When one possesses it, the mind does not enter the right path.

original: 'di ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags nas 'dod chags dang gti mug de gnyis kyi bdag @223b gi nyes pa bcab pa'i phyir mgo rmongs par byed pas de gnyis 'dus pa la de gdags so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags nas 'dod chags dang gti mug de gnyis kyi bdag @223b gi nyes pa bcab pa'i phyir mgo rmongs par byed pas de gnyis 'dus pa la de gdags so //
translated: It is a combination of attachment and delusion, for it is by means of these two that one hides one's faults when one is attached to gain and honor.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rnyed pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rnyed pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct the acquisition of good advice.

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ni gang rnyed na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ni gang rnyed na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Good advice is that by which one correctly reflects on the Teaching.

original: de'i bar chad byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bar chad byed pa'o //
translated: It is obstructed by crookedness.

original: rgyags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conceit?

original: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa'i bar du dga' ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa'i bar du dga' ba ste /
translated: It is self-satisfaction in one's possessions.

original: sems yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs dang nad med pa dang / gzugs dang / lang tsho la bab pa dang / stobs dang / phyug pa dang / blo dang / yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa ni rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs dang nad med pa dang / gzugs dang / lang tsho la bab pa dang / stobs dang / phyug pa dang / blo dang / yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa ni rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the mind is held refers to the highest degree of one's own excellence, such as one's spiritual lineage, good health, physical appearance, youthfulness, strength, wealth, intelligence, and mental acuity.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'i bye brag go //
translated: The phrase a special form of joy refers to a particular type of joy.

original: sems yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya bas ni dga' ba'i bye brag nyid ston te /
analyzed: sems yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya bas ni dga' ba'i bye brag nyid ston te /
translated: The phrase the mind is held indicates that it is a special form of joy.

original: dga' ba'i bye brag gang gis sems rang dbang med par byed pa des de bdag gi dbang du bya ba byed pas yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i bye brag gang gis sems rang dbang med par byed pa des de bdag gi dbang du bya ba byed pas yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind is held by a special form of joy that causes the mind to be uncontrollably drawn to an object.

original: de'i phyir sems yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the mind is held.

original: 'dir ni mdor na dga' ba'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i sred pa'i rnam pa la rgyags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mdor na dga' ba'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i sred pa'i rnam pa la rgyags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, here in this chapter, intoxication is a type of craving that is accompanied by a special form of joy.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support all the root and secondary mental afflictions.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni /üîΩgsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa gnod pa sna tshogs kyis /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni / gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa gnod pa sna tshogs kyis /
translated: Harmfulness

original: sems can rnams la 'tshe bas rnam par 'tshe ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'tshe bas rnam par 'tshe ba ste /
translated: Harmfulness is the desire to harm sentient beings by various means such as killing, binding, beating, and threatening.üîΩIts action is to torment.üîΩIt torments sentient beings by killing, binding, and so on.

original: 'dis gsad pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir /üîΩrnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis gsad pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir / rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
translated: It produces suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: de ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
translated: It is a form of anger.

original: snying brtse ba med pa dang / snying rje med pa dang / brtse ba med pa'o //üîΩsnying brtse ba med pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang gsod pa la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa dang gzhan dag byed pa mthong ngam ;
analyzed: snying brtse ba med pa dang / snying rje med pa dang / brtse ba med pa'o //üîΩsnying brtse ba med pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang gsod pa la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa dang gzhan dag byed pa mthong ngam ;
translated: It is the absence of compassion, mercy, and affection.üîΩThese three terms, absence of compassion, etc., refer to the absence of the desire to help sentient beings, the absence of the desire to bring them happiness, and the absence of the desire to bring them freedom from suffering, respectively.

original: thos na rjes su yi rang ba rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thos na rjes su yi rang ba rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Those who hear it rejoice in it.

original: yang na gcig gis gcig bshad do //
analyzed: yang na gcig gis gcig bshad do //
translated: Or else, they explain each other.

original: 'di ni mdor na khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mdor na khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
translated: This is, in brief, the category of anger.üîΩIt is a harsh thought toward sentient beings, a thought that is violent toward sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa dang / sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams @224a * //üîΩba'i las can ni rnam par 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa dang / sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams @224a * // ba'i las can ni rnam par 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Its function is to torment sentient beings.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni 'di la ngo tsha med pa ste /üîΩde gang dang ldan na de skad ces bya ba de ngo tsha shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni ngo tsha med pa ste /üîΩlas de bdag gi cha ma yi na shes kyang gang kha na mtho pas mi 'dzem pa de ngo tsha med pa'o /

translated: Lack of self-respect is the absence of self-respect.

original: de las bzlog pa ni khred med pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni khred med pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of self-respect.üîΩIt is

original: 'di gnyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
translated: These two have the function of assisting all the defilements and secondary defilements.

original: bya ba ngan pa thams cad kyi rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rnam pa rnams ji ltar mthun mthun du gdags te /
analyzed: bya ba ngan pa thams cad kyi rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rnam pa rnams ji ltar mthun mthun du gdags te /
translated: The forms of attachment, hostility and confusion which are the causes of all evil actions are designated according to their similarity.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gnyis cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because attachment and hostility do not occur simultaneously.

original: 'di gnyis ni rang gi rgyud ni med do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni rang gi rgyud ni med do //
translated: These two do not exist as independent entities.

original: rmugs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rmugs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is torpor?

original: sems las su mi rung ba ste /üîΩblong ba nyid do zhes bya ba la blong ba nyid ni rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems las su mi rung ba ste / blong ba nyid do zhes bya ba la blong ba nyid ni rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: It is unfitness of mind.üîΩIt is a state of mental depression.

original: blong ba'i dngos po ni blong ba nyid de /
analyzed: blong ba'i dngos po ni blong ba nyid de /
translated: The state of being depressed is torpor.

original: de dang ldan na sems blun par gyur nas mi g-yo ba bzhin du dmigs pa rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan na sems blun par gyur nas mi g-yo ba bzhin du dmigs pa rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: When it is present, the mind becomes dull and inert and is unable to grasp an object.

original: 'di yang nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di yang nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of assisting all the defilements and secondary defilements.

original: gti mug gi cha la gdags pas btags pa nyid yin gyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug gi cha la gdags pas btags pa nyid yin gyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
translated: It is designated as a part of delusion, and thus it is a mere designation, not a substance.

original: rgod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is excitedness?üîΩIt is a lack of calmness of mind.

original: sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la zhi ba ni zhi gnas te /
analyzed: sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la zhi ba ni zhi gnas te /
translated: Calmness is meditative serenity.

original: de dang mi mthun pa ni ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa ni ma zhi ba'o //
translated: Its opposite is a lack of calmness.

original: de yang 'dod chags dang mthun pa sngon dgod dgod pa dang / rtse rtse ba la sogs pa dran pa'i 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa sems ma zhi ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang mthun pa sngon dgod dgod pa dang / rtse rtse ba la sogs pa dran pa'i 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa sems ma zhi ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: It is a cause of the lack of calmness of mind that is part of attachment, such as the recollection of former laughter, play, etc.,

original: zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: and it functions to obstruct meditative serenity.

original: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the opposite of faith.

original: dad pa ni yod pa dang / yon tan can dang / nus pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni yod pa dang / yon tan can dang / nus pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa'o //
translated: Faith is a clear, calm, and firm conviction that things exist, that they have certain qualities, and that one has the ability to do something.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma dang pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma dang pa ste /
translated: Lack of faith is the opposite of that.

original: dad pa med pa ni sbyor ba la 'dun pa med pas le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dad pa med pa ni sbyor ba la 'dun pa med pas le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It functions as the basis for laziness, since one who lacks faith has no desire to apply oneself.

original: nyal ba dang gnyid pa dang 'phres pa'i bde ba la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba la sems mi spro ba de ni le lo ste /
analyzed: nyal ba dang gnyid pa dang 'phres pa'i bde ba la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba la sems mi spro ba de ni le lo ste /
translated: Laziness is the non-exertion of body, speech, and mind which is a part of delusion, based on the pleasure of lying down, sleeping, and reclining.

original: ngan pa la sbyor bas ni le lo'o //
analyzed: ngan pa la sbyor bas ni le lo'o //
translated: It is called laziness because it is applied to evil.üîΩLaziness is the adversary of effort.

original: @224b brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: @224b brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: Effort is the exertion of body, speech, and mind which is applied to virtue.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas le lo ste /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas le lo ste /
translated: Laziness is its adversary because it is applied to evil.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is to obstruct the exertion of body, speech, and mind which is applied to virtue.üîΩNegligence is the non-protection of mind which is applied to the increase of that which is unvirtuous and the decrease of that which is virtuous.üîΩIt is a designation for attachment, hatred, and delusion as previously explained.

original: bag med pa ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ji skad du bshad pa rnams la btags te mi dge ba 'phel ba dang dge ba 'grib pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: bag med pa ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ji skad du bshad pa rnams la btags te mi dge ba 'phel ba dang dge ba 'grib pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is to act as the support for the increase of that which is unvirtuous and the decrease of that which is virtuous.

original: brjed ngas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is forgetfulness?

original: dran pa nyon mongs pa can de zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyon mongs pa can de zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: That memory is defiled means that it is associated with defilement.

original: dge ba la mi gsal ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba la mi gsal ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is unclear about the wholesome means

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yul tha dad pa ma yin pas dge ba la sems gsal bar byed mi nus te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yul tha dad pa ma yin pas dge ba la sems gsal bar byed mi nus te /
translated: that memory associated with defilement is not distinct from the object of defilement and so cannot make the mind clear about the wholesome.

original: g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'dis sems sna tshogs su g-yeng bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'dis sems sna tshogs su g-yeng bar byed pa'o //
translated: Distraction is that by which the mind is distracted in various ways.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug de dag gis sems ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa las phyi rol tu 'phro bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug de dag gis sems ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa las phyi rol tu 'phro bar byed pa ste /
translated: The mind is distracted from the object of concentration by attachment, hostility, and benightedness.

original: de dag la ji ltar mthun mthun du nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi g-yeng ba gdags so //
analyzed: de dag la ji ltar mthun mthun du nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi g-yeng ba gdags so //
translated: They are designated as the distraction of the secondary defilement that corresponds to each of them.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct freedom from attachment.

original: shes bzhin ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-conscientiousness?

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: It is discernment associated with defilement.

original: des lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa ste /üîΩbya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas ltung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no /
analyzed: des lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa ste / bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas ltung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no /
translated: It is the lack of knowledge of the activities of body, speech and mind, going out and coming back, etc.

original: // / phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa bye brag tu bshad pa /üîΩbam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // / phung po lnga'i rab tu byed pa bye brag tu bshad pa / bam po gsum pa /
translated: Its function is to support the fall into error, because it does not know what should be done and what should not be done.

original: 'gyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is regret?üîΩIt is remorse.

original: yid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba la ngan pa byas pas 'gyod de de'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba la ngan pa byas pas 'gyod de de'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa nyid do //
translated: It is remorse for what has been done badly.

original: ngan pa byas pa'i yul la sems mi dga' ba ste /
analyzed: ngan pa byas pa'i yul la sems mi dga' ba ste /
translated: It is a mental process of dissatisfaction with regard to what has been done badly.

original: sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pas 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pas 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called regret because it is a mental factor.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa dang / rang mi rigs pa byas sam ma byas kyang rung ste /üîΩgti mug gi char gtogs pa'i sems kyi yid @225a * //üîΩla gcags pa ni 'gyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa dang / rang mi rigs pa byas sam ma byas kyang rung ste / gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i sems kyi yid @225a * // la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa ste /
translated: It is a mental factor that is associated with delusion and is a regret that is either desirable or undesirable, virtuous or nonvirtuous, or indeterminate, timely or untimely, proper or improper, whether or not it is done by oneself or another.

original: 'di ni sems gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni sems gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of obstructing the stability of mind.

original: mngon par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is a mental factor that is associated with attachment and is a longing for an object that is desirable.

original: mi 'dod pa ni gzhan dag gis nan gyis byed du bcug pa gang yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i zil gyis non nas byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni gzhan dag gis nan gyis byed du bcug pa gang yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i zil gyis non nas byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Undesirable means that which is done by another through force or that which is done under the influence of an affliction.

original: dus ni ji srid du ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dus ni ji srid du ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Timely means that which is not abandoned.

original: dus ma yin pa ni de las thal ba'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa ni de las thal ba'o //
translated: Untimely means that which is beyond that.

original: rigs pa ni gnas yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni gnas yin pa'o //
translated: Proper means that which is suitable.

original: mi rigs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Improper means that which is not suitable.

original: de la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of desire:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o//
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o//
translated: wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined.

original: 'dir ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas bsdus pa kho na gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas bsdus pa kho na gzung ngo //
translated: Here, only that which is included in the secondary defilement belonging to delusion is accepted.

original: gnyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is sleep?üîΩIt is the withdrawal of the mind, which is involuntary.

original: 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o zhes bya ba la 'jug pa ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o zhes bya ba la 'jug pa ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The withdrawal is the mind's withdrawal from its object.

original: de yang sems kyi rang dbang med pa gang las 'byung ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sems kyi rang dbang med pa gang las 'byung ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is also called the involuntary state of the mind.

original: yang na lus 'dzin mi nus pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med pa de gang las byung ba de gnyid ces bya'o //üîΩgzhan gyis kyang sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir sems sdud pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang na lus 'dzin mi nus pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med pa de gang las byung ba de gnyid ces bya'o // gzhan gyis kyang sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir sems sdud pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Or else, sleep is that from which there is the involuntary withdrawal of the mind which is unable to hold the body.üîΩThe mind's withdrawal is involuntary because it is produced by the power of the defilements.

original: gzhan gyis kyang sems sdud par 'gyur bas sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang sems sdud par 'gyur bas sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The mind's withdrawal is involuntary because it is produced by the power of the defilements.

original: sems sdud pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems sdud pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The contraction of mind is the non-engagement of the mind through the door of the sense faculties such as the eye.

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is also virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral.

original: gnyid kyi rgyu nyi nyams chung ba dang / ngal ba dang / lus lci ba dang / mun pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa la sogs pa la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyid kyi rgyu nyi nyams chung ba dang / ngal ba dang / lus lci ba dang / mun pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa la sogs pa la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Sleep is a mental factor belonging to the category of delusion that arises in dependence on causes of sleep such as weakness, fatigue, heaviness of the body, and attention to dark images.

original: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of providing a basis for the loss of awareness.

original: 'dir ni mi dge ba nyid gti mug gi char gtogs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mi dge ba nyid gti mug gi char gtogs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, only the non-virtuous aspect is considered to belong to the category of delusion, not the others.

original: rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is initial mental application?

original: kun du tshol ba'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: kun du tshol ba'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
translated: It is mental expression that is a search.

original: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba la kun du tshol ba ni 'di ci yin zhes kun du rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba la kun du tshol ba ni 'di ci yin zhes kun du rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is a specific type of volition and wisdom. Search means engaging in the thought What is this?

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi brjod pa ni yid kyi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi brjod pa ni yid kyi brjod pa'o //
translated: Mental expression is mental in nature, thus it is mental expression.

original: brjod pa dang 'dra bas brjod pa ste don brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dra bas brjod pa ste don brjod pa'o //
translated: It is called expression because it is similar to expression, i.e., the expression of meaning.

original: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba la @225b sems pa ni gang gis sems kun du g-yo bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba la @225b sems pa ni gang gis sems kun du g-yo bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: It is said that it is a particular kind of volition and wisdom. Volition is that which moves the mind.

original: shes rab ni yon tan dang nyes pa 'byed pa'i rnam pa yin pas de'i dbang gis kyang sems 'jug pas na bar 'ga' sems dang sems pa la rtog pa gdags /
analyzed: shes rab ni yon tan dang nyes pa 'byed pa'i rnam pa yin pas de'i dbang gis kyang sems 'jug pas na bar 'ga' sems dang sems pa la rtog pa gdags /
translated: It is also said that the mind engages in activity under the influence of wisdom, which has the aspect of distinguishing good qualities and faults.üîΩSometimes, the term vitarka is applied to the mind and volition,

original: 'ga' ni shes rab dang sems la ste /
analyzed: 'ga' ni shes rab dang sems la ste /
translated: and sometimes, to wisdom and the mind,

original: mngon par mi rtog pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon par mi rtog pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: in accordance with the order of non-discursive and discursive states.

original: yang na sems pa dang shes rab nyid la gdags te /
analyzed: yang na sems pa dang shes rab nyid la gdags te /
translated: Or else, vitarka is applied to volition and wisdom themselves,

original: de'i dbang gis de ltar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de ltar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind engages in activity under their influence.

original: tshul 'di ni dpyod pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni dpyod pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: This method should also be applied to vicƒÅra.

original: sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba la che long ste /
analyzed: sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba la che long ste /
translated: It is said that vitarka is gross,

original: dngos po tsam kun du tshol ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tsam kun du tshol ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the aspect of seeking the mere thing.

original: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is vicƒÅra?

original: so sor rtog pa yid kyi dpyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni sngar khong du chud pa la 'di ni 'di'o zhes dpyod pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa yid kyi dpyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni sngar khong du chud pa la 'di ni 'di'o zhes dpyod pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Discernment is the investigation of the mind. It is the aspect of investigating what has been understood, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is that.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gang sems zhi ba ba'o zhes bya ba la de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang sems zhi ba ba'o zhes bya ba la de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, serenity is the calming of the mind.

original: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag go //
translated: ‚ÄúSimilarly‚Äù means that it is a specific type of volition and wisdom.

original: dngos po la so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa yin pas zhi ba pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po la so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa yin pas zhi ba pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called serenity because it has the aspect of investigating things.

original: 'di gnyis ni reg par gnas pa dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni reg par gnas pa dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: These two have the function of supporting the attainment of tranquility and the non-attainment of tranquility.

original: 'di gnyis ni sems rtsing ba dang zhib par rnam par gnas pa tha dad du dbye'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni sems rtsing ba dang zhib par rnam par gnas pa tha dad du dbye'o //
translated: These two are distinguished as the states of a coarse and subtle mind.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad pa de la sems las byung ba rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi bdag nyid do zhes bshad pa de la sems las byung ba rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of formation was explained as being the nature of mental factors other than feeling and conception, and the nature of the formations that are not associated with the mind. The mental factors have already been explained.

original: da ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Now, non-associated compositional factors must be mentioned, so it says,

original: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What are the non-associated compositional factors?

original: dris pa bzhin du gang dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags pa ste /
analyzed: dris pa bzhin du gang dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags pa ste /
translated: Just as asked, they are imputed in the context of form, mind, and mental factors.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes de dag spyir bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags so zhes de dag spyir bstan te /
translated: They are not imputed as the same or different.

original: de dag ni mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin par skabs kyis sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin par skabs kyis sbyar ro //
translated: They are generally indicated as non-associated compositional factors.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs pas rang gi ngo bo gud na med pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs pas rang gi ngo bo gud na med pas /
translated: Since they do not exist separately from the nature of the context of form and so on,

original: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir btags pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir btags pa'o //
translated: they are imputed because they are imputed in the context of form and so on.

original: de'i phyir rten @226a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten @226a * //
translated: Therefore, since they have a basis,

original: dang bcas pa yin pas gnas skabs bzhin du de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags te /
analyzed: dang bcas pa yin pas gnas skabs bzhin du de nyid dang gzhan du mi gdags te /
translated: they are not imputed as the same or different as the context.

original: gnas skabs dang gnas skabs can gcig dang / du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnas skabs can la 'bras bu rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gnas skabs dang gnas skabs can gcig dang / du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnas skabs can la 'bras bu rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it would follow that the state and the one in the state would be one or many, and because it would follow that the effect would be permanent in the one in the state.

original: / de ltar spyir bstan nas khyad par khong du chud par 'dod nas /
analyzed: / de ltar spyir bstan nas khyad par khong du chud par 'dod nas /
translated: Having thus taught in general, in order to understand the distinctions,

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang thob pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba de dag gi khyad par rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang thob pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba de dag gi khyad par rgya cher bstan to //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhat are they?‚Äù and extensively teaches their distinctions, beginning with ‚Äúobtainment, the meditative attainment of nonperception, and . . . ‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag go zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can dag ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag go zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose that are similar to that‚Äù means those that have that nature.

original: gzhan gang dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs la gdags pa ste /
translated: Others are designated in the states of form, mind, and mental factors.

original: de dag kyang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as the nonconcurrent formations.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'jug pa dang / so sor nges pa dang / 'byor pa dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / rus dang / yul dang / grangs dang / tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩda ni tshogs pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo so sor dmigs kyis dbye ba'i phyir /üîΩthob pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris pa dang / rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩsngon ma thob pa thog ma nyid du thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang / so sor nges pa dang / 'byor pa dang / mgyogs pa dang / go rims dang / rus dang / yul dang / grangs dang / tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // da ni tshogs pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo so sor dmigs kyis dbye ba'i phyir / thob pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris pa dang / rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // sngon ma thob pa thog ma nyid du thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: engagement, determination, endowment, speed, order, caste, country, number, and assembly.üîΩNow, in order to individually discern the intrinsic natures of assembly, etc.,üîΩhe asks, ‚ÄúWhat is obtainment?‚Äù and so on, and then states, ‚ÄúIt is acquisition and possession.‚ÄùüîΩObtainment is the first acquisition of what was not previously obtained.üîΩ

original: ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba de la rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba de la rigs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reason is as follows.

original: skad cig dang po thob pa nas brtsams te dbang gi dus kyi bar du sa bon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig dang po thob pa nas brtsams te dbang gi dus kyi bar du sa bon zhes bya ste /
translated: From the time of attaining the first moment until the time of the controlling faculty, it is called seed.

original: de ltar na sa bon ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa gnyi gar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sa bon ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa gnyi gar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, seed is said to be both obtained and possessed.

original: dbang dang mngon du gyur pa ni ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang dang mngon du gyur pa ni ldan pa yin no //
translated: The controlling faculty and manifestation are possessed.

original: sa bon ci la bya zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon ci la bya zhe na /
translated: What is a seed?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par shes pa la ma 'ongs pa na de dang rigs gcig pa'i chos kyi rgyu bskyed pa'i nus pa'i bye brag ni sa bon no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par shes pa la ma 'ongs pa na de dang rigs gcig pa'i chos kyi rgyu bskyed pa'i nus pa'i bye brag ni sa bon no //
translated: The specific potency of consciousness to generate the cause of future dharmas of the same type as those virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral dharmas is a seed.

original: sa bon rnyed nas de la rag las pa'i @226b phyir mngon du ma gyur kyang de'i sa bon gang yin pa de thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon rnyed nas de la rag las pa'i @226b phyir mngon du ma gyur kyang de'i sa bon gang yin pa de thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having obtained the seed, one is said to possess the seed that is the cause of future dharmas of the same type, even though it is not manifest, because it depends on that seed.

original: dbang ni de'i rkyen la ltos nas rgyun gyi 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: dbang ni de'i rkyen la ltos nas rgyun gyi 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The controlling faculty is the state of establishing the result of the continuum in dependence on its conditions.

original: mngon du gyur ba ni de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i dus so //
analyzed: mngon du gyur ba ni de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i dus so //
translated: The actualized state is the time when its effect is accomplished.

original: 'du shes med pa'am 'du shes med pa rnams kyi ste /üîΩ'du shes med par snyoms bar 'jug pa'am /üîΩ'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'am 'du shes med pa rnams kyi ste / 'du shes med par snyoms bar 'jug pa'am / 'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
translated: The state of non-perception is the state of those without perception.üîΩThe attainment of non-perception is the attainment of those without perception.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The attainment of non-perception is the attainment of those without perception.

original: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from attachment to the stage of the third absorption is free from attachment to the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni dge chung dang tshad med dge dang dge rgyas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni dge chung dang tshad med dge dang dge rgyas so //
translated: The third absorption is the stage of lesser virtue, immeasurable virtue, and extensive virtue.

original: de la gang dge rgyas las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang dge rgyas las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Among those, one who is free from attachment to extensive virtue is free from attachment to the third absorption.

original: gong ma ma yin pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa las gong du gyur pa bsam gtan bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: gong ma ma yin pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa las gong du gyur pa bsam gtan bzhi pa ste /
translated: Not higher means not higher than the third absorption, which is the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not free from attachment to the fourth absorption.

original: 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pa su la yod pa de 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pa su la yod pa de 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba ste /
translated: Those who have a mental attention that is preceded by the discernment of emergence have a discernment of emergence that is preceded.

original: 'du shes med pa la thar bar 'du shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la thar bar 'du shes pa'am /
translated: They discern the state of nonperception to be liberation or

original: snyoms bar 'jug pa la de'i lam du 'du shes pa rnams 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //üîΩde'i phyir 'byung ba'i 'du shes ni thar pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: snyoms bar 'jug pa la de'i lam du 'du shes pa rnams 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go // de'i phyir 'byung ba'i 'du shes ni thar pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: they discern meditative attainment to be the path to liberation.üîΩTherefore, the discernment of emergence is the discernment of liberation

original: de'i lam du 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lam du 'du shes pa'o //
translated: or the discernment of the path to liberation.

original: 'dir ni sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa la 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir ni sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa la 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya bar 'dod de /
translated: Here, the mental attention that is preceded by the discernment of emergence is asserted to be a form of antidotal mental attention.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags su zin kyang 'du shes med pa nyid la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags su zin kyang 'du shes med pa nyid la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bstan te /
translated: Therefore, even though the mind and mental factors have ceased, the state of nonperception is called the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: 'di ltar 'du shes nyid la sun 'byin pas sems dang sems las byung ba ma lus par 'gag pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brten pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la brten pa ma yin pa rnams ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs @227a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du shes nyid la sun 'byin pas sems dang sems las byung ba ma lus par 'gag pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro // sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brten pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la brten pa ma yin pa rnams ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs @227a * //
translated: Thus, by refuting the notion of a self, the mind and all mental factors cease.

original: drug po dag ste /
analyzed: drug po dag ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cessation of the mind and mental factors that are not supported‚Äù refers to the six collections of consciousness that are included in the active forms of consciousness and their associated mental factors.

original: gang gi phyir sems med pa'i dus thams cad na med pa dang / sems dang bcas pa'i dus rnams na yang gang gi phyir ni rtag tu yod pa ma yin pa de dag brtan pa ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems med pa'i dus thams cad na med pa dang / sems dang bcas pa'i dus rnams na yang gang gi phyir ni rtag tu yod pa ma yin pa de dag brtan pa ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: These are not supported because they do not exist at all times when there is no mind, and they do not exist at all times when there is mind.

original: brtan pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: brtan pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The supported are the store consciousness and the afflicted mind, together with their associated mental factors.

original: gtan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are supported because they exist permanently.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bden pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / mi slob pa'i dus ma gtogs par dus gzhan kun na yod pa'i phyir brtan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bye brag smos so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bden pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / mi slob pa'i dus ma gtogs par dus gzhan kun na yod pa'i phyir brtan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bye brag smos so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúunstable‚Äù because they exist at all times except when one enters the meditative absorption of the truth of the path that is free from impurity, when one enters the meditative absorption of cessation, and when one is a nonlearner.

original: gang 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byas pa ste /
translated: The state called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù is produced by the mind of meditative absorption.

original: 'dis 'gag par byed pas na 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gag par byed pas na 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù because it causes the cessation of unstable minds and mental factors.

original: dus gzhan na sems dang sems las byung ba brtan pa ma yin pa kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la bya ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan na sems dang sems las byung ba brtan pa ma yin pa kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la bya ste /
translated: It is a particular condition of the body that is incompatible with the occurrence of unstable minds and mental factors at another time.

original: de ltar na lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gdags par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gdags par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the designation of the meditative attainment of non-apperception is a particular condition of the body.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis de ma thag pa'i sems gzhan skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus skyed pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis de ma thag pa'i sems gzhan skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i lus skyed pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind of meditative attainment is called ‚Äúthat which is done‚Äù because it generates a body that is incompatible with the arising of another mind immediately after it.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of cessation?

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the state of one who is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness and who has risen above the summit of existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du ma bskyod kyang ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i so so skye bo'i yang yod pas de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du ma bskyod kyang ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i so so skye bo'i yang yod pas de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Even though one has not risen above the summit of existence, one who is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness may be an ordinary person. Therefore, the words ‚Äúwho has risen above the summit of existence‚Äù are added.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kha cig /'bras bu la gnas pa dang 'jug pa yang yod pas /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kha cig /'bras bu la gnas pa dang 'jug pa yang yod pas /
translated: Some who are free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness and who have risen above the summit of existence abide in the fruit and enter the attainment of cessation.

original: de'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúfreed from attachment to the sphere of nothingness.‚Äù

original: gong ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes ma brjod pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dgra bcom pa yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ@227b ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga smos pas ni 'di 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
