analyzed: gong ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes ma brjod pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dgra bcom pa yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir ro // @227b ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga smos pas ni 'di 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: It is not called ‚Äúfreed from attachment to the higher‚Äù because there are arhats who enter the absorption of cessation and are freed from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: dgra bcom pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfreed from attachment to the sphere of nothingness and elevated above the summit of existence‚Äù indicates that this absorption is that of a noble being, either a nonreturner or an arhat.

original: so so'i skye bo ni ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not that of an ordinary being.

original: so so'i skye bo ni srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du mi bskyod do /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du mi bskyod do /
translated: Ordinary beings are not elevated above the summit of existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las gnyen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las gnyen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no supramundane path that is an antidote to the summit of existence.

original: mthong ba'i lam zag pa med pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam zag pa med pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: The uncontaminated path of seeing is the antidote to the summit of existence.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / bsgom bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir ma chags pas srid ba'i rtse mo las bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa nyid mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / bsgom bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir ma chags pas srid ba'i rtse mo las bskyod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the noble one who, by means of nonattachment, shakes the summit of existence, having abandoned the afflictions abandoned by the path of seeing and having abandoned the afflictions abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩIt is entered through attention that is preceded by the perception of abiding.

original: gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is not entered through attention that is preceded by the perception of emergence, as is the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: gyi gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas so //
analyzed: gyi gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas so //
translated: It is entered through attention that is preceded by the perception of abiding.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo ba ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo ba ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation belongs to the summit of existence.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni srid pa las 'byung ba'i 'du shes mi 'jug gi /'du shes dang tshor bas yongs su skyo nas de med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni srid pa las 'byung ba'i 'du shes mi 'jug gi /'du shes dang tshor bas yongs su skyo nas de med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: The noble ones do not have the notion of emerging from existence, but rather the notion of peaceful abiding in the attainment of cessation, because they are disgusted with ideation and sensation and they do not exist.

original: gnas su mnyam pa'i 'du shes ni gnas pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: gnas su mnyam pa'i 'du shes ni gnas pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The notion of abiding is the notion of dwelling.

original: 'dis gnas par byed pas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis gnas par byed pas gnas pa ste /
translated: Abiding is that by which one abides.

original: dus gzhan du sdod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gzhan du sdod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means to stay for a period of time.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bas gnas par bya'o snyam pa'i 'du shes mngon par 'du byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bas gnas par bya'o snyam pa'i 'du shes mngon par 'du byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental attention that forms the notion, ‚ÄúI will abide in the attainment of cessation, which is distinguished by being like nirvana,‚Äù is called mental attention preceded by the notion of abiding.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo pa de ni phra ba'i phra ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo pa de ni phra ba'i phra ba ste /
translated: The summit of existence is the most subtle of the subtle,

original: de ma thag tu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the attainment of cessation is immediately actualized after it.

original: brtan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang bzhi dang gcig 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams su go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: brtan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang bzhi dang gcig 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams su go rims bzhin no //
translated: The unstable ones are the six active consciousnesses, four, and one in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, respectively.

original: brtan pa rnams las kyang @228a * //
analyzed: brtan pa rnams las kyang @228a * //
translated: Some of the stable ones

original: kha cig ces bya ba la brtan pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa dag kyang yod pas de'i phyir kha cig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba la brtan pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa dag kyang yod pas de'i phyir kha cig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: are also the stable ones, because the consciousnesses included in the consciousness as retribution are also stable.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mi slob pa'i dus ma gtogs par zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa thams cad na gnas pa'i tshul can yin pas brtan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mi slob pa'i dus ma gtogs par zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa thams cad na gnas pa'i tshul can yin pas brtan pa'o //
translated: The defiled mind is stable because it is present in all defiled activities, except in the samƒÅdhi of cessation and in the state of the adept.

original: 'gog pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas byas pa ste /
translated: The samƒÅdhi of cessation is that which is made by the active consciousnesses.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon la gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon la gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the cessation of the active forms of consciousness and the afflicted mind consciousness, which are seeds of the consciousness that is the result of evolution.

original: 'dis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dus gzhan na mi 'byung bar 'gog pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dus gzhan na mi 'byung bar 'gog pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called cessation because it stops the active forms of consciousness and the afflicted mind consciousness from arising for a period of time.

original: de ltar na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sa bon nyams par byas pa'i gnas skabs la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gdags so //
analyzed: de ltar na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sa bon nyams par byas pa'i gnas skabs la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gdags so //
translated: Thus, the state in which the seeds in the store consciousness have been damaged by the mind of meditative equipoise is designated as the attainment of cessation.

original: 'du shes med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attainment of nonperception?

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: It is the result of the attainment of nonperception.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brtan pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la lha de dag ni 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brtan pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la lha de dag ni 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba rnams te /
translated: It is the cessation of unstable minds and mental factors of those born among the gods who are beings devoid of discernment.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i gnas gzhan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i gnas gzhan gsum pa'o //
translated: Those gods are called ‚Äúthose of great fruit‚Äù and they are the third realm of the fourth meditative concentration.

original: de dag gi gong na khang khyim lta bur 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi gnas yod pa der skyes pa'i 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gong na khang khyim lta bur 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi gnas yod pa der skyes pa'i 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Above them, like a house, is the realm of the gods who are beings devoid of discernment.üîΩIt is the cessation of unstable minds and mental factors of those born there.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brtan pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rang bzhin nges par bzung ba ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brtan pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rang bzhin nges par bzung ba ste /
translated: This is the essential nature of this meditative attainment.

original: der skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams rang gi gnas la rang gi rigs kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i sa bon la gnod par byed pa ni srab pa bas kyang ches srab bar 'gyur zhing tha mar shin tu
analyzed: der skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams rang gi gnas la rang gi rigs kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i sa bon la gnod par byed pa ni srab pa bas kyang ches srab bar 'gyur zhing tha mar shin tu
translated: The minds and mental factors born there that are not teachings of the Dharma are subtler than subtle and finally become extremely subtle, since they harm the seeds of the minds and mental factors of their own type in their own abode.

original: srab pa'i bar du gyur nas rang gi gnas la sa bon nyams par byas pa'i phyir sems gzhan dang sbyor mi nus so //
analyzed: srab pa'i bar du gyur nas rang gi gnas la sa bon nyams par byas pa'i phyir sems gzhan dang sbyor mi nus so //
translated: Because they destroy the seeds in their own abode, they are unable to connect with other minds.

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i brtan ba ma yin pa rnams @228b de'i tshe gnas las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i brtan ba ma yin pa rnams @228b de'i tshe gnas las mi 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, unstable minds and mental factors do not arise from their abode at that time.

original: sa bon nyams par gyur ba'i dus de na gnas la 'du shes med pa gdags so //
analyzed: sa bon nyams par gyur ba'i dus de na gnas la 'du shes med pa gdags so //
translated: When the seeds are destroyed, it is designated as the state of nondiscernment.

original: de ltar na gnas kyi dus nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas kyi dus nyid la bya ste /
translated: Thus it is called the state of nondiscernment because it is the time of the abode.

original: 'dis 'gog par byed pas na 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gog par byed pas na 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is cessation because it causes cessation.

original: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of life force?

original: ris mthun pa rnams su sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pas gang 'du byed rnams kyi gnas ba'i dus nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'tsho bar byed pas srog go //
analyzed: ris mthun pa rnams su sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pas gang 'du byed rnams kyi gnas ba'i dus nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'tsho bar byed pas srog go //
translated: The time of the duration of the aggregates is determined by the projecting force of previous karma.

original: ris mthun pa de nyid du gnas bar dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ris mthun pa de nyid du gnas bar dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called life force because it causes the continuity of the aggregates to remain.

original: ris ni sems can gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: ris ni sems can gyi tshogs so //
translated: A class is a group of sentient beings.

original: skal ba mtshungs pa ni mthun pa ste /
analyzed: skal ba mtshungs pa ni mthun pa ste /
translated: Homogeneous means similar.

original: 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the same.

original: ris mthun pas ris mthun pa ste /
analyzed: ris mthun pas ris mthun pa ste /
translated: A class is a homogeneous class.

original: 'gro ba tha dad pa dang / las tha dad pas tha dad par gyur pa'i ris mthun pa de dag tu so so'i tshe gcig gi phung po'i rgyun gang yin pa de ris mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba tha dad pa dang / las tha dad pas tha dad par gyur pa'i ris mthun pa de dag tu so so'i tshe gcig gi phung po'i rgyun gang yin pa de ris mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The continuum of aggregates in a single life in those homogeneous classes that are differentiated by different realms and different types of rebirth is called a homogeneous class.

original: de yang sngon bsags pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa ni las kyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sngon bsags pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa ni las kyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is produced by karma, since it is projected by virtuous, nonvirtuous, and invariable karma accumulated in the past.

original: gang gnas pa'i dus nges pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin ba'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gnas pa'i dus nges pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin ba'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The time of duration is the time during which the formations included in the same life-stream continue.üîΩThe time of duration is determined by the time during which the formations included in the same life-stream continue.

original: gnas pa de'i dus nges pa ni 'dis ris mthun pa der lo brgya'am /üîΩlo stong ngam /
analyzed: gnas pa de'i dus nges pa ni 'dis ris mthun pa der lo brgya'am / lo stong ngam /
translated: The time of duration is determined by the time during which the formations included in the same life-stream continue.

original: dus ji srid du gnas par 'gyur ba de gnas pa'i dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus ji srid du gnas par 'gyur ba de gnas pa'i dus nges pa'o //
translated: The time of duration is determined by the time during which the formations included in the same life-stream continue.

original: de ltar na gnas pa'i dus nges pa'i rang bzhin la tshe zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas pa'i dus nges pa'i rang bzhin la tshe zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of the time of duration is taught as life.

original: de'i gnas ni sngon bsags pa'i las kyis 'phangs pas nus pa'i khyad par can gyi 'du byed brtan pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni sngon bsags pa'i las kyis 'phangs pas nus pa'i khyad par can gyi 'du byed brtan pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: The basis of that is the stable formations that are preceded by the store-consciousness, which have the special ability projected by previous actions.

original: ris mthun pa gang zhe na gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba la sems can ni lha dang mi la sogs pa 'gro ba lngar gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ris mthun pa gang zhe na gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba la sems can ni lha dang mi la sogs pa 'gro ba lngar gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: Homogeneity means the similarity of bodies among sentient beings. Sentient beings are those included in the five destinies such as gods and humans.

original: de dag gi bdag gi dngos por gang la 'dzin pa de /
analyzed: de dag gi bdag gi dngos por gang la 'dzin pa de /
translated: What is the self of those?üîΩ

original: sems can rnams kyi lus yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus yin te /
translated: The self of those is the body of sentient beings.

original: de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po nyid dam /
analyzed: de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po nyid dam /
translated: That is the five appropriated aggregates themselves,

original: phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: or it has the nature of the four aggregates.

original: 'dra zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'o //üîΩde ni 'di skad du 'gro ba dang gnas dang lus la sogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa ni sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba dang / gnas dang lus tha dad pa'i gzhi sems can rnams kyi lus phan tshun 'dra ba gang yin pa de la ris mthun pa gdags so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'o // de ni 'di skad du 'gro ba dang gnas dang lus la sogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa ni sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba dang / gnas dang lus tha dad pa'i gzhi sems can rnams kyi lus phan tshun 'dra ba gang yin pa de la ris mthun pa gdags so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Similarity means sameness.

original: skye @229a * //
analyzed: skye @229a * //
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúSentient beings are different due to the differences of their life-cycle, abode, body, and so on. The basis of the differences of the life-cycle, abode, and body of sentient beings is the body of sentient beings. That similarity of bodies of sentient beings is called a class affiliate.‚Äù

original: pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth?

original: ris mthun par gang 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ris mthun par gang 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the arising of the aggregates that did not exist before within a class affiliate.

original: ris mthun pa smos pa ni 'du byed tsam gyi 'byung ba la skye ba zhes mi bya'i /
analyzed: ris mthun pa smos pa ni 'du byed tsam gyi 'byung ba la skye ba zhes mi bya'i /
translated: The mention of class affiliate is to indicate that the arising of mere aggregates is not called birth.

original: ris mthun par gyur pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag nyid ma byung ba las byung ba la skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ris mthun par gyur pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag nyid ma byung ba las byung ba la skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the arising of those formations that are of the same class is called birth.

original: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in order to show that not all formations are birth.

original: gang dag dngos po la skyes pa med pa dang / zhig pa med pa rnams kyi skye ba don gzhan du 'gyur pa dang byed pa las dus rnam par gzhag par 'dzin pa rnams kyi 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po la skyes pa med pa dang / zhig pa med pa rnams kyi skye ba don gzhan du 'gyur pa dang byed pa las dus rnam par gzhag par 'dzin pa rnams kyi 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: For those who believe that birth is a different entity from the arising of things, and that time is established on the basis of activity, the following is stated in order to refute their views:

original: ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is the arising of that which did not previously exist is called birth.‚Äù

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of formations that did not previously exist is called birth.

original: don gzhan gyur pa yang med /
analyzed: don gzhan gyur pa yang med /
translated: There is no other entity that is birth.

original: byed pa las dus rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa las dus rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is time established on the basis of activity.

original: rga ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rga ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is aging?

original: de ltar de dag gi rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la de ltar de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ris mthun par gyur pa'i 'du byed rnams nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la de ltar de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ris mthun par gyur pa'i 'du byed rnams nyid kyi'o //
translated: Thus, their continuum is transformed means that the continuum of those formations that are in the same life is transformed.

original: rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid pa nas 'chi ba'i srid pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid pa nas 'chi ba'i srid pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The continuum is transformed from the birth existence to the death existence.

original: bar der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa'i 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la rgyun ces bya'o //
analyzed: bar der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa'i 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la rgyun ces bya'o //
translated: The continuum is said to be the uninterrupted occurrence of formations that exist as cause and effect in the interim.

original: de'i gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ste ;
analyzed: de'i gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ste ;
translated: The transformation of that continuum is the transformation of the continuum.

original: 'di ltar nur nur po'i dus las mer mer por 'gyur ba'i dus dang / de bzhin du dar la bab pa'i dus las rgas pa'i dus kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nur nur po'i dus las mer mer por 'gyur ba'i dus dang / de bzhin du dar la bab pa'i dus las rgas pa'i dus kyi bar du'o //
translated: Thus, the state of the embryo is transformed into the state of the fetus, and so on, up to the state of old age.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i dus rnams la yang snga ma las phyi mar 'gyur ba'i skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i dus rnams la yang snga ma las phyi mar 'gyur ba'i skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Even in the states of the embryo and so on, the transformation of the continuum is said to occur in each moment, since the later state is different from the earlier.

original: de ltar na rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba la rga ba gdags te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba la rga ba gdags te /
translated: Thus, aging is designated in relation to the transformation of a continuum.

original: skad cig gcig la yang ma yin pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med do //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la yang ma yin pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med do //
translated: It is not in relation to a single moment, nor is it in relation to a transformation into something else.

original: gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is duration?

original: de ltar de dag gi rgyun rgyud chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi rgyun rgyud chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The continuum of those is a continuum.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gcig na'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gcig na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to a single life in a class affiliate.

original: shi ba la thug gi bar du 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun rgyud chags pa la gnas pa gdags te /
analyzed: shi ba la thug gi bar du 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun rgyud chags pa la gnas pa gdags te /
translated: Duration is designated in relation to the continuum of formations that lasts until death.

original: skad cig gcig la yang mi bya zhing don gzhan du gyur pa yang med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la yang mi bya zhing don gzhan du gyur pa yang med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not in relation to a single moment, nor is it in relation to a transformation into something else.

original: mi rtag pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is impermanence?üîΩThe cessation of those is a continuum.

original: de ltar de dag ni rgyun 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba la de ltar de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gcig tu 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun chad pa la mi rtag @229b pa gdags te /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni rgyun 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba la de ltar de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gcig tu 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun chad pa la mi rtag @229b pa gdags te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the cessation of the continuum of formations in a single life in a class affiliate.

original: skad cig re re la yang ma yin zhing don gzhan du gyur pa yang med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig re re la yang ma yin zhing don gzhan du gyur pa yang med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not in every moment, nor is there a transformation into another object.

original: rgyun chad pa ni 'dir 'chi ba la bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa ni 'dir 'chi ba la bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the cessation of the continuum should be understood as death.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid yod par nges na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid yod par nges na /
translated: If arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence definitely exist in external form,

original: ci'i phyir ris mthun pa nyid kyi 'du byed kyi rgyun la skye ba la sogs par bshad kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ris mthun pa nyid kyi 'du byed kyi rgyun la skye ba la sogs par bshad kyi /
translated: why are arising, etc. explained in relation to the continuum of formations that are homogeneous,

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: but not in relation to external form?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid gang dag bshad pa de dag ni sems can du brjod pa nyid kyi 'du byed kyi dbang du mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid gang dag bshad pa de dag ni sems can du brjod pa nyid kyi 'du byed kyi dbang du mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn explained the characteristics of the conditioned as arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence, which are in relation to formations that are called sentient beings,

original: phyi rol gyi ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not in relation to external things.

original: gnyi ga la yang skye ba la sogs pa yod par mtshungs na zin pa'i 'du byed kyi dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang skye ba la sogs pa yod par mtshungs na zin pa'i 'du byed kyi dbang du mdzad de /
translated: If arising and so on are equivalent in both, then why does the Abhidharmakosa say,üîΩThe appropriator is the sentient beings.üîΩ

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If arising, etc., are the same in both cases, why did the Lord teach the characteristics of conditioned entities from the perspective of internal conditioned entities?

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs ni 'jig pa dang chags bas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs ni 'jig pa dang chags bas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: External form is distinguished by destruction and origination.

original: nang gi 'du byed rnams ni skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi 'du byed rnams ni skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Internal conditioned entities are distinguished by arising, aging, etc.

original: de ni 'di skad du 'jig rten na phyi'i gzugs kyi 'jig pa dang / skye ba la 'jig pa dang / chags pa'i sgrar grags pas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jig rten dang mthun par de skad du bshad de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'jig rten na phyi'i gzugs kyi 'jig pa dang / skye ba la 'jig pa dang / chags pa'i sgrar grags pas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jig rten dang mthun par de skad du bshad de /
translated: This is what is being said: since in the world the destruction and origination of external form are known as destruction and origination, the Lord also taught them in that way in conformity with the world.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sgrar ni ma yin no //üîΩnang gi 'du byed rnams ni skyes so //üîΩrgas so // gnas so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sgrar ni ma yin no // nang gi 'du byed rnams ni skyes so // rgas so // gnas so //
translated: He did not use the terms arising, etc.

original: zhig go zhes skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: zhig go zhes skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Internal conditioned entities are distinguished by arising, aging, etc., as in the statements, ‚ÄúThey are born,‚Äù ‚ÄúThey age,‚Äù ‚ÄúThey endure,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThey perish.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jig rten dang mthun par de dag gi 'byung ba la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i sgrar bstan to zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jig rten dang mthun par de dag gi 'byung ba la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i sgrar bstan to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The Lord, in conformity with the world, has taught the arising, etc. of those as birth, etc.

original: ming gi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of names?üîΩThe names are the designations of the entities of the dharmas.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba dang brjod pa la rnam par shes pa gzhol bar byed pas ming ngo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba dang brjod pa la rnam par shes pa gzhol bar byed pas ming ngo //
translated: The names are the names because they cause the consciousness to engage with the objects of expression and the expressions.

original: de yang don rnams la brda sprod ba'i yi ge 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de yang don rnams la brda sprod ba'i yi ge 'dus pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the names are the collection of syllables that convey the conventional symbols for the objects.

original: ming ngam yi ge rnams 'dus pa la ming gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming ngam yi ge rnams 'dus pa la ming gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of names is the collection of names and syllables.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid brjod du med pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i tshig la tshig bla dags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid brjod du med pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i tshig la tshig bla dags zhes bya'o //
translated: The words are the designations for the words that are superimposed on the entities of the dharmas, because the entities of the dharmas are inexpressible.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The entities are the specific characteristics.

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo brjod du med kyang gang gis rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa'i brjod pa de ming @230a * //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo brjod du med kyang gang gis rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa'i brjod pa de ming @230a * //
translated: Although the entities of the dharmas are inexpressible, the names are the expressions that make the entities clear.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the explanation.üîΩüîΩ

original: dper na mig rna ba gzugs sgra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig rna ba gzugs sgra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, eye, ear, form, sound, etc.

original: tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is a collection of words?üîΩIt is the designation of the particularities of the dharmas.

original: chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni 'dis khyad par gyi don shes par byed pas tshig ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni 'dis khyad par gyi don shes par byed pas tshig ste /
translated: It is a word because it causes the particularity to be known.

original: de lta na ming dang 'jig rten pa'i tshig las tshig bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ming dang 'jig rten pa'i tshig las tshig bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, a word is distinguished from a name and from a worldly expression.

original: ming dang tshig gnyis yi ge 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin par bye brag med kyang don gyi bye brag gis bye brag tu dbye ste /
analyzed: ming dang tshig gnyis yi ge 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin par bye brag med kyang don gyi bye brag gis bye brag tu dbye ste /
translated: Although there is no difference in that both a name and a word are by nature a collection of letters, they are distinguished by the difference in their meanings.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags ni ming yin la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags ni ming yin la /
translated: A name is the designation of the intrinsic nature of the dharmas.

original: khyad par gyi gzhi ni ngo bo nyid yin pas sngar ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags smos so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhi ni ngo bo nyid yin pas sngar ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags smos so //
translated: Since the intrinsic nature is the basis of the particularities, the designation of the intrinsic nature is mentioned first.

original: khyad par ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The particularities are impermanence, etc.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid dang gzhan du mi snyegs pa'i ngo bo nyid las bye brag tu byed pa ni khyad par te /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid dang gzhan du mi snyegs pa'i ngo bo nyid las bye brag tu byed pa ni khyad par te /
translated: The difference is the particular, which is the nature of something that is not shared with others, and which is the basis for distinguishing between the engaging and the disengaging.

original: dper na 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: dper na 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: For example, all conditioned things are impermanent,

original: cho thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: cho thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are selfless,

original: ya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and nirvana is peace.

original: de ni 'di skad du dngos po'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa tsam ni ming yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du dngos po'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa tsam ni ming yin la /
translated: This is what is being said: a name is the mere expression of the nature of an entity.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par brjod pa ni tshig yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par brjod pa ni tshig yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: A phrase is the expression of the particular nature of an entity.

original: lhag ma ni ming bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ming bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as it was explained in the case of names.

original: yi ge'i tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is a collection of letters?

original: yi ge rnams te de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dis gsal bar byed pas yi ge'o //
analyzed: yi ge rnams te de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dis gsal bar byed pas yi ge'o //
translated: It is the letters, because they both express and manifest.

original: yi ge rnams kyi tshogs ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi tshogs ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
translated: A collection of letters is a collection of letters.

original: tshogs smos pa ni yi ge thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs smos pa ni yi ge thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is used because it includes all the letters.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig smos na ni gong ma nyid la sbyor du dgos la /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra 'ba' zhig smos na ni gong ma nyid la sbyor du dgos la /
translated: If the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù were used alone, it would have to be connected to the previous sentence.

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba nyi tshe smos na yang gnyi ga gang la bya bar gtol med de /
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba nyi tshe smos na yang gnyi ga gang la bya bar gtol med de /
translated: If only the word ‚Äúboth‚Äù were used, it would be unclear to which two it referred.

original: de'i phyir de gnyi ga zhes gnyi ga smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyi ga zhes gnyi ga smos so //
translated: Therefore, both are mentioned with the words ‚Äúthat and those.‚Äù

original: de ltar na bshad ma thag pa'i ming dang tshig gsal bar byed pa'i phyir yi ge zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bshad ma thag pa'i ming dang tshig gsal bar byed pa'i phyir yi ge zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because they illuminate the names and phrases that have just been explained, they are called ‚Äúletters.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na yi ge rnams kyis ming dang tshig gsal bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yi ge rnams kyis ming dang tshig gsal bar byed ce na /
translated: How do letters illuminate names and phrases?

original: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi tshig bla dags kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa'i yi ge 'dus pa rnams la ming dang tshig gdags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi tshig bla dags kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa'i yi ge 'dus pa rnams la ming dang tshig gdags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because names and phrases are designated in relation to collections of letters that are the bases for the terms that express intrinsic natures and specific qualities.

original: de ltar na yi ge rnams kyis ming dang tshig gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na yi ge rnams kyis ming dang tshig gsal bar byed do //
translated: In this way, letters illuminate names and phrases.

original: yi ge rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Letters are not the nature of verbal informative form.

original: yi ge la sogs pa ni brjod pa'o zhes 'jig rten na grags @230b so ;
analyzed: yi ge la sogs pa ni brjod pa'o zhes 'jig rten na grags @230b so ;
translated: In the world, it is well known that letters and so on are expressions.

original: / de dag ni ming dang tshig gnas kyis don yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir brjod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de dag ni ming dang tshig gnas kyis don yang dag par brjod pa'i phyir brjod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúexpressions‚Äù because they express the meaning by means of the location of names and phrases.

original: don gyi gnas gang dag la bstan pa'i gnas de dag la ming dang tshig gdags pas de dag ni de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi gnas gang dag la bstan pa'i gnas de dag la ming dang tshig gdags pas de dag ni de'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The locations of the meaning are the locations of the teaching. Names and phrases are designated in relation to them. Therefore, they are called ‚Äútheir locations.‚Äù

original: yi ge yang de dag gi rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yi ge yang de dag gi rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The letters are the other synonyms of those names and phrases. They are the means of making them known.

original: 'di ltar mig dang 'dren byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan dag tu 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang 'dren byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa gzhan dag tu 'gyur ba ste /
translated: For example, ‚Äúeye‚Äù and ‚Äúinducement‚Äù are synonyms.

original: brjod par bya ba nyid rnam gangs su gtogs pa gzhan rnams kyis shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid rnam gangs su gtogs pa gzhan rnams kyis shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is known by means of the other synonyms.

original: gang gis aa zhes brjod pa ma gtogs par aa zhes bya ba shes par 'gyur ba aa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs de lta bu gzhan med do //
analyzed: gang gis aa zhes brjod pa ma gtogs par aa zhes bya ba shes par 'gyur ba aa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs de lta bu gzhan med do //
translated: Apart from the expression ‚Äúa,‚Äù there is no other synonym of ‚Äúa‚Äù by means of which ‚Äúa‚Äù is known.

original: thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: All of them are as follows:

original: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par dang de gnyi ga'i tha snyad tsam du zad de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par dang de gnyi ga'i tha snyad tsam du zad de /
translated: They are merely the conventions of entity, attribute, and both of those.

original: de dag thams cad ni 'di dag gis rjes su tha snyad gdags pa yin pas de'i phyir ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs de dag rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni 'di dag gis rjes su tha snyad gdags pa yin pas de'i phyir ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs de dag rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: Since all of those are designated by these, therefore those collections of names, phrases, and letters are established.

original: / de bzhin du ldan pa ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs bzhin du dgos pa la ltos nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du ldan pa ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs bzhin du dgos pa la ltos nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, other non-associated compositional factors should be understood as established in dependence on purpose, like the collections of words and letters.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is being an ordinary being?üîΩIt is not obtaining the qualities of an ƒÅrya.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos gang dang ldan na so so'i skye bo zhes brjod pa de so so'i skye bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos gang dang ldan na so so'i skye bo zhes brjod pa de so so'i skye bo nyid do //
translated: Those who are called ordinary beings because they possess certain qualities are ordinary beings.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du song bas 'phags pa rnams so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du song bas 'phags pa rnams so //
translated: ƒÄryas are those who have gone far from sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de dag kyang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams te /
analyzed: de dag kyang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams te /
translated: They are also learners and nonlearners.

original: de dag gi chos rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams te /
analyzed: de dag gi chos rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams te /
translated: Their dharmas are the paths of seeing, cultivation, and the adept.

original: de dag ma thob pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ma thob pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid do //
translated: Non-acquisition of these is the state of an ordinary person.

original: ma thob pa ni 'dir 'phags pa'i chos ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ma thob pa ni 'dir 'phags pa'i chos ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Non-acquisition here is the non-arising of the noble dharmas.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la so so'i skye bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la so so'i skye bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the continuum of a sentient being in whom the noble dharmas have not arisen is called an ordinary person.

original: 'phags pa'i chos skyes pa la ni 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos skyes pa la ni 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the noble dharmas have arisen, it is called a noble one.

original: 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is engagement?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the uninterrupted engagement of cause and effect.

original: skad cig gcig la'am /
analyzed: skad cig gcig la'am /
translated: It is not engagement in a single moment,

original: rgyun chad pa la ni 'jug pa gdags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa la ni 'jug pa gdags pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is it engagement in a discontinuous continuum.

original: so sor nge pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor nge pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is determination?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa nyid la so sor nges pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa nyid la so sor nges pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Determination is established as the difference of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa yang 'dod pa'i yul gyi ni legs par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa yang 'dod pa'i yul gyi ni legs par spyad pa'o //
translated: The good conduct of the object of desire is the cause.

original: mi 'dod pa ni nyes par spyad ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ni 'bras bu @231a * //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni nyes par spyad ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ni 'bras bu @231a * //
translated: The undesirable is the result of bad conduct, etc.

original: so so ba rnams kyi rgyu tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: so so ba rnams kyi rgyu tha dad pa'o //
translated: The different results of different causes are called ‚Äúdistinct.‚Äù

original: 'byor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'byor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is ‚Äúfitness‚Äù?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'tsham pa la 'byor pa gdags te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'tsham pa la 'byor pa gdags te /
translated: Fitness is the designation indicating the correspondence of cause and effect.

original: dper na sbyin pa ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang 'tsham par rigs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang 'tsham par rigs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, generosity is the cause of the abundance of wealth, and the abundance of wealth is the result of generosity.

original: mgyogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mgyogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ‚Äúspeed‚Äù?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba la mgyogs pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba la mgyogs pa zhes gdags so //
translated: Speed is the designation indicating the rapid occurrence of cause and effect.

original: go rims gang zhe na /
analyzed: go rims gang zhe na /
translated: What is ‚Äúorder‚Äù?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu re re nas 'byung ba la go rims zhes gdags te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu re re nas 'byung ba la go rims zhes gdags te /
translated: Order is the designation indicating the successive occurrence of cause and effect.

original: re re nas 'byung gi cig car du 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re re nas 'byung gi cig car du 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is successive, not simultaneous.

original: dus gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang zhe na /
translated: What is ‚Äútime‚Äù?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun du 'byung ba la dus zhes gdags te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun du 'byung ba la dus zhes gdags te /
translated: Time is the designation indicating the continuous occurrence of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'byung ba la de las rgyu dang 'bras bu byung nas 'gags pa gang yin pa de 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags so //üîΩgang ma byung ba de ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'byung ba la de las rgyu dang 'bras bu byung nas 'gags pa gang yin pa de 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags so // gang ma byung ba de ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
translated: The past time is the time when the cause and effect have already arisen and have already ceased.üîΩThe future time is the time when the cause and effect have not yet arisen.

original: gang byung ba ma 'gags pa de da ltar byung ba'i dus so //
analyzed: gang byung ba ma 'gags pa de da ltar byung ba'i dus so //
translated: The present time is the time when the cause and effect have arisen but not yet ceased.

original: yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang zhe na /
translated: What is a place?

original: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng dang phyogs bcu thams cad la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa nyid la yul zhes gdags te /
analyzed: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng dang phyogs bcu thams cad la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa nyid la yul zhes gdags te /
translated: A place is the place where the cause and effect exist, in the east, south, west, north, below, above, and in all ten directions.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bus phyogs khyab pa la yul zhes gdags so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bus phyogs khyab pa la yul zhes gdags so //
translated: A place is the place where the cause and effect are extended.

original: gzugs su bsdus pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs su bsdus pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur rig par bya ste /
translated: The place is to be understood as the cause and effect included in form,

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni phyogs la khyab par byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni phyogs la khyab par byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the formless is not capable of extending in a place.

original: grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is number?

original: 'du byed rnams kyi so so tha dad pa la grangs zhes gdags te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi so so tha dad pa la grangs zhes gdags te /
translated: Number is the designation of the individualities of formations.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin zhing gcig pa'i bdag nyid la gnyis zhes bya ba grangs mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin zhing gcig pa'i bdag nyid la gnyis zhes bya ba grangs mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not different means that it is not tenable to say that a single nature is two.

original: tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a collection?

original: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa la tshogs pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pa la tshogs pa zhes gdags so //
translated: A collection is a designation for a gathering of causes and conditions.

original: de ltar na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed 'di dag ni chos rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la gdags pas rtags yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed 'di dag ni chos rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la gdags pas rtags yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these formations that are not associated with minds should be understood as existing as designations in the specific states of mind and mental factors.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of formations has been explained.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad par bya ste /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness should be explained immediately following the aggregate of formations.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the root text asks, What is consciousness?

original: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: and responds, The awareness of an object.

original: dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul te /
translated: An object is the object of a mind or a mental factor.

original: de yang gzugs nas chos kyi bar du rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de yang gzugs nas chos kyi bar du rnam pa drug go //
translated: It is of six types, ranging from form to entities.

original: de yang rnam par rig pa ni @231b 'dzin pa dang / rtog pa dang khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rig pa ni @231b 'dzin pa dang / rtog pa dang khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, consciousness is a synonym for grasping, thought, and understanding.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ste mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ste mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: It is the six consciousnesses that engage objects: the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi dbang po la brten nas yul so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi dbang po la brten nas yul so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: Among them, the eye consciousness is the discernment of objects based on the eye faculty.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos thams cad so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos thams cad so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the mind consciousness is the discernment of all phenomena based on the mind faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the nature of consciousness,

original: de'i rnam grangs bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsems dang yid kyang de yin te //
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs bstan pa'i phyir / sems dang yid kyang de yin te //
translated: in order to teach its synonyms,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrnam par shes pa de ni sems zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / rnam par shes pa de ni sems zhes kyang bya /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúIt is also the mind and the mental faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThat consciousness is also called the mind

original: yid ces kyang bya'o //
analyzed: yid ces kyang bya'o //
translated: and also called the mental faculty.

original: rnam grangs kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the synonyms,üîΩit says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe mind is the continuum of consciousness.üîΩThe mental faculty is the immediately preceding condition.‚Äù

original: sna tshogs pa dang yid rten byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang yid rten byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúBecause it is diverse and because it serves as the support for the mind.‚Äù

original: sna tshogs pa'i phyir sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i phyir sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind is called ‚Äúdiverse‚Äù because it is the basis for the various forms of mental activity.

original: de ma thag pa'i sems kyi rten byed pas yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i sems kyi rten byed pas yid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúmind‚Äù because it serves as the support for the immediately preceding mind.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa so sor rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / dmigs pa so sor rnam par rig pa yang rnam pa du ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa so sor rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / dmigs pa so sor rnam par rig pa yang rnam pa du ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The consciousness that engages those objects is the nature of the awareness of individual objects, and the awareness of individual objects is of many different types.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni sna tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni sna tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the consciousnesses of the eye, etc., are called ‚Äúdiverse.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de'i dbang po la brten nas 'byung ba na yul rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbang po la brten nas 'byung ba na yul rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Thus, when consciousness arises in dependence on its organ, it is called the ‚Äúconsciousness of the object,‚Äù

original: dbang po rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not called the ‚Äúconsciousness of the organ.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug po gang dang gang 'gags pa de dang de ni de ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rten gyi dngos por gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug po gang dang gang 'gags pa de dang de ni de ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rten gyi dngos por gnas te /
translated: In this way, the six consciousnesses of the eye, etc., are the basis for the arising of the immediately preceding consciousness, because they are the support for the arising of the immediately preceding consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i sems kyi rten byed pas yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag pa'i sems kyi rten byed pas yid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called manas because it serves as the basis for the immediately preceding mind.

original: sna tshogs pa'i phyir sems zhes bya'o zhes gang bshad pa de ni rigs kyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i phyir sems zhes bya'o zhes gang bshad pa de ni rigs kyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
translated: The statement that it is called citta because it is a collection is made with reference to a class, not to a moment.

original: skad cig ni dmigs pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa yin pas sna tshogs zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ni dmigs pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa yin pas sna tshogs zhes mi bya ste /
translated: A moment is a particular aspect of an object, and therefore it is not called a collection.

original: de ni dngos su sems ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos su sems ma yin no //
translated: It is not the actual mind.

original: dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /üîΩ'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste / 'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The actual mind is the store consciousness.

original: 'di ltar de'i 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate its cause, the root text states, ‚Äúbecause it is the accumulation of the seeds of all the formative forces.‚Äù

original: skad cig re re la 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pas sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig re re la 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pas sems zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called citta because it is the accumulation of the seeds of all the formative forces in each moment.

original: dngos su na de nyid sems so //üîΩbsags pa ni yang dang yang sa bon yongs su gsos pa'am /üîΩ'du byed @232a * //
analyzed: dngos su na de nyid sems so // bsags pa ni yang dang yang sa bon yongs su gsos pa'am / 'du byed @232a * //
translated: It is the actual mind.

original: kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'o //
translated: The accumulation is the repeated activation of the seeds or the continuity of the seeds of the formative forces.üîΩThe formative forces are the volitions that cause the mind to engage in what is wholesome, unwholesome, or neutral.

original: 'du byed rnams ni 'dir zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams su 'dod de /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni 'dir zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams su 'dod de /
translated: Formations are here asserted to be all contaminated dharmas.

original: de dag kyang rkyen bzhi las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang rkyen bzhi las 'byung ngo //
translated: They arise from four conditions.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags te /
translated: The causal condition is the latent impressions in the store consciousness.

original: yang dang yang 'du byed rnams kun du 'byung bas sa bon brtas pa la bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang 'du byed rnams kun du 'byung bas sa bon brtas pa la bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they repeatedly produce formations, the seeds are called latent impressions.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
translated: The dominant condition is the faculties such as the eyes.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'o //
translated: The condition as cause is the immediately preceding condition, the just ceased consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objective condition is form, etc.

original: 'di ltar mdo las kyang mig nyams par ma gyur la gzugs rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa dang / de skyed pa yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par gyur na de las byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las kyang mig nyams par ma gyur la gzugs rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa dang / de skyed pa yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par gyur na de las byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, a scripture says, When the eye is not damaged, forms appear, and the attention that produces them is present, then the visual consciousness that arises from them arises.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should explain the consciousnesses of the ear, etc., as appropriate.

original: rgyu'i rkyen rtag tu gnas pa dang / shes par dka' ba'i phyir ma smos so //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen rtag tu gnas pa dang / shes par dka' ba'i phyir ma smos so //
translated: The causal condition is not mentioned because it is always present and difficult to understand.

original: de'i 'og tu kun du tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩkun du tshol ba'i 'og tu rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun du tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o // kun du tshol ba'i 'og tu rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: After that, there is the mental consciousness that searches.üîΩAfter searching, there is the mental consciousness that determines.

original: rnam par 'jog pa'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste ;
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste ;
translated: After determining, there is the mental consciousness that conceptualizes.

original: de'i tshe yul las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yul las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, there is defilement and purification with regard to objects.

original: de'i tshe bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed sems pa'i bdag nyid can rnams mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed sems pa'i bdag nyid can rnams mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: At that time, one accumulates meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable formations that are of the nature of volition.

original: mngon par 'du byas pa de dag 'gag pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byas pa de dag 'gag pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags so //
translated: When those accumulated formations cease, they become the habitual tendencies of karmic ripening in the store consciousness.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gso bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gso bar byed do //
translated: It nourishes the seeds of the natural outcome.üîΩFrom the store consciousness, the formative forces of merit,

original: de la rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la brten nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la brten nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: nonmerit, and the imperturbable arise in dependence on the seeds of the natural outcome.

original: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags la brten nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du 'grub bo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags la brten nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du 'grub bo //
translated: From the store consciousness, the store consciousness itself arises in another life in dependence on the seeds of the karmic result.

original: de la mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan gang yin pa @232b de dag la yang tshul 'di nyid do //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan gang yin pa @232b de dag la yang tshul 'di nyid do //
translated: The same process occurs for all other dharmas, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or undefined.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags nyid gso bar byed kyi /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags nyid gso bar byed kyi /
translated: The undefined nourishes only the seeds of the natural outcome.

original: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not nourish the seeds of the karmic result,

original: de dag la rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no karmic result.

original: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, the storehouse consciousness has two modes.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la brten nas rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /üîΩ'di ltar 'du byed thams cad rang gi sa bon bskyed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bye brag tu 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos por gnas pas de ni 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags la brten nas rgyu dang 'bras bu ste / 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad rang gi sa bon bskyed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bye brag tu 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos por gnas pas de ni 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is a cause in dependence on the seeds of the various karmic predispositions, and it is an effect in dependence on those same karmic predispositions.üîΩIn this way, the storehouse consciousness is the cause of all the karmic predispositions because it is the basis for the seeds of all the karmic predispositions.üîΩThe storehouse consciousness is the effect of all the karmic predispositions because it is the basis for the seeds that are generated by the karmic predispositions.üîΩThe storehouse consciousness is the effect of all the karmic predispositions, but it is not their cause, in the sense of being the dominant condition for the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the various entities of the three realms.

original: 'du byed thams cad de dag gi sa bon nye bar len pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu yin no //üîΩrnam par smin pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad de dag gi sa bon nye bar len pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu yin no // rnam par smin pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The storehouse consciousness is the effect of the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms, but it is not their cause, in the sense of being the dominant condition for the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms.üîΩThe storehouse consciousness is the effect of the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms, but it is not their cause, in the sense of being the dominant condition for the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms.üîΩThe storehouse consciousness is the effect of the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms, but it is not their cause, in the sense of being the dominant condition for the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: The storehouse consciousness is the effect of the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms, but it is not their cause, in the sense of being the dominant condition for the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms.üîΩThe storehouse consciousness is the effect of the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms, but it is not their cause, in the sense of being the dominant condition for the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms.üîΩThe storehouse consciousness is the effect of the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the three realms, but it is not their cause, in the sense of being the dominant condition for the karmic predispositions that are the seeds of the entities of the

original: rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags la brten nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags la brten nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is the cause of the consciousness that is the ripening of karma in other similar life-forms, based on the habitual tendencies of ripening.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su chad pa dang / rnam shes yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su chad pa dang / rnam shes yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The active forms of consciousness are limited in terms of their objects and their aspects, because they have form, sound, etc., as their objects and because they have the aspects of specific and general characteristics.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is the basis of all experience is not limited in terms of its objects and its aspects.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su gcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su gcad par mi nus so //
translated: Its objects and aspects cannot be limited.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa gnyis la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa gnyis la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Because the consciousness that is the basis of all experience operates on two kinds of objects.

original: nang gi nye bar len pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod la rnam par rig pa rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi nye bar len pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod la rnam par rig pa rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: It is not limited in its aspects, because it is aware of the internal appropriated aggregates and the external world.

original: de la nang gi nye bar len pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de la nang gi nye bar len pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs so //
translated: The internal appropriating is the latent impressions of the attachment to the imagined reality and the form of the sense faculties together with their bases.

original: dmigs pa 'di gnyis ni phra ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang rtogs par dka' bas de'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: dmigs pa 'di gnyis ni phra ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang rtogs par dka' bas de'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya'i /
translated: These two objects are subtle, and therefore difficult to understand even for the wise of the world. Therefore, they are called ‚Äúuninterrupted objects and aspects,‚Äù

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not non-objects.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rang @233a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rang @233a * //
translated: The active consciousnesses are of the nature of virtue, affliction, and indeterminate.

original: bzhin no // kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rigs gcig pa yin no //üîΩde la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhin no // kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rigs gcig pa yin no // de la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness is of one type.üîΩIt is not of the nature of virtue or nonvirtue,

original: de dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not concomitant with virtue or nonvirtue.

original: de ni sems las byung ba kun du 'gro ba yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa lnga po kho na dang / mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de ni sems las byung ba kun du 'gro ba yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa lnga po kho na dang / mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is associated only with the five omnipresent mental factors: attention, contact, feeling, conception, and volition.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par sngon gyi las kyi 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung bas gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par sngon gyi las kyi 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung bas gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs so //
translated: The storehouse consciousness is of the nature of indeterminate because it is the result of the evolution of former actions and is associated with mental activities.

original: rgyun chags par 'jug pa'o //üîΩde la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rgyun chags par 'jug pa'o // de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba nas bzung ste /
translated: It is continuous.üîΩThe storehouse consciousness is said to be continuous because it evolves in a series uninterrupted like the stream of a river.

original: ji tsam na 'chi 'pho ba de'i bar du skad cig rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug gi /'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du bar skabs bar skabs su chad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji tsam na 'chi 'pho ba de'i bar du skad cig rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug gi /'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du bar skabs bar skabs su chad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the active forms of consciousness, which are interrupted from time to time.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, after eye consciousness, ear consciousness and so on arise, and after ear consciousness, eye consciousness and so on arise, and similarly, after nose consciousness and so on, eye consciousness and so on arise.
