original: de bzhin du dge ba'i 'og tu mi dge ba 'byung ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'og tu dge ba dang / de gnyis ka'i 'og tu lung du mi ston pa dang / khams dman pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma dang / khams bar ma'i 'og tu khams gya nom pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i 'og tu mi dge ba 'byung ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'og tu dge ba dang / de gnyis ka'i 'og tu lung du mi ston pa dang / khams dman pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma dang / khams bar ma'i 'og tu khams gya nom pa dang /
translated: Similarly, after virtue, nonvirtue arises, after nonvirtue, virtue arises, after both, unobscured neutral states arise, after lower realms, intermediate realms arise, after intermediate realms, excellent realms arise,

original: khams gya nom pa'i 'og tu gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / khams gya nom pa ma yin pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma zhes bya ba rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khams gya nom pa'i 'og tu gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / khams gya nom pa ma yin pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma zhes bya ba rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
translated: after excellent realms, nonexcellent realms arise, and after nonexcellent realms, intermediate realms arise.

original: shi ba la thug gi bar du rdzas gcig tu 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shi ba la thug gi bar du rdzas gcig tu 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that they are engaged in a single substance until death.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po ma gtogs par gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po ma gtogs par gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Apart from the six engaging consciousnesses, what is the evidence for the existence of the foundation consciousness?

original: lung dang rigs pas mngon no //üîΩde la ni 'di ni lung yin te /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas mngon no // de la ni 'di ni lung yin te /
translated: It is evident through scripture and reasoning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las /
translated: As for scripture, the BhagavƒÅn says in the Abhidharma S≈´tra:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings //
translated: The realm without beginning is

original: chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
translated: the abode of all phenomena.üîΩBecause it exists, all beings

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // @233b mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // @233b mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and even nirvƒÅ·πáa is attained.

original: yang dgongs ba nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: yang dgongs ba nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Samdhinirmocana S≈´tra it says:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is deep and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //üîΩbdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab // bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: all seeds fall upon it like a flowing stream.üîΩIf I taught it to the childish,

original: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: they would imagine it to be a self.

original: rigs pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: As for reasoning,

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa po rnams las langs nas yang yul rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa po rnams las langs nas yang yul rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung /
translated: Thus, when one arises from the meditative attainment of cessation, the meditative attainment of nonperception, or the state of nonperception, the entry consciousness, called the ‚Äúperceiving of objects,‚Äù arises again.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The foundation consciousness is different from the active forms of consciousness.

original: 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa par gyur pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ma lus par 'gag pa las yang ldang ba'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa par gyur pa na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ma lus par 'gag pa las yang ldang ba'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung du mi rung ngo //
translated: When one enters the meditative attainment of cessation or the meditative attainment of nonperception, or when one enters the state of nonperception, all the active forms of consciousness cease completely. If the foundation consciousness did not exist, the active forms of consciousness would not arise again when one arises from these meditative states.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems las de 'byung du mi rung ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems las de 'byung du mi rung ste /
translated: Nor is it possible for them to arise from the mind that is entering the meditative attainment,

original: de 'gags nas ring du lon pa dang / 'gags pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gags nas ring du lon pa dang / 'gags pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a long time has passed since it ceased, and because that which has ceased does not exist.

original: med pa ni rgyur yang mi rung 'bras bur yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: med pa ni rgyur yang mi rung 'bras bur yang mi rung ste /
translated: That which does not exist is not suitable as a cause and is not suitable as an effect,

original: gtso bo dang bdag la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso bo dang bdag la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower, the son of a barren woman, and so on.

original: gang yang 'di snyam du dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la skye ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med kyi ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / 'das pa ni dngos po rnams kyi byed pa'i sgo nas yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'di snyam du dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo la skye ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med kyi ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / 'das pa ni dngos po rnams kyi byed pa'i sgo nas yin te /
translated: If you think that the intrinsic reality of things does not arise and does not disintegrate, but that future, present, and past are due to the activity of things,

original: 'di ltar bya ba mi byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba mi byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: then that which does not perform its activity is future.

original: bya ba byed pa ni da ltar ro //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa ni da ltar ro //
translated: That which performs its activity is present.üîΩThat which has ceased performing its activity is past.

original: byed ba rgyun chad pa ni 'das pa'o zhes bya'o snyam du sems pa de lta bu yin na ni byed pa las dngos po gzhan yin par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: byed ba rgyun chad pa ni 'das pa'o zhes bya'o snyam du sems pa de lta bu yin na ni byed pa las dngos po gzhan yin par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If you think this, then you must accept that the activity is different from the thing.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis kyi dus na byed pa med kyang dngos po khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis kyi dus na byed pa med kyang dngos po khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that things exist in the past and future, even though the activity does not exist in the past and future.

original: de ltar na med pa las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ni byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na med pa las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ni byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, because of arising from what does not exist and because of becoming nonexistent after arising, arising and destruction are the agents,

original: dngos po rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not entities.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyis @234a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyis @234a * //
translated: It is not the case that form, feeling, conception, formations, and consciousness

original: ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: are the agents.

original: rtag tu rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa dang / de yang 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa dang / de yang 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they always have their own nature, and because they do not arise and do not perish.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni 'gog pa bzhin du mi rtag pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni 'gog pa bzhin du mi rtag pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., would not be impermanent, like cessation.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, they would not be suffering,

original: mdo las ni mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las ni mi rtag pa gang yin pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: because a sutra declares: ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni phung po rnams la ni mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid du sems pa phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni phung po rnams la ni mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid du sems pa phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mind that thinks the aggregates are impermanent and suffering would be erroneous.

original: phyin ci log gis ni nyon mongs pa spang bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gis ni nyon mongs pa spang bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the erroneous would eliminate the defilements,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la rtag pa dang bde bar phyin ci log pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la rtag pa dang bde bar phyin ci log pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the error of permanence and the error of pleasure with regard to the impermanent and painful do not eliminate the impermanence and pain.

original: byed pa la ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pas 'dus byas nyid yin te /
analyzed: byed pa la ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pas 'dus byas nyid yin te /
translated: Since origination and destruction exist for the agent, it is a conditioned thing.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams su ni ma 'dus pas phung po drug par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams su ni ma 'dus pas phung po drug par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is not included among the aggregates of form, etc., it must be admitted that there is a sixth aggregate.üîΩAgain, do not say that all contaminated things are included by the appropriating aggregates and that all conditioned things are included by the aggregates.

original: yang nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad dang / phung po rnams kyis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so zhes ma zer cig / yang gzhan na re byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad dang / phung po rnams kyis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so zhes ma zer cig / yang gzhan na re byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Again, another says: The agent is the appropriator of the effect.

original: chos gang zhig chos gang gi rgyu dngos por gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang zhig chos gang gi rgyu dngos por gnas pa ste /
translated: That dharma which is the cause of a certain dharma is the cause of that dharma.

original: chos dang chos de 'bras bur 'dzin pa de'i phyir rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa ni dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos de 'bras bur 'dzin pa de'i phyir rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa ni dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Because of the apprehension of the dharma and the result of the dharma, the entity that exists as the cause holds the result of entities.

original: chos de nyid rgyu'i dngos por gnas pas na chos rnams las byed pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: chos de nyid rgyu'i dngos por gnas pas na chos rnams las byed pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Since that very dharma exists as the entity of the cause, the dharma is not a different agent from the entities.

original: de bas na gong du smos pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na gong du smos pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the previously mentioned error does not occur.

original: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid de /
translated: Not different means that very thing.

original: de ni 'di skad du chos las byed pa gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du chos las byed pa gzhan ma yin te /
translated: This is stated as follows: The dharma is not a different agent.

original: chos nyid byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid byed pa'o //
translated: The dharma itself is the agent.

original: de bzhin du byed pa las kyang chos gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa las kyang chos gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the agent is not a different dharma from the action.

original: byed pa nyid chos yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa nyid chos yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The action itself is the dharma.

original: de lta na ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gnyis kyis chos rnams byed pa bzhin du med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gnyis kyis chos rnams byed pa bzhin du med par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the past and future would not exist like the present dharma.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes smras pa btang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes smras pa btang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the assertion that the past and future exist is relinquished.

original: yang na byed pa yang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du chos las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dus gsum par khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: yang na byed pa yang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du chos las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dus gsum par khas blang dgos te /
translated: Or else, since the activity is not different from the entity of the phenomenon, it must be accepted as being in the three times,

original: de lta na yang byed pa las dus rnams rnam par gzhag par smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de lta na yang byed pa las dus rnams rnam par gzhag par smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro//
translated: and in that case, the assertion that the times are posited from activity is undermined.

original: @234b bya ba byed pa ni da ltar du 'dod de /üîΩgzhan ni gzhan gyis byed pa la /
analyzed: @234b bya ba byed pa ni da ltar du 'dod de / gzhan ni gzhan gyis byed pa la /
translated: Activity is asserted to be present,üîΩbecause the other two times are posited in dependence on the present.

original: de byas zin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de byas zin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The other two times are posited in dependence on the present.

original: ma byas pa ni byed dgos kyi byas zin pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma byas pa ni byed dgos kyi byas zin pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The past is posited as that which has already performed its activity, and the future is posited as that which has not yet performed its activity.

original: de'i phyir byed pa dang chos gnyis ni byas pa dang / ma byas pa ma yin pas tha dad par mngon no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa dang chos gnyis ni byas pa dang / ma byas pa ma yin pas tha dad par mngon no ;
translated: Therefore, since the activity and the phenomenon are not the same, it is clear that they are different.

original: / de lta bas na gong du smos pa'i skyon de yod do //
analyzed: / de lta bas na gong du smos pa'i skyon de yod do //
translated: Therefore, the previously mentioned errors ensue.

original: chos dang byed pa gnyis kyang tha dad pa ma yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos dang byed pa gnyis kyang tha dad pa ma yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the phenomenon and the activity are not different, then cause and effect would not exist.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu yang rgyu bzhin du thog ma nyid nas yongs su grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu la ji zhig byed na rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu yang rgyu bzhin du thog ma nyid nas yongs su grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu la ji zhig byed na rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Thus, because the effect is already fully established like the cause from the very beginning, what would the cause do for the effect?

original: mi byed na yang rgyu zhes ji skad du bya 'bras bu yang des ma byas na de'i 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi byed na yang rgyu zhes ji skad du bya 'bras bu yang des ma byas na de'i 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not do anything, how could it be called a cause? And if the effect is not produced by it, how could it be its effect?

original: byed pa rnams nyid phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byed pa rnams nyid phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur gyi /
translated: Only the activities would be the entities of cause and effect.

original: chos rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: But not the phenomena.

original: 'di ltar byed pa yod na byed pa gzhan 'byung gi med na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa yod na byed pa gzhan 'byung gi med na ni ma yin te /
translated: Because when the activity exists, another activity arises, but not when it does not exist.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not from the nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin las kyang chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin las kyang chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: And from the nature of phenomena, another phenomenon does not arise,

original: rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it always exists.

original: de ltar na gang yod na gang 'byung gi med na ni mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang yod na gang 'byung gi med na ni mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, that which arises when this exists and does not arise when it does not exist is its cause.

original: cig shos ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'o //
translated: The other is the effect. This is what is accepted in the world.

original: de ltar na chos kyi rang bzhin ni rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin pa ni 'jig rten pa dang bstan bcos dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi rang bzhin ni rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin pa ni 'jig rten pa dang bstan bcos dang 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, the nature of things is neither a cause nor an effect, and this contradicts both the world and treatises.

original: gzhan dag na re chos rnams las byed pa de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos rnams las byed pa de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: The activity of things is inexpressible as either the same or different.

original: ci'i phyir de nyid ces mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de nyid ces mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said to be the same?

original: chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not the nature of things.

original: / ci'i phyir gzhan zhes mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir gzhan zhes mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said to be different?

original: chos kyi rang bzhin de'i ngo bo nyid yang ma yin pas gzhan zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin de'i ngo bo nyid yang ma yin pas gzhan zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Because it is not the intrinsic reality of the nature of things.

original: de lta na ni gang de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir med pa nyid yin te /
translated: If that is so, then that which is neither the intrinsic reality of that nor the intrinsic reality of something else is nonexistent because it lacks intrinsic reality like the horn of a donkey.

original: med pa ni dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa ni dus rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is nonexistent be the cause for positing time?

original: de ltar na byed pa las dus rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na byed pa las dus rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub bo //
translated: Thus the temporal determination of activity is not established in any way.

original: de lta bas na dngos po ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin /
translated: Therefore, a non-arisen entity is future,

original: 'gags pa ni 'das pa yin /üîΩbyung lam 'gags pa ni de ltar yin par khas @235a * //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni 'das pa yin / byung lam 'gags pa ni de ltar yin par khas @235a * //
translated: a ceased entity is past,üîΩand an entity that has arisen and not yet ceased is present.

original: blang bar bya'o //üîΩbya ba mi byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa /üîΩbya ba byed pa ni da ltar /
analyzed: blang bar bya'o // bya ba mi byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa / bya ba byed pa ni da ltar /
translated: This is how you should accept it.

original: byed pa rgyun chad pa ni 'das pa'o zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa rgyun chad pa ni 'das pa'o zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not accept that the future is the non-performance of activity, the present is the performance of activity, and the past is the termination of activity.

original: yang gzhan dag na re dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang sems ni gcig gi sa bon gcig yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang sems ni gcig gi sa bon gcig yin te /
translated: Moreover, some say: The form and mind that possess faculties are the seeds of each other.

original: de'i phyir 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa las ldang ba na dbang po dang bcas ba'i gzugs las sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa las ldang ba na dbang po dang bcas ba'i gzugs las sems 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, when one arises from the meditative attainment of cessation, or from the meditative attainment of non-perception, or from the state of non-perception, the mind arises from form that possesses faculties.

original: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems las kyang 'gags nas ring du lon ba dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems las kyang 'gags nas ring du lon ba dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, form that is endowed with faculties arises from a mind that has long ceased, such as when one dies in the formless realm.

original: de lta bas na 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ca dgos zhes zer te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ca dgos zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore, what need is there for an alaya consciousness?

original: de ltar na sems can re re'i sems kyi rgyud kyang gnyis gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can re re'i sems kyi rgyud kyang gnyis gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the mindstreams of individual sentient beings would be twofold.

original: gcig ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs las byung /
analyzed: gcig ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i gzugs las byung /
translated: One would arise from form that is endowed with faculties,

original: cig shos ni sems las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig shos ni sems las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the other would arise from mind.

original: gzugs med pa'i sems su 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni gzugs med pas ldang ba yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i sems su 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni gzugs med pas ldang ba yang med do //
translated: One who has entered the meditative attainment of cessation in the formless realm would not arise from the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur bas rtog pa 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur bas rtog pa 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, this would be nothing but complete nirvana. Thus this theory is untenable.

original: rgyu ni bdag yod pa dang ldan zhing g-yo ba med la mi rtag cing nus pa yod pa gcig pur 'dod kyi /
analyzed: rgyu ni bdag yod pa dang ldan zhing g-yo ba med la mi rtag cing nus pa yod pa gcig pur 'dod kyi /
translated: The cause is asserted to be a single entity that possesses a self, is unmoving, is impermanent, and is capable.

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the opposite of that.

original: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di 'byung /
analyzed: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di 'byung /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúBecause this exists, that comes to be.

original: 'di skye ba'i phyir 'di skye ste /
analyzed: 'di skye ba'i phyir 'di skye ste /
translated: Because this is produced, that is produced.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, with ignorance as condition, there are volitions.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na rgyu rtag pa ma yin zhing med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu rtag pa ma yin zhing med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, a cause is not permanent and it is not nonexistent.

original: byed pa yod pa yang ma yin zhing nus pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa yod pa yang ma yin zhing nus pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that there is an agent and it is not that there is no potentiality.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The storehouse consciousness is endowed with the seeds of all conditioned factors.

original: shi ba la thug gi bar du rgyun chags par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: shi ba la thug gi bar du rgyun chags par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It occurs in a continuous series until the end of death.

original: sems med pa'i gnas las ldang ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems med pa'i gnas las ldang ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: When one arises from the mindless states, the active forms of consciousness arise from the storehouse consciousness.

original: mdo las kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lus las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lus las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: A s≈´tra states, ‚ÄúConsciousness does not depart from the body in the state of composure that is a cessation.‚Äù

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa lus las mi @235b 'da' ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan mi rung ngo //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa lus las mi @235b 'da' ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan mi rung ngo //
translated: When one enters meditative attainment, consciousness does not depart from the body, and this is not possible apart from the foundation consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gal te 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig kun du 'byung bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig kun du 'byung bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that a consciousness other than the foundation consciousness arises in meditative attainment,

original: de lta na ni gsum 'dus pa'i rig pa dang / reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis kyang kun du 'byung bar khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: de lta na ni gsum 'dus pa'i rig pa dang / reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis kyang kun du 'byung bar khas blang dgos so //
translated: then you must accept that discernment, feeling, and intention also arise, because the sutras state that the three contact, feeling, and discernment arise together.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba yod pas 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba yod pas 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because feeling and discernment exist, this meditative attainment would not be the cessation of feeling and discernment.

original: gang yang mdo las tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes gsungs pa yang tshor ba thams cad sred pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang mdo las tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes gsungs pa yang tshor ba thams cad sred pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Also, the sutra statement that craving has feeling as a condition does not mean that all feeling is a condition of craving.

original: de bzhin du reg pa thams cad kyang 'du shes dang tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin pas nyes pa med do snyam du sems pa de yang de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa thams cad kyang 'du shes dang tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin pas nyes pa med do snyam du sems pa de yang de lta ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, since all contacts are not conditions of discrimination and feeling, there is no fault.

original: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa 'byung zhes bye brag tu mdzad kyi reg pa ni gang du yang de ltar bye brag mi mdzad pa 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa 'byung zhes bye brag tu mdzad kyi reg pa ni gang du yang de ltar bye brag mi mdzad pa 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so, because in another s≈´tra it is specified that craving arises in dependence on feeling that arises from contact accompanied by ignorance, but contact is not specified in any s≈´tra.

original: de lta bas na 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa rnams las ldang ba na gdon mi za bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pas sa bon thams cad gnas skabs kun du 'byung ba las skye bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa rnams las ldang ba na gdon mi za bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pas sa bon thams cad gnas skabs kun du 'byung ba las skye bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when one arises from the meditative attainment of cessation, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, and the state of nondiscernment, one must accept that all seeds arise from the foundation consciousness, which is the universal basis of all states.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the store consciousness is different from the active forms of consciousness, because the latter engage their objects in different ways, depending on the objective condition.

original: phyir ro zhes tha mar bstan pa ni 'dir yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes tha mar bstan pa ni 'dir yang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the objective condition‚Äù is to be supplied here.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang yul gzugs la sogs pa lnga'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang yul gzugs la sogs pa lnga'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: The objective condition of the five consciousnesses of eye, etc., is the five sense objects of form, etc., and the objective condition of mental consciousness is all dharmas.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa las sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa gzhan no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa las sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa gzhan no //
translated: The form of a sound, etc., is different from the form of a visible object, etc.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa las gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa gzhan no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa las gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa gzhan no //
translated: The form of a visible object, etc., is different from the form of a sound, etc. The form of a blue object, etc., is different from the form of a yellow object, etc.

original: de ltar kun du yang rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun du yang rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be extended in the same way to all the sense objects.

original: rnam pa gzhan @236a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan @236a * //
translated: The form of a sound, etc., is different from the form of a visible object, etc. The form of a blue object, etc., is different from the form of a yellow object, etc.

original: du 'jug pa bdag thob pa ni rnam par shes pa 'di'i yin pas rnam par shes pa de ni rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa ste de yod pas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: du 'jug pa bdag thob pa ni rnam par shes pa 'di'i yin pas rnam par shes pa de ni rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa ste de yod pas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Since this consciousness is the appropriator of the self, it is the consciousness that engages in other aspects. Since it exists, it is the very engagement in other aspects.üîΩSince it is the cause that depends on the objective condition, it is the very engagement in other aspects that depends on the objective condition.

original: de dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i rgyus rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa gang gi yin pad de dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i rgyus rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa gang gi yin pad de dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is the cause that depends on the objective condition, it is the very engagement in other aspects that depends on the objective condition.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltas nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du dmigs pa'i rkyen la ltas nas rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Since it is the cause that depends on the objective condition, it is the very engagement in other aspects that depends on the objective condition.üîΩSince

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid de yang ji ltar dmigs pa la mi ltos par mi rung ba de bzhin du rgyu'i rkyen la mi ltos par mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa nyid de yang ji ltar dmigs pa la mi ltos par mi rung ba de bzhin du rgyu'i rkyen la mi ltos par mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: And just as it is impossible for it to occur in a different way without depending on the objective condition, so it is impossible for it to occur without depending on the causal condition.

original: gang dag gi sa bon rnams dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi spyi'i rkyen te /
analyzed: gang dag gi sa bon rnams dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi spyi'i rkyen te /
translated: The universal condition is that which possesses the seeds of all of them.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni gcig gi sa bon du gcig mi rung ngo //üîΩdge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / dman pa dang / 'bring dang / gya nom pa'i khams pa rnams dang / 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni gcig gi sa bon du gcig mi rung ngo // dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / dman pa dang / 'bring dang / gya nom pa'i khams pa rnams dang / 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The active forms of consciousness cannot be the seeds of one another.

original: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la rim pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la rim pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the active forms of consciousness are of different types, such as wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined; inferior, middling, and superior; of the realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm; mundane and supramundane; and with and without impurity.

original: de nyid kyi bag chags bsgo ba yang ma mthong la //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bag chags bsgo ba yang ma mthong la //
translated: The seeds of these are not the same.üîΩThe seeds of the active forms of consciousness are not the seeds of the store consciousness, because the latter is not perfumed by the former.

original: gzhan gyi dus gzhan na yang ma yin zhing 'brel pa med par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus gzhan na yang ma yin zhing 'brel pa med par yang ma yin no //
translated: The store consciousness is not perfumed by the active forms of consciousness, because they do not accompany it.

original: 'on kyang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa nyid kyi me tog la sogs pas 'bru mar rnams la bsgo bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa nyid kyi me tog la sogs pas 'bru mar rnams la bsgo bar mthong ste /
translated: that arise and cease simultaneously with the oil-seed are what cause the oil.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i bag chags kyi rnam par shes pa dang / dus mtshungs pa de nyid las 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed nus ba rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i bag chags kyi rnam par shes pa dang / dus mtshungs pa de nyid las 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed nus ba rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la byed do //
translated: Therefore, the arising and ceasing of the consciousness that is the maturation of karma and the consciousness that is the same in time as it are what cause the active forms of consciousness to be able to produce a result that is similar to itself.

original: de'i nus pa ni bag chags zhes bya'o //üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / dus rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa de dag @236b gis bsras  pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa las yang dmigs pa la ltos pa dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams
analyzed: de'i nus pa ni bag chags zhes bya'o // 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / dus rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa de dag @236b gis bsras  pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa las yang dmigs pa la ltos pa dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan du 'jug pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams
translated: The power of the active forms of consciousness to produce a result is called a ‚Äúhabit energy.‚ÄùüîΩThe active forms of consciousness, which are of a different type than the consciousness that is the result of maturation, are produced from the consciousness that is the result of maturation, which is perfumed by them.

original: 'byung bar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: They are definitely to be accepted as arising in a different form, such as virtuous or nonvirtuous, depending on the object.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa gzhan yin par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa gzhan yin par grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the fruitional consciousness is different from the active consciousnesses, and that it contains the seeds of all conditioned factors.

original: chad nas 'byung ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: chad nas 'byung ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The store consciousness should be understood as different from the active forms of consciousness because it occurs in a series, because it is the cause of rebirth, and because it is the cause of the arising of the active forms of consciousness.

original: sems med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun chad pa las yang sems med pa'i nyid kyis log pa dang / brgyal ba las sangs pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun chad pa las yang sems med pa'i nyid kyis log pa dang / brgyal ba las sangs pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: When a person is unconscious, either in a deep sleep or in a faint, the active forms of consciousness are interrupted. If the store consciousness did not exist, then the active forms of consciousness would occur without a cause when a person awakens from sleep or regains consciousness.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang 'dra bar 'dir yang dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang 'dra bar 'dir yang dpyad par bya'o //
translated: This should be investigated in the same way as the arising of the mind when one comes out of the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyu las byung ba'i 'khor bar 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yod pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan yin par shes so //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyu las byung ba'i 'khor bar 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yod pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan yin par shes so //
translated: Because of entering and turning away from cyclic existence.

original: skad cig kyang mi gnas par ris mthun pa rgyun mi 'chad ba'i rgyun gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po 'byung ba ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig kyang mi gnas par ris mthun pa rgyun mi 'chad ba'i rgyun gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po 'byung ba ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The stream of the appropriated aggregates, which is not interrupted even for a moment, is called ‚Äúcyclic existence.‚Äù

original: de'i 'jug pa ni ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa ni ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: Its entry is the connection to another homogeneous collection.

original: ldog pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: ldog pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Its turning away is the realm of nirvana, with and without remainder.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na 'du byed kyi rgyu rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na 'du byed kyi rgyu rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug bar mi rung ngo //
translated: If one does not accept the store consciousness, then because there is no consciousness that is the condition for the arising of the formations, it is not possible to enter cyclic existence.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na /üîΩ'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'am /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'am /
translated: If you do not accept the foundation consciousness,üîΩthen you must explain the statement ‚Äúconsciousness has formations as its condition‚Äù as referring to the consciousness that links to rebirth

original: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung bar brtag grang na /üîΩde'i tshe nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe snga ma la bsags pa'i 'du byed @237a * //
analyzed: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung bar brtag grang na / de'i tshe nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe snga ma la bsags pa'i 'du byed @237a * //
translated: or as referring to the six collections of consciousness that are infused by formations.

original: kyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: In the first case, the consciousness that links to rebirth does not arise from the condition of formations that were accumulated in a previous life

original: tshe snga ma la bsags pa'i 'du byed ni 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe snga ma la bsags pa'i 'du byed ni 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the formations that were accumulated in a previous life have long since ceased.

original: 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has ceased does not exist.

original: med pa ni rkyen du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni rkyen du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not exist cannot be a condition.

original: gal te 'gags pa rkyen du mi 'dod na de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te 'gags pa rkyen du mi 'dod na de ltar na /
translated: If you do not accept that which has ceased as a condition,

original: da ltar gyi las las ni rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub pa las kyi 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi las las ni rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub pa las kyi 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the result of karma would not be established from present karma, and karma would be without result.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: de las byung ba'i bsgos pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i bsgos pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latent impressions that arise from it remain.

original: gang las 'gyur ba bye brag tu gyur nas rnam par smin pa 'grub pa'i bag chags las kyis bskyed pa sems kyi rgyud la yod do //
analyzed: gang las 'gyur ba bye brag tu gyur nas rnam par smin pa 'grub pa'i bag chags las kyis bskyed pa sems kyi rgyud la yod do //
translated: The latent impressions generated by karma exist in the mind-stream, and from them, after a transformation into a different state, the evolution of the result occurs.

original: de lta bas na las kyi 'bras bu med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na las kyi 'bras bu med pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, karma is not without a result.

original: las 'gags pa las rnam par smin pa 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: las 'gags pa las rnam par smin pa 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor does the evolution of the result occur from a ceased karma.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ni ming dang gzugs kyi yin te /üîΩrnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ni ming dang gzugs kyi yin te / rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na /
translated: At the time of rebirth, it is name-and-form, not just consciousness.

original: de la rnam par shes pa nyid 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung gi / ming dang gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa nyid 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung gi / ming dang gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
translated: What is the logic in saying that consciousness alone arises with the formations as its condition, and not name-and-form?

original: de lta bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes brjod par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, it should be said that name-and-form has the formations as its condition,

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: and not just consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba gzhan gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba gzhan gang zhe na /
translated: What is the other called name-and-form that is conditioned by consciousness?

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig las dus phyi ma gang yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig las dus phyi ma gang yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is whatever occurs later than the moment of rebirth-linking.

original: de nying mtshams sbyor ba'i ming dang gzugs las rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod na /
analyzed: de nying mtshams sbyor ba'i ming dang gzugs las rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod na /
translated: What is the difference in nature between that and the name-and-form of rebirth-linking?

original: 'di ltar de nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yin la /
translated: Name-and-form that occurs later is conditioned by consciousness,

original: snga ma ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba yin la /
translated: but that of the prior moment is conditioned by karmic forces.

original: phyi ma ni ma yin te de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyi ma ni ma yin te de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: The latter is not conditioned by karmic forces, so name-and-form is conditioned by karmic forces.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes ba'i yan lag gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes ba'i yan lag gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of positing a separate link of consciousness at rebirth?

original: de lta bas na nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness at rebirth is not suitable as conditioned by karmic forces.

original: 'du byed rnams ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yin la des bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba dang / de'i rkyen gyis byung ba nying mtshams sbyor ba ni ming dang gzugs nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba yin la des bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba dang / de'i rkyen gyis byung ba nying mtshams sbyor ba ni ming dang gzugs nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: The link of the arising of that condition is name and form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'du byed kyis @237b yongs su bsgos pa dag 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di yang sbyar ma legs pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'du byed kyis @237b yongs su bsgos pa dag 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di yang sbyar ma legs pa nyid de /
translated: The position that the sixfold collection of consciousness, imbued with formations, is consciousness due to the condition of formations is also not well formulated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags bdag la skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags bdag la skyed par mi nus te /
translated: Consciousness is not able to generate the seeds of karmic maturation and the seeds of natural outflow in the self,

original: bdag la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for it to act on itself.

original: de ma theg pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma theg pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not in that which has not yet arisen,

original: de ni de'i tshe ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not yet exist at that time.

original: ma byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not yet exist is nonexistent.

original: byung ba la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byung ba la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from the past,

original: de ni de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the past has already ceased.

original: sems med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa la sogs pa'i dus na ni 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems med pa'i gnyid kyis log pa la sogs pa'i dus na ni 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is unconscious, such as when one is asleep, it is impossible for the mind to arise, since it is permeated by karmic formations. Therefore, name-and-form would not occur due to consciousness.

original: de med par skye mched drug kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par skye mched drug kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without that, the six sense bases would not occur.

original: de bzhin du rga shi'i bar du yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rga shi'i bar du yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, up to old age and death would not occur.

original: de'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug pa nyid dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug pa nyid dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, the very entry into cyclic existence would be contradicted.

original: 'khor ba las ldog pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'khor ba las ldog pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, the cessation of cyclic existence is not tenable without the foundation consciousness.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The causes of cyclic existence are karma and the afflictions.

original: de gnyis las kyang nyon mongs pa ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang nyon mongs pa ni gtso bo ste /
translated: And among those two, the afflictions are the principal cause.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis na las kyis yang srid pa 'phen nus par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis na las kyis yang srid pa 'phen nus par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is due to the power of the afflictions that karma is able to impel rebirth, but not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir bden pa mthong ba rnams kyi las las yang srid pa mi 'phen te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa mthong ba rnams kyi las las yang srid pa mi 'phen te /
translated: Therefore, those who have seen the truth do not project a new existence from karma.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de bzhin du yang srid pa 'phangs pa'i las kyang nyon mongs pa med na yang srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang srid pa 'phangs pa'i las kyang nyon mongs pa med na yang srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, karma that projects a new existence does not produce a new existence if it is not associated with the afflictions.

original: 'di ltar khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi yang srid pa 'phangs pa'i las kyang nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir yang srid pa 'byung bar byed mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi yang srid pa 'phangs pa'i las kyang nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir yang srid pa 'byung bar byed mi nus so //
translated: Thus, even the karma of those who are free from attachment to the three realms and that projects a new existence cannot produce a new existence because it is not associated with the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi yang srid pa mngon par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi yang srid pa mngon par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, a new existence is not actualized for them.

original: de ltar na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa nyid 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa nyid 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Thus, because they are the principal cause, the afflictions are the root of the process of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir de dag spangs na 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag spangs na 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who abandons them turns away from cyclic existence, but not otherwise.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par de dag spang du mi rung ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par de dag spang du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible to abandon them without a foundation consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa'am /
translated: If you ask whether afflictions are abandoned when they are manifest

original: sa bon gyi tshe spang grang na /
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshe spang grang na /
translated: or when they are seeds,

original: de la mngon du gyur pa spang ngo zhe na ni /
analyzed: de la mngon du gyur pa spang ngo zhe na ni /
translated: if you say that they are abandoned when they are manifest,

original: de mi 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de mi 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: that is unacceptable,

original: @238a * // de'i tshe de dag spong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @238a * // de'i tshe de dag spong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time there is no path for abandoning them.

original: sa bon gyi tshe yang spang du mi rung ste /
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshe yang spang du mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that they are abandoned when they are seeds,

original: gang la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gnas pa de gnyen pos spong na /
analyzed: gang la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gnas pa de gnyen pos spong na /
translated: because if the seeds of the afflictions were abandoned by an antidote,

original: de'i tshe ni gnyen po las ci yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gnyen po las ci yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: at that time, since you do not accept any antidote at all,

original: ji ste gnyen po'i sems nyid nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'dres na ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'dres pa nyid pas gnyen por mi rung ste /
analyzed: ji ste gnyen po'i sems nyid nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'dres na ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'dres pa nyid pas gnyen por mi rung ste /
translated: if the mind that is the antidote were mixed with the seeds of the afflictions, it would not be tenable as an antidote because it would be mixed with the seeds of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma spangs pa rnams ni 'khor ba las ldog mi srid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma spangs pa rnams ni 'khor ba las ldog mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to turn away from cyclic existence without abandoning the seeds of the afflictions.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang gi sa bon gso bar bya ba'i phyir bag chags bsgo bar khas blangs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang gi sa bon gso bar bya ba'i phyir bag chags bsgo bar khas blangs so //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that the foundation consciousness is perfumed by the other consciousnesses and by the root and secondary mental afflictions that occur with them, so that the seeds of those phenomena are nourished.

original: rgyun 'gyur ba'i bye brag gi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du bsgos pa 'jug pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: rgyun 'gyur ba'i bye brag gi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du bsgos pa 'jug pa rnyed nas /
translated: The perfuming occurs when the foundation consciousness is in a state of equilibrium, and the perfuming is in proportion to the strength of the transformation of the continuum.
